description:
I just love this place and they have continuously delivered top quality food and service to me for over 20 years. The history of the building and the decor are awesome. I reserved the Wind Hold for a party of eight Saturday night October 6th. Four of the people in my group had never been there before and just loved the place. I ordered the Fruits De Mer which they made up special for the table and they loved it. The smoked muscles were terrific.

Fantastic seafood every time.
author: Micki F.

description:
I'm about 93% certain that the girl I was visually perceiving broke up with me because she will sempiternally associate me with burnt and extravagantly charred octopus. But part of me cerebrates it could have been because I took so long to get ready.

A short romantic getaway to San Francisco turned into a tragic novel. I wanted to take her to a memorable dinner. Goal achieved. After spending an inordinate amount of time researching romantic restaurants I conclusively made a calculated risk and culled this well reviewed establishment. I made a deplorable cull. 

Tactfully authoritatively mandated a bottle of Qupe Syrah and was brought a bottle of Krug Champagne. Our precious time was wasted as I wanted to seduce her shortly after this repast and commence a night full of zealousness and smooth jazz.  Erroneous.

Commenced with the shrimp cocktail. Prawns were astronomically immense and chilled as expected. She gave me the last one on the plate which told me that so far things were going well. I optate I could have prehended this moment because the turning point was expeditiously approaching. 

We then injuctively authorized the Octopus appetizer which tasted as though I was licking a BBQ that had not been cleaned and accumulated years of salty burnt charcoal. There was additionally a minuscule filet of fish to the side which was cooked medium rare. Why? I haven't the slightest conception. Erroneous.

Short Ribs were our next excursion. I can't explicate the taste because I was diligently asking myself why this course was marked with a steak knife. The taste we experienced perpetuated to be a component of both our breathes the rest of the evening and into the morning. I stared off into the distance and found a painting of a jellyfish to divert me so I wouldn't ask her how everything was. Additionally, spaghetti squash. I'm skeptical. It came with swiss chard too right? It was like a bundle of spinach mated with an arugula plant then proceeded to bathe in the excess juice from canned corn. Again, I do not know.

The coffee was good and so was the bus boy.  

Let it be known that there was no seduction, no zealousness, no congenial breathe, just inelegant silence the rest of the evening. I held in my emotions until I flew back to Los Angeles and entered my habitation. I immediately ambulated into my restroom, divested, turned the shower on and spent a good portion of my evening crying while sitting down in the bath tub.

I am now single but optimistic about what the future brings. These events inspired me to commence a 5 year plan in order to monetarily increase my value as a human being. Also never trust CitiBank with your money, they are a bunch of willy nilly clowns. 

If any half asian women are reading this please feel in liberty to drop off an application, I am currently not looking to hire but will ecstatically prehend a head shot and resume for future reference.
author: Tim A.

description:
Came with a friend to try out their happy hour in their Jellyfish Lounge! It's offered daily from 4:30 to 6 pm and includes a selection of food and drinks at either $5 or $7.

I arrived a little after 5 pm and the lounge was pretty empty. There were a couple parties there but I was able to snag a spot pretty easily. It never got full over the course of the 2 hours we were there.

The decor is done beautifully here. As a primarily seafood spot, Farallon goes all out to add touches of marine life everywhere. I particularly enjoyed the jellyfish lights and the columns designed to invoke the image of marine plants.

For drinks, I had their classic margarita and the Hemingway daiquiri ($7 each). Both drinks were okay, but my daiquiri was way too sour compared to my friend's which was much sweeter. I had to send it back to the bar to have them fix it. I was a little bit disappointed that the same drink could taste so different when made at the same bar.

For food, we split the fish 'n' chips ($7) and also a dozen oysters ($14). The fish and chips only comes with one small piece, which was a little disappointing but reasonable given the price point. I forgot to ask where the happy oysters were from, but they were small and briny. Not my favorite type of oysters, but hey oysters are oysters. I still enjoyed them.

It was pretty quiet in the lounge, which made it easier for my friend and I to chat as we slowly sipped and ate our way through everything. I appreciated that the servers respected our space and didn't try to rush us at all.
author: Dianna H.

description:
Awesome dinner spot! Bf and I stopped by on a random Sunday night and managed to get a last minute reservation an hour prior. 

I will say the interior is very interesting - like an upscale version of a Little Mermaid-themed restaurant lol.

On to the food... everything was shockingly good. Maybe I had low expectations coming in, but I was taken aback at every dish. Oysters were fresh and creamy, a nice contrast to the tangy champagne mignonette. The abalone chowder was ADDICTING. Bonus points if you save some bread to eat with it. Lobster was very simple yet tender - falling off the shell. Sole was flavorful and cooked perfectly... flaky and juicy on top of these AWESOME cranberry beans. Plus, their Snickerdoodle pudding dessert is to die for. I don't really care for sweets but this was an exception.
author: Caroline K.

description:
Wow! Finding a place to have dinner on a Friday night in SF is so hard! So here comes yelp to the rescue! Ended up picking this place because concierge was able to get me a reservation and the picts of the interior looked so cool!

Here the reviews:

-Ambience: super nice and cool inside! 

-Service: it was just good.

-Food:

-Amuse-buche ($17)
Usually this ones a restaurant curtesy but then i saw i got charged for it in my bill...

-Gazpacho ($25)
Pretty good! Not everyone cares  for cold soup but i loved it!

-Scallop crudo ($17)
Its good but definitely had better ones.

-Lobster with uni garlic pasta ($85)
Not in the menu, it was good but a little bit too dry, not worth the $85

-Fish specials ($38)
Pretty good! I like the crispy skin!

-panna cotta ($11)
Refreshing! I like that it wasnt too sweet

Overall it was a 3.5 stars but since i feel generous i will round it up to 4.

Next SF visit i may skip it...
author: Elizabeth L.

description:
Went here years ago and it seemed so elegant at the time. Interior is the same so I guess it just hasn't kept up with the competitor. Menu items were limited. Only two fish choices for a seafood restaurant. I went with the sole which had muscles. I don't care for muscles and asked for a substitution and all they could give me was more beans under the base of the fish. Gnocchi appetizer was tasty - a bit too salty.  White peach sorbet was smooth and spot on with its flavor. 

There are so many restaurants in SF that I will not be returning here again.
author: Rob N.

description: Great place, the ambience is stunning!!  Excellent place for business or pleasure.  You have to try the caviar
author: Marcus S.

description:
Super fresh seafood, but definitely on the pricey side. $$$$. Service was excellent. The decor made me feel like I'm under the sea. A scene in the movies for a bougie little mermaid comes to mind. 

Ordered the infamous Fruits de Mer upgraded to 1.5x portion to serve 3. Added half lobster, half dozen Kumamotos, and half dozen Tamales Bay. Would forego the half lobster (tiny) next time at the price of $42.50, but to be honest, we got that one for the photo. 

Ordered a few cold and warm appetizers. Very non-traditional is how I can explain them. Escargot wasn't in shell but was accompanied by pasta. Bone marrow wasn't in bone but was fried to crisp. Loved the fried shallots (?) on top of the scallops. Two different textures for the foie gras spread.

Received a complimentary chocolate dessert for our lovely girl's birthday along with a delicious cheesecake we ordered. Wonderful experience with wonderful company.
author: Tina S.

description:
Erg unassuming place from the outside, but inside you feel are transported to Atlantis. The decor is very intricate and unique providing a deep aquatic experience from the front door. The servers were friendly and prompt. The food was very good and eclectic. The only knock was that the menu is not super expansive, so we decided to have 2 appetizers a piece. The ribeye was remarkable and the dungenesss crab was extremely fresh. We all left full, but do not go in too hungry because you will wind up ordering more food than necessary, driving up the bill. 
A very pleasurable and worthwhile experience with a good looking crowd. Bring your business associates or a sexy date for a great ti
author: Damon G.

description: Great place for Happy Hour appetizers and drinks!!  Went here before our Phantom of the Opera evening show.  Drinks are much cheaper, great atmosphere, friendly service and the food is delicious!!
author: Diane L.

description:
This is probably my 4th time back. Every time I'm in SF, I have to try to make it here and it always satisfies me. 

The food is beautifully presented with good texture and taste. Never too salty for me. It is delightful to dine in this underwater motif restaurant. Manager and servers were all professional, knowledgeable about what they are serving and very nice people. 

The Riesling recommendation hit the spot tonight. The oysters sampler can't be any fresher. 

The two fish dishes were different and yet both were wonderfully prepared. I have not been disappointed by Farallon yet. 

This is also a no rush place. Take your time to enjoy the different dishes. Don't rush through your meal. Appreciate the surrounding. It is not going to be cheap but it is worth the experience and to be delighted by the sight and taste of their dishes. 

The sorbet trio we had tonight was guava with strawberries, banana with pecans and passion fruit with baked coconut.  Only the passion fruit was left on the plate as it was way too sour for us. A little sweeter would be perfect. 

Well done Farallon. Can't wait for my return visit.
author: Khiang S.

description:
Farallon is a great place for seafood. Brody attended to us and made all the right recommendations. 

We had the Crab chowder, Lobster, Caesar Salad, among others. All good! We also liked the Mosca to which was recommended by their sommelier.
author: Benjamin S.

description:
This is easily one of the coolest restaurants in SF. The food, service and atmosphere was impeccable from start to finish. My mom and I sat at the Oyster Bar in the Jellyfish Lounge while we waited for our table to get set up and had a drink to start. The decor of the bar and the jellyfish light fixtures made you feel as if you were under the sea, but not in a hokey, little mermaid type way. It felt authentic and genuine and every detail was perfect. The oysters were delicious and they had a great variety. My favorite was the Olympia from Washington (small, huge flavor) and my mom's was the wellfleet from Cape Cod. We also shared the Dungeness Crab Louie, so good! 

At dinner we had the best seat in the house, overlooking the whole restaurant. The octopus chandeliers, the mosaic tiles on the ceiling, down to the handrails that looked like octopus tentacles, it is a feast for the eyes! Everywhere you looked there was some amazing detail to catch. The chowder was one of my favorites, creamy and flavorful. The ceviche was so flavorful and fresh. The tuna perfectly cooked. Finished with the butterscotch dessert, one of the best meals I've had in a long time!
author: Meghan G.

description:
We visited Farallon, which was attached to our hotel, the Kensington Park Hotel, when we visited SF in May 2017.  We found it on a "Best Restaurants of SF" list and it was also conveniently just 200 feet away, so we figured we'd try it out!  We were not disappointed.  The restaurant is quite classy and serves up some awesome seafood.  Service was good throughout and we ordered the following dishes:

-Fruits de Mer (oysters and clams, maine lobster claws, dungeness crab, and prawns)
-Oysters on the half shell (just 7 of them, but we loved those dipping sauces they came with)
-Olive Oil Poached Tombo Tuna (Maine Lobster).  So delicious!  We split this dish because we weren't super duper hungry.

Overall, great experience.  The portions were a bit small given the price point, but we enjoyed it nevertheless!  Would return again.
author: Pegah Y.

description:
This is what I like to call old world San Francisco. I think it's prime was 10 years ago. The hype of the jellyfish room was more than was delivered.

3/5 oysters not too keen on their vinegar sauce 

5/5 angus burger very flavorful meat and no 
gimmicks with sauces, really executed the meat flavor well. 

5/5 cheese platter done very nicely, orange marmalade  along with the rind wrapped up 

3/5 ceviche nice flavors, jalapeños had some kick to it and large crunchy chip for serving
author: Morgan S.

description:
Beautiful restaurant..

If you're looking for an elegant night out and a beautiful restaurant located directly downtown..

This is not your typical restaurant. They have a good assortment of choices from the menu that will tantalize and test your pallet...They carry a very nice assortment of unique dishes..

If you're in the mood for something different this is a place you might like to try..
author: Head Chef F.

description:
Well. Very disappointing took my friend for her birthday. They gave us nice table on the top floor, although the prettiest part of the dining room was far away. Food started off good. Oysters delicious. But our server was pretentious and condescending from outset. Kept trying to upsell us on to get highest priced wines and food items. And was pushy and not trying to make it a special experience by saying that we needed to decide what we wanted all at once because he was very busy (!). Busboy was gracious and attentive. And to top it off, I told waiter about my serious (deadly!) allergy to cashews and pistachios and he actually served cheese that we ordered at end with cashews all over the plate!!
When I called him on it, he was snooty and the presumably manager tried to rectify by bringing us an additional cheese plate . Honestly, for the cost of the meal, it was entirely over-rated. There are so many great restaurants in the city who actually care about food & customers service. This is not one of them.
author: Victoria Z.

description:
Farallon was a very unique experience. When you first walk in you are immediately casted into a theater set. The decor is that of a deep see adventure, combined jelly fish inspired ceilings and toward the latter half of the restaurant a sunken 17th century Spanish naval ship. In between, tastefully gaudy frames hang from the walls - depicted characters from the depths of the designers imagination. 

The food - I am a vegetarian. So initially I was expected to fill up on wine. But, to my surprise the chef was prepared with a series of seasonal plates that consisted of pure delight. 

The Summer Tomato Salad.... literal bliss. The freshest tomato medley I've ever had mixed with warm smokey lentils and a sweet/spicy horseradish dressing. I wanted seconds. 

Seasonal Veggie Plate - I couldn't even begin describe what I was eating. Just check out the picture. Stellar surprise. 

Wine was delicious but definitely on the expensive side. 

Great service. Dope ambience. Great food. Enjoy!
author: Chris W.

description:
I have wanted to go here for a really long time. It is my friend's favorite restaurant so we met for drinks last night. I don't eat fish and I am vegan so I thought we would grab a bite elsewhere. My friend told them I was vegan and they talked to the chef and made this amazing veggie extravaganza with puréed spinach on the bottom! This is one of the best dishes I have ever had! It was so delicious. The chef even came out and explained what he created.
     I loved the ambiance and everyone was so nice and friendly. Thank you so much to everyone at Farallon last night. You made my night exceptional!
author: Erica S.

description:
I heard Farallon's been around for about 15 years. How they managed to stay put for that long with such expensive prices amazes me because the food we had was definitely not worth it.

My friends started off with the Fruits de Mer. 1 lobster tail, 1 oyster, 1 clam, 1 prawn, and a heap of shredded dungeness crab (to share among 3 people) = $69!?!?!!? How??? Why??? I don't understand. For $69, I expect to be eating an entire lobster or a steak.

The Dungeness Crab Chowder I ordered was lukewarm...

For my main entree, I got the Cast Iron Seared Sablefish. It came with tiny veggies but the only edible part of the dish was the small piece of fish. Just a drizzle of bearnaise suace. Needless to say, it wasn't enough for me.

Boyfriend also thought the Prime Filet of Beef wasn't worth it. I heard the Dungeness Crab with Pork Belly was better though.

When the birthday girl walks out of the restaurant craving fries from the bar around the corner, I'd say it's not worth it. Honestly, I think the best part of the entire dinner was the birthday meringues we received in the end...

Maybe I'm just not made for the fancy expensive dainty life.
author: Athena C.

description:
Was not impressed with this place. All the servers were great and very attentive, but I think the restaurant lacks on executing a nice plate of food. 
We were seated right away upon arrival and the server took our drink orders. Loved the limited choices in the menu because it means less decision on my end. GREAT!
We started with the tomato salad and a melon and lobster salad. The tomato salad was great. I just think that anything with fresh tomatoes is amazing. The lobster was quite fresh, but the melons were cup pretty small, so I the taste didn't stand out very much.
The real problem I found were the entrees. We 5/6 of the dishes:

1. White Bass: the fish was soooo overcooked and dry that it was not memorable at all. I only tried the fish, so i can't speak for the other items on the menu. 
2. I didn't try the steak, but it looked very well cooked - medium.
3. Scallop dish: the actual scallops were very fresh and nicely looked, but the dish was soooo salty!
4. Seared Tuna: on the contrary to the scallops, the tuna was very bland. I have definitely had better tuna at other places. 
5. and finally the duck. It's very ironic that the duck dish was the best one we had in a a seafood restaurant. although it was also a bit salty, i enjoyed the duck very much.

Overall, I had a good time having dinner with my family here because the staff was great and everything was very fresh! however, given the price tag and the flavor on the dishes, I think I'll pass.
author: Anna Y.

description:
Farallon was once a rather good place that is now long on style and short on food experience. 

It was much easier to get a last minute reservation than before, which should have been clue #1.

The service was good, the wine selection was good and the appraisers were much beret than the main course selections. All three main dishes ordered were bland and lacking in flavor and presentation. 

In a City with so many really good options, I wouldn't recommend Farallon as your choice for dining in the City by the Bay.
author: Millard M.

description:
Place reminded me of Gaudi's architecture in Barcelona. Undulating curves and trippy jelly-fish lamps transport you someplace else. 
Great place to impress your date.
author: Sharad R.

description:
When I called to make my reservation, I requested a "Romantic table" over the phone for my 6th year Anniversary. Once we got there, we were seated at a tiny claustrophobic table with my elbow hitting the wall... I was furious and told the mannager, he quickly moved us to a much bigger table in the center of the restaurant as I had originally imagined. 

The ambiance is incredible & by far one of the best places I have ever been too and was the deciding factor that made me choose this place. It's beautiful and over the top. Worth taking a mini tour after dinner before you leave. Very romantic!!

Food was good except for the "Ravioli & lobster" dish. The tiny piece of lobster was delicious, but the ravioli was unbearable & drenched in salt! Of course they took that plate off our bill. Overall it was a great experience and a wonderful way to spend our anniversary dinner. 

My advice to Farallon is, be a little more meticulous with your customers request & have a better communication between your staff members. I understand mistakes happen, but that "extremely salty Ravioli" plate was very embarrassing for such a high end restaurant.
author: Yuriy T.

description: A definite YES to Farallon. Service is a top notch, food is Amazing. I loved every single course here. Highly recommend. I've been here couple times in the past, they never fail. Thank you for great experience!
author: Betsy E.

description:
OMG.

I was a bit a skeptical as it is fairly close to tourist central - but the decor, service and food were all 5 star. 

It was arguably the best seafood my husband and I have ever had  (which is a high bar for us since we lived most all of our lives in Seattle) - and phenomenal wines!
author: Cheryl S.

description:
Tasty food, tiny portions, extremely high prices.

The decor was interesting, kinda under the sea themed, and ancient nautical themed as well. The service was good, but not great.

To drink I had the barrel-aged negroni which was good, but not great and not worth the price (this will be a theme of this review...). With dessert I had the ice wine, which was very tasty, but a very small poor for twice the price of a "normal" after dinner drink.

For food, I started with the 4 oyster sampler and while they were all tasty (not chewy or gritty and very flavorful), the price was 2-4 times more than most oyster houses in SF. My main was the scallop dish which had pretty big, very tasty scallops with a unique and flavorful sauce, and a few tiny vegetables on the side. However, there were only 3 scallops, and I just can't justify paying double-digits per scallop. For dessert I got the burnt sugar pot de creme with cocoa nibs and hazelnuts and all of it was flavorful and fresh and actually a reasonably-sized portion, so that was probably the best thing I had.

I'm glad I tried it once but I have no desire to return. There are plenty of places in SF with nearly as good or as good seafood and desserts and drinks for 1/2 to 75% of the price.
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
Another famous SF spot off the bucket list.  I've been been to come here for ages, but for whatever reason, it never happened.  Well, that finally changed yesterday. 

Made reservations and we were promptly seated.  The layout of this place is really posh and quite creative.  Has a themed presence that is undeniable.  Service was quick and done with a giant smile.  Everything was fast and efficient, and they were very courteous throughout the entire experience. The food? The portions were much larger than I would have imagined, and the filet mignon was amazing.  Didn't expect such an amazing steak from a seafood spot. 

Easily, one of the best restaurants in SF, and I've been to a few.  Overall, loved this place!
author: Benny H.

description: Beautiful and unique place. Excellent service and delicious food. I highly recommend to dine at this restaurant if you are in San Francisco.
author: Diana P.

description: Horrible service l! Server never comes around! We asked other waiters to send over our server, we asked another waiter or menu, very nice server with zero customer service
author: Mary G.

description:
This restaurant has a nice decor and service, great for business meetings, ie taking clients out for dinner etc.

Food is decent but nothing that really spells out as "extraordinary". 

We ordered a chilled whole lobster and the portion of it was a little underwhelming. However, the Kumamoto oysters were very delicious and fresh. Highly recommended. 

As we are walking out the restaurant, I do not get the feeling that I am dying to come back soon for another meal. Let's just say that. 

4 stars for its service, decor, and decent food.
author: William Qi D.

description:
I made a reservation and was alerted that they have a 24 hour cancellation policy. The guests we were going to host for this dinner cancelled so I cancelled 12 hours before. Not aware but others should be that there is a charge of   $20 per person if you cancel without 24 hour notice. I was kind enough to call which I'm sure many don't. The charge seems to be high for cancelling and letting them know.
Lovely restaurant, but this policy will cause me to choose other restaurants to dine at.
author: Tina M.

description:
All though the atmosphere is slightly dim and the underwater, the seafood here is fresh. I went here with a few friends and were greeted with smiles and quick service. The waiters are a bit absent at this location but not in a rude way. The place is quite large and dim, so I can understand why waiters would not be able to see if you are finished your food or require another drink.

I had the oysters and built my own tray of sea food, i will say that the amount of lobster that I had compared to the price was acceptable, it wasn't a lot of food but the freshness is the main reason why I come here for my sea food
author: Tony G.

description: My husband and I went to Farallon last Saturday night for our 15th wedding anniversary dinner.  They knew it was our anniversary and gave us a Thank you note at our table for dining at Farallon and gave us a beautiful and delicious dessert on the house! Our meal was amazing, our server was very knowledgeable about the menu and the sommelier helped pick out the perfect wine for our meals and was such a nice person! Farallon is a beautiful place to dine with amazing seafood and we'll be back!
author: Laura A.

description:
Oh Farallon...I wanted to, and quite frankly, after reading the Yelp reviews, expected to fall in love.  Sadly, this is a hard pass for me.  Perhaps we came on an off night...I'm not quite sure.  
We arrived about 45 mins to one hour before our reservation to sit at the bar and enjoy some cocktails before dinner.  We checked in with the host to let them know we had arrived and sat down.  Our waiter came to take our drink orders and didn't return with our cocktails for about 15 mins.  This seemed to be a bit longer than one would have expected...the service at the restaurant, from bar to table, was definitely slower than we would have liked.  There was quite a bit of time between courses and as a result, our entire dinner took nearly 4 hrs! Not to mention, we arrived early for our reservation, yet our table was not ready for about 10 mins after our reservation time.
Onto the food:
We ordered the cheese plate while we had our cocktails...we sampled all 5 cheeses and 3 of them had almost zero flavor.  The cheese choices were very underwhelming, which was disappointing considering we paid $25 for it.  This was also the case for the cocktails.  We ordered the blackberry cocktail which was supposed to be their specialty, and it tasted like watered down mezcal.  The blackberry color was there, but it had very little flavor.  We also ordered the Sidecar and that too had an off flavor...VERY tart and almost undrinkable.  We had hoped dinner would be a better experience.
When we were finally seated at our dinner table, we ordered the Oyster flight to start(2 to be exact, since only 6 come in 1 flight at $21 a pop).  There were 3 different types of oysters...2 of which were terrible, literally tasted like dirt.  In addition, they were not shucked properly and had a ton of tiny shell pieces in them.
We also ordered the foie gras mousse as an app which was delicious, but was literally about a tablespoon size on the plate, if that, and it was $29!  
Next, was dinner...two of us ordered the salmon dish, both of which were not fully cooked.  One of the pieces was actually completely raw and mine was not cooked on the side that was opposite the seared side.  We sent it back to ask for them to be cooked a bit more and the wait staff graciously did so.  When they came back, they were cooked perfectly.   I also felt that the flavor choices featured on the plates were a bit strange and didn't really mesh together.  With the salmon, they had red and golden beets with some sort of grain, perhaps barley?  I don't know...none of it seemed to make sense together and $49?  Completely overpriced.
For dessert, we had the lemon verbena creme brulee...now this was interesting.  It was flavorful and creamy, but the flavor was strange.  It didn't taste like natural flavors, it actually tasted like fruity children's cereal-think Fruity Pebbles or Trix.  It was a very artificial tasting flavor.  Not bad...just not what I expected. 
I didn't dislike this restaurant, but nothing was remarkable or something I would choose to come back to order, especially for the price.  For the amount we paid for a dinner for 4 people, we could have gone back to Gary Danko's and had an outstanding meal instead.  I say save your money and go somewhere else for a great seafood dinner.
author: Merri P.

description:
Super Overpriced restaurant with Super Mediocre dishes. A touristy restaurant. If you love seafood, this is not the right place to go because their fresh seafood quality is below average and all their cooked dishes are bland and lack originality. 

In addition, the service was also really mediocre. Most of the time, we can't even find our waiter. When I asked the other waiter to bring us some water, he said:"I don't serve your table, you have your own waiter." WTF??? Are you serious?

This is probably one of the worst restaurants I have been to in sf. It's not worth your money and time. There are so many other better places in sf. I felt embarrassed for bringing my family here.
author: Clare L.

description:
Walking into Farallon is like walking into an aquarium. The jellyfish chandeliers hang above, the ocean-themed murals surround you, and the sloping, deep-colored ceilings make you feel like you're in an aquarium! The "booth" we sat at was even reminiscent of a clamshell, making us feel like characters in the Little Mermaid as we dined.

We started with a chilled seafood platter "fruits de mer," which came with creamy oysters with a champagne sauce, juicy claws of fresh lobster, grilled and chilled shrimp with cocktail sauce, juicy raw clams, and crab with a honey mustard aioli. Our server explained that the seafood here never sees the tank, and the lobsters are flown in live! Amazing!

We continued with the melon/lobster/burrata salad, which had an interesting contrast of sweet, tart, and creamy. The grilled local squid was filled with a rice-based stuffing and served over beans, and one of my favorite appetizers was the gnocchi and oyster--the gnocchi were pillowy and tender, and they made for an interesting pairing with the cooked oysters, the creamy sauce, the caviar, and the shreds of fried potato skin on top!

For our mains, we had the perfectly grilled scallops with chanterelles, served over a bean puree. We also had the local sablefish (cod), which came with beautifully crispy skin, fava beans, and sliced potatoes, but the entree I liked the best was the duck breast. It was cooked to medium rare, sliced, and served with bing cherries (what a seasonal ingredient!), tender turnips, hericot verts, and a delicious duck jus, which simply brought the entire dish together. Though some of the duck slices were a little bit tough, overall, the flavors of this dish just worked so well together!

And then came dessert--we opted for the light strawberry-rhubarb pavlova, which came with a creamy center, macerated strawberries, and was topped little dollops of meringue. A great finish to the meal! We really got the full experience at Farallon. Overall, the food is a little bit on the pricey side and is not the absolute best seafood I've had in the Bay Area, but this is the place to come for great wines, friendly, knowledgeable service, and a beautiful atmosphere.
author: David K.

description: This review is for the Happy Hour. Luckily, Farallon is super close to my office -- so, I took my sister here, when she was visiting. I was truly blown away by the prices and the service. While there are numerous places in the city with awesome Happy Hour oysters, I was definitely impressed by Farallon. Also, the decor is stunning! There's really no other restaurant like this when it comes to the interior design and decor.
author: Meesh L.

description:
By far the best seafood places I've ever been to in my life. Haven just come back from Maui and eating at all the restaurants there, now I know this is a gem in SF. 

Food flavor: 5/5
Food quantity: 5/5
author: Dale L.

description:
Your standard tourist American cuisine and restaurant with under the sea decor. Really like the interior. My friends booked it and happy with the choice because it is a SF staple, plus I was here to celebrate my actual birthday. 

I did like my meal but I felt it was over price. The dinner that day was more expensive than most of the Michelin's Star I went during my birthday month. 

I got their sea bass and it was good, lots of flavor but no wow factor. We got the Prosciutto Salad and Soft Shell Carbs as starters. They were all good but average. My friend got the Ribeye and he said it was good but he can get better for $50. Over I like my meal and service but it wasn't anything amazing.
author: Sandy B.

description: My review is based solely on the desert. I tried the pecan praline cheesecake it was SCRUMPTIOUS. i will return for happy hour and oysters on the half shell!!!
author: Michelle F.

description: I want to make it clear in this review, that it is specifically about the food and not about the service. Our waiter and the management team did everything they could to try to make the experience better, but the dishes were either so salty it was inedible or on the other extreme had almost no flavor.
author: Wayne T.

description:
I went to farallon for dinner last night.  Let me break it down.

Bar=5 stars-drinks tasty-blood Orange margarita

Bartender=5 stars

Host/hostess=5 stars

Restaurant Decor=5 stars very beautiful

Now tha bad part:

Wait Staff= needs improvement- got my order wrong and did not like that I refused the order=2 stars

Food/Kitchen=1 star for taste and 5 stars for presentation.

The food did not live up to my expectations.  Both dishes were bland.  The seafood foam on the Cod was off putting.  I did not eat it and sent it back.  Hubby preferred the Petrale Sole much better than the Cod but still not that great.  The Abalone chowder excellent.  The yogurt Amuse Bouchée the Chef sent was yucky.  It was Greek yogurt plain on a spoon with mint leaf and cut almond with a drizzle of some berry sauce.  Not my taste.  I will not return.  It was disappointing.
author: Pam P.

description:
We visited Farallon for Happy Hour on a Friday night. The Jellyfish Lounge is really unique and cool, with its Jellyfish lights and classy under-the-sea decor.  I'm pretty sure it's where Sponge Bob Square Pants comes to dine for special occasions.

We ordered several Vodka Gimlets; two dozen oysters; a cheese plate (one cheese); and the Mezcal Ceviche.  I was relieved that the ocean didn't call, wanting its oysters back.

The service was not good.  The waitress would disappear for long periods of time, but at least we finally got our food and drinks during Happy Hour.  A couple across from us never got the oysters they ordered, while waiting on a table for dinner. Another couple also seemed quite annoyed with the lackluster service.

My boyfriend has had dinner there before, and he thought it was quite good. I'd do dinner there if he wanted, but overall, I wasn't that impressed with the food or the wait staff.
author: Lynda T.

description: I love the glass sculptures in this restaurant. It's so over the top like you feel like you're under the sea. I am a HUGE fan of their Happy Hours which are daily - even on Saturdays. Last time I was there I enjoyed a burger and fries with a glass of sparkling wine and oysters of course.
author: Danielle S.

description:
I am not a huge seafood eater, but I had a gift cert here and wanted to use it up before seeing a play down on Market street.

It was easy enough to make a reservation day of for 6:15.  I think this place is likely a tourist place and packed when conventions are in town.  

The place is decorated kinda cool if you have never been...the chandeliers are made to look like Octopus and sea urchins.

We decided to split a few things, but first bread came to the table from Acme.  Brad really good and butter with sea salt on it. But I had a gripe - the Acme Epi is made to be torn not cut and they cut it...Blerg (Liz Lemmon)

We ordered:
--A salad that came with a strip of bacon that was uncut-able - really almost un-tearable (with bare hands) too. another table near us had the exact same issue - I think partially b/c it was too think and not warm.
--My favorite thing of the night was the foie gras mousse, served with some frisse lettuce, strawberries, chopped hazelnuts and brioche toast. I thought the acme bread was better - so just used that 
--We also ordered the corn broth soup with totellini, we had told our server (Nancy- who was great) not to bother to split anything in the kitchen, but they did. The soup was good, BUT - my soup spoon tasted of soap. bummer.
--We order the scallop on top of corn purée (also came with popcorn and chorizo) - the polenta was too sweet, but the scallop was nicely seared
--The swordfish - comes with some eel accompaniment that we asked for on the side.  It was good, but I can make better at home.

I would only come here again on someone else's expense report. The burger served at the bar looked good.
author: Amy W.

description:
I fell in love with this place the moment I stepped inside the restaurant. The atmosphere was very welcoming and heart-filling. The seafood was exceptionally good!! We tried the oyster tasting and all of them was impeccable. Their main dishes are very unique and the ingredients are very high quality. 
I had the coal seared amberjack and the overall texture of this dish is out of this world. The fish was med rare and it's rhe best thing I've ever tasted! Although it was quite pricey, it's totally worth it!! Besides, they have very great service. The waiter came and explained in very detail for us about the menu that night. 
Would def recommend it to someone who loves seafood! And even when you're not a seafood fan, they still have a variety of vegan and red meat for you to choose from.
author: Nha Vy N.

description: I am from out of town and have worked in the food business for about 15 years. Front of the house, back of the house, and on the sales side of the spectrum. From the start, the bartender was extremely entertaining. As we sat down the Sommelier of the House helped us with the proper wine. Might I add he had us laughing out @$$ off. Our server could see we wanted to do mainly tasting and he coursed out as such.   Most importantly this is the second time I have been to San Francisco and I was finally able to enjoy some Abalone. Best dinner of my trip. When I get back I will surely stop in again. Great Job EVERYONE!
author: Eric H.

description:
Food Quality and presentation - amazing.  Service-awesome.  Decor - unbelievable.  What a great experience!  I can't wait to go back next time I'm in town - this place is fantastic!

I started with the scallop ceviche, which was out of this world!  Then moved on to the pacific sea bass, which had a fantastic array of flavors, served in a slight broth.  Then went for the olive oil cake & a cappuccino - perfect end to a perfect meal!  My server Kirsten really set a very high bar for other servers to achieve - she was perfect.

All things considered - this was the overall best dining experience I've had in years!  The only thing missing was my trophy wife......
author: Stewart G.

description: Amazing food & fabulous service. We had appetizers & a drink in the bar area. For dinner we were seated in a nice sized booth facing the open kitchen (great location). Decor was sea themed. Our waiter was full of knowledge on the menu items & offered additional culinary information. Every item we ordered was perfection. (See photos for food ordered)
author: Reese R.

description: Amazing historic structure and story with a very professional and courteous staff and of course the food was good. I had the pork tenderloin and it was amazing.
author: Gary P.

description:
Sorry, I left this draft for too long.  Awesome happy hour food.  Nice little table by the window.  Portions were good, ideal for small eaters like me.  The waiters were friendly and professional.  The ambience was lovely, especially with the beautiful glass jelly fishes hanging from the ceiling.

Will go back again for sure!
author: Elaine Y.

description:
We celebrated our anniversary at Farallon, which was just amazing, they even had a Happy Anniversary card on our table waiting for us. I absolutely loved the fresh oyster bar selection, we tried 2 of 6 different oysters, all of which were amazing (although I did have my favorites). I want to come back just to have an Oyster Happy Hour.

The atmosphere was upscale, fancy, but being in SF, I was able to get away with jeans and a nice shirt. Thank goodness, cause I don't have anything else. The jellyfish decor was really cool, as was their mural on the back wall. 

Every dish that came out was delicious, and the clam chowder was probably the best I have had in a while. I want to come back and sample more of the menu
author: Bryan M.

description:
Eh. Food was decent. Service was good but not what I could've hoped for at those prices. Glad I brought a friend and we used his company's business development credit card to pay...I would have been unhappy for either of us personally spending that amount of money on a mediocre meal. 

Maybe the bar would be better? It looked pretty hopping when we left.
author: Regan F.

description:
The seafood here is so good. 

I came here for happy hour one day after I worked on a Saturday. I decided that I would come here and treat myself and throughly enjoyed myself. The bartenders are great and the people I happened to sit next to were fun to talk to. 

I ordered some oysters (so fresh and delicious!), and the ceviche. Both were so good and really worth it - especially at happy hour prices. 

This is my type of happy hour - can't wait to go back.
author: Nina Y.

description: Took the wife here for our 10 yr. wedding anniversary - we had several of the 'starter' / 'small plates', the crab, the chowder, the halibut / octopus, and the mushroom lasagnette - all of them were outstanding except for the lasagnette, maybe not what I was expecting but overall the 'appetizer' parade was exception despite this 1x dish.  I had the tuna main and the wife had the main lobster - both were cooked to perfection.  We did several half-bottles of wine per the recommendation of the sommelier, who I believe was one of the best I've encountered ever.  We shared parts of our mains just to get a good sample of the dishes, those plus the starters, plus the half-bottles were really fabulous.  The service was outstanding, from the host to the waitress to the sommelier to the management - I've fine dined before, so I was expecting the 'relaxed' pace of the courses - I can see where that type of pause would feel slow to others though.  This is not a get-in and get-out place, this is traditional fine dining at a much slower RPM than silicon valley spins at.....  We had follow-up reservations at Bar Crenn for Champagne and desserts so we passed on the after-dinner treats at Farallon.  BUT having self-medicated with waves of drinks, app., mains, wines, we were feeling the food coma approaching like an oncoming freight train... so we ordered espressos at Farallon and asked the waitress for the check.  The coffee was excellent, and she brought us complimentary chocolate / sea salt / caramel squares from the kitchen that I don't know were laced with what type of crack - but whatever that thing was BLEW ME AWAY.  I could eat a pallet of those things.... best "chocolate" square I've had in my life hands down.  The wife commented it tasted like a French dessert I've never heard of (or can pronounce correctly)... but I was so stunned by it the waitress brought us 2x more each.  Yeah..... wedding anniversary dinner: BOOM
author: John K.

description:
This review is only for the happy hour which is from 4:30-6 in the jellyfish lounge which is actually right in front.  We came in at 4:50 on a Saturday and we're able to get a seat on the lounge couches.

We ordered the bourbon manhattan and Hemingway daiquiri both were very tasty.  We also ordered the fries $5, a little soggy but good aioli.  The Kumamoto oysters 3 for $7, a dozen for $28.  And 3 dozen of the happy hour special oysters 6 for $7, these were really fresh and delicious. Sweet and not too briny.  The special soup $7, which was cream of abalone, very good.  The chiccharones $5 were crispy and well seasoned.  Finally we also ordered the sturgeon caviar $50 happy hour special.  It was indeed special and well worth every penny.

The service was spectacular and the ambiance was upscale but not stuffy, cozy yet refined.  We had a great happy hour here and I think this may have been one of my most memorable stops in SF this trip.  I highly recommend Farallon's for their happy hour and excellent service.
author: Han D.

description: Yummy Hemingway Daquiri, oysters to die for at happy hour and yummy salad with goat cheese that was not "goaty" at all! I loved the aqua-themed decor - jellyfish chandeliers are beautiful :)
author: Penny L.

description:
After walking around all day as a tourist, we had one final destination before heading home. The restaurant feels nice after a long day, very relaxing atmosphere. We had drinks before sitting down for dinner. It seems like the happy hour here has a bunch of great deals on food. However, it was the last day we had, so wanted to get a little more.

I had the butterfish, and it tasted like butter. They apparently cook it skin side down. But the skin doesn't get weird at all. It came out very crispy, perfect, and delicious. It's probably one of the best-prepared pieces of fish I've had. The sauce that came with it was equally delicious.

We had appetizers, we had dessert, we had a great time. I have no complaints, everything was delicious. I would recommend visiting first for happy hour. After that, you'll likely realize you should come back for the full dinner. This is also a great date spot!

To the management, don't do anything different. This place is great!
author: Alden K.

description: Went for my wife's birthday since a business associate said it was his favorite restaurant.  Now I know why!  Amazing ambiance, insane drinks, incredible food and awesome waitstaff/bartenders... truly one of the best dining experiences we've ever had.  Highly recommend!!!
author: Roger H.

description:
Aptly rated 4 stars for the following reasons... for the price point one might expect more (literally... more, like in terms of portion). With that said the quality and service is pretty outstanding.  However,  a $69 seafood appetizer sparsely adorned by raw creatures of the sea, fresh as they may be, leaves one desiring more for one's money. 

Pat Kuleto (owner and designer) managed to transform this former bathhouse into a romantic spot that could easily turn from designer chic to Disneyland kitsch, but remains the former while igniting imagination.

Highlights:***** best clam chowder I think I've ever had. More like a bisque and amazing.

*****Bread and butter an east coaster dreams about.

Hot towel ... always a nice touch. 

***Homemade gnocchi quite tasty but 1/2 European portion. 

*****Atmosphere/ambiance 

*** dessert is okay... they ran out of almond cake affogato so we tried the tiramisu. I can make it better myself so while I was unimpressed, it wasn't terrible
author: Tara C.

description: Took my bff here for her bachelorette dinner party. We ordered the oyster sampler which includes half a dozen of 3 different types of oysters for an appetizer. The oysters were very fresh and delicious and had a great finishing taste to it. We both ordered the scallops with a side of Brussels sprouts for our entrees. Our amuse bouche was some yogurt cream with persimmon topping. We each got 2 pieces of different types of house bread. I loved the ambience and the way the restaurant looked inside. The service was superb as the waiters came around several times to ask us how our meal went. I will have to come back here again!
author: Diana T.

description:
Stopped by FaraLLon to ceLebrate VaLentines2017 earLy and it just so happened to Land on the day when the CNY festivities were going down. What.A.Big.Mistake!!
Traffic kept being detoured and our 7:40pm reservation was Long gone- we didn't arrive untiL an hour after and got stuck sitting around waiting for a tabLe open up.

At first gLace, the decor and ambiance didn't do it for me. It Looked oLd and feLt oLd- more than one chair Lined up @ the entrance was uneven & rocked back and forth. Meh.
We were seated and I honestLy feLt Like I was in a reaL-Life taping of Gordon Ramsey's HeLLs Kitchen. The head chef shouting out orders and asking how Long before the foods were done. It was Quite an experience. 

Due to VaLentine's day, FaraLLon offered a pre-set tastings menu & wine pairings option but We opted with a La carte:
CompLimentary Bread
Baby Gem SaLad [appetizer]
SQuid Ink TagLiateLLe [appetizer]
Brian FLannery Prime FiLet of Beef X2 [one with Maine Lobster SuppLement +$29]
VaniLLa Bean Cheesecake w|Meyer Lemon Sorbet [dessert]

Food was fantastic- starting with the amazing smoked trout in the saLad, to the aL dente & perfectLy seasoned pasta, and our perfectLy cooked medium rare steaks.

My onLy gripe: portions are smaLL. We spent weLL over 200 bucks (prior to tip) and I stiLL feLt Lightweight hungry. 
Sodas are soLd by the cup- don't make the same mistake we did by spending $20+ on this.
author: Ter L.

description:
Happy hour daily from 4:30pm - 6:00pm at the Jellyfish Lounge. Came here after drinks at The View for a quick snack on a Monday. It was pretty dead, but then again, it was only 5pm. 

Ordered:
x 6 HH oysters -The oysters were small to medium sized oysters which were great. They didn't give us horseradish, but saw the party next to us receive some. Maybe you have to ask?
x Mezcal Ceviche -It tasted fishy :(
x Caviar - I forgot which one we ordered, but all caviars are 50% off during HH. This is an incredible deal. However, the only toppings they served with this was chives and creme fraiche. MEH. I looked through pictures here and some people received theirs with 4 other toppings which is what I really wanted. Not sure if it's because of HH or what. I also disliked how they served this with toast that was so thick and buttery it almost overpowered the taste of everything else. 

In all, the HH menu is just OK. You get high quality foods for a very good price, but taste wise it's just meh. This place is slightly rundown too. I think Farallon is worth it for the HH drinks/oysters, but other than that, it's whatevers.
author: Anna M.

description: The best food i ever had..... the staff was amazing and ty chef Jason for accommodating to my grandma Chef Jason made a special dish for her!
author: Tiersa M.

description: Happy hour EVERY DAY!! So happy to be here on a Sunday evening; not so crowded but get to have amazing apps and drinks at happy hour prices! Excellent cocktails, delicious ceviche (best in the city), chips & dip, fries, and best of all Tomales Bay oysters for $1 a piece!!! Definitely will be back!!
author: Sheila K.

description:
Everything was perfectly delicious from start to finish! 
Gem Salads for starters; Foie Gras and Squash Blossom stuffed with Dungeness Crabmeat for appetizers; Lingcod with Cherry Tomatoes and Scallops over Risotto garnished with Grilled Grapes for entrees; Chocolate Cream with Croissant and Doughnut with Peanut Butter Ice Cream for desserts. Truly amazing! 
Not to forget....Service was absolutely flawless!
author: Malu D.

description:
It's a pretty restaurant.. presentation was nice.. our waitress was nice... BUT as my party of 7 was walking to to leave, a random waiter that didn't even serve us asked "Hello, i just wanted to ask.. was the service bad? because you guys left a really small tip for the waitress." 
First of all.. our bill was $600 and the waitress got a little more than a $100 tip! So damn rude
author: Mazy F.

description: Perfectly orchestrated dishes as if it were an impeccably pieced ballet..a precise and formalized dance of flavors with a balanced mixture of light,graceful fluid textures combined with decadent flavor infusions that leaves your pallet on the edge of its seat with an overall ambience demanding a standing ovation..the maestro accompanied by his unparalleled orchestra gave a marvelously stunning and unbelievable performance that deserves a trembling round of applause and praise..the dedicated and passionate artisans of Farallon have truly won our hearts and bellies.
author: Monica G.

description:
The "Monterey Aquarium" underwater decor is a visually stunning setting for great, but not excellent, seafood faire. The service is friendly and courteous.

Your out of town guests will enjoy Farallon. It is also very convenient as it is  near many of the Union Square hotels. 

Farallon is a solid a four [stars] and I do recommend enjoying this unique decor and feel. I also recommend enjoying the experience at the counter rather than a table for more engagement with other guests visiting from around the world
author: Michael G.

description:
TLDR - Fancy, upscale restaurant with classy ambiance and beautiful underwater decor. They have a great oyster HH (6 for $7), but the sliders shouldn't be missed either!

How to Dine at a $$$$ Restaurant for $$, Featuring Farallon
1. Go during HH, 4:30-6PM in the Jellyfish Lounge
2. Order oysters - 6 oysters for $7!
3. Order beef sliders - 2 sliders for $7
4. Order more oysters

Amongst all the overhyped restaurants of SF, Farallon is definitely one of the more underrated ones in my opinion. I'd never heard of it until I was looking for $1 oyster happy hours, and probably would have never visited otherwise as it's rather expensive for a normal meal.

The restaurant is very close to Union Square but easily missed since the front is rather unassuming. Walking inside though, you're immediately taken into an underwater world with beautiful jellyfish lamps hanging from the ceiling. The Jellyfish Lounge is where they have their HH specials; normal dining is in the back. Classy, upscale ambiance.

My friend and I got there around 5:30PM and snagged the last spot for 2 at a table by the door. Not a great spot for a large group. 2-3, maybe 4 people max, would work well here. Good spot for solo diners too. We ordered 3 orders of oysters (18 total), the ceviche and the sliders and thought that was just the right amount of food for us. The oysters were good, but not gonna lie, those sliders were better!

* SIX FEATURED OYSTERS ($7) - 4/5
Fresh! More on the briny side than I would've liked, but I still enjoyed them.

* MEZCAL CEVICHE ($7) - 3.5/5
[w/ avocado mousse, spiced tostada]
Just okay. Not sure what makes it mezcal. The ceviche was a little on the acidic side.

* TWO BEEF SLIDERS ($7) - 5/5
[w/ crisp onions]
Simple and plain-looking but one of the best sliders I've had! The patty was a beautiful medium rare pink (slightly more on the rare side) and sooo juicy. Good size and will fill you up more compared to the other HH items. The crisp onions were like very thin, delicate onion rings.
author: Jessie L.

description: I give them a 3 because the food was mediocre. Service is excellent but for the price of their food I was expecting way better food. I had a party of about 17. Gratuity was added to the bill. We brought our own cake for a bday and they charged us $5 per slice to cut which was crazy. I could have cut the cake myself honestly.
author: Brianna A.

description: Wow, had a fantastic dinner last night.  The Foie grass was outstanding! The service was impeccable and the staff was very friendly.  This is without a doubt a Michelin-class restaurant.
author: Kevin M.

description:
This restaurant has a brilliant marketing scheme. Draw in unsuspecting patrons with the BEST happy hour in San Francisco, then entice them with incredible service and cuisine. My friend and I came here for happy hour because we couldn't resist the idea of sitting in the Jellyfish Lounge. When we arrived, however, we chose to sit at a small table by the window instead of at the bar areas under the jellyfish shaped chandeliers.

WE ATE SO MUCH. It was supposed to be an innocent happy hour, but we seriously feasted, and I hardly had room for actual dinner when I went home to my boyfriend. We started off with two dozen oysters, chicharones, and some cocktails. The oysters were mid sized and sooo fresh and delicious! My favorite were the chicharones, which are made in house. They were a bit salty for my friend, but they added variety in flavor and texture throughout the rest of the items we ordered.

For round two, we got more oysters, in addition to the sliders and ceviche. This was all on the happy hour menu, somewhere between $5 and $7. And I got a refill on my margarita. The sliders were amazingly juicy and filling. For such good happy hour prices, I half expected the food to be subpar, but this was some high class stuff. I'd actually love to come here for a fancy dinner sometime. Or just another happy hour adventure.

The best part was our smiling and hospitable waitress. I think the staff here was blown away by how much my friend and I could eat. They checked in on us regularly and cleared our dishes in a timely manner. I'm already excited to come here again, either for happy hour or dinner. Tourist or local, come check out this upscale and welcoming Union Square restaurant!
author: Stefanie C.

description: We originally were dining at Morton's, but they asked us to step out because we had a aromatic cannabis situation happening. Albeit most of their waiters were sitting in front poisoning themselves with cigarettes and greeting us with a wall of cigarette smoke. We stepped out of dark ass Morton's and into this seafood paradise. Not saying go to this place wreaking of cannabis, but they didnt deny our serious munchies.  We had a fabulous spread..Starters were caviar, oysters, and stuffed squash blooms Entrees were scallops, tuna, and octopus, and ended it all with a cheese plate OMG it was delish! Oh and Paul was so legit and knowledgeable of everything on the menu. Shout out to Paul and company for having respect for respectable cannabis users for sure!
author: Diana J.

description:
Drinks and food are pricey, but you get your money's worth.  The seafood was very fresh.  

I came here with a friend/coworker after a long traveling workday on a Friday night.  We had made reservations and arrived a bit early so we enjoyed happy hour drinks in the lounge area and started off with oysters ... there were selected varieties and each one was very fresh - oysters are a must try here! My friend isn't a big fan of oysters, and even she really enjoyed them. 

Drinks: 
The Roxie: it had an interesting smokey flavor to the tequila...you could really taste the tequila, and I'm not a fan of tasting the alcohol in my drinks, but after a few sips I started to enjoy it more :) ... it went really well with the oysters.

The Parisian: (I think that's the name) and it was a delightfully refreshing fruity flavor. 

Hemingway daiquiri: stronger and less fruity than expected 

Chardonnay (Dento?): smooth and buttery 

Food: 
Oysters - so many varieties and very fresh; definitely get some to try...some of them are a big saltier and brinier than others, but most of them have a sweet flavor to them (e.g. Tomales bay) 

Fruit de mer: this entree is perfect for sharing; comes with two good sized lobster claws, 2 oysters, 2 prawns, 2 clams, and a lump of crabmeat

Crudo of halibut: very light and refreshing with a hint of tartness and saltiness from the berries on top

Baratta and lobster with melons: very light and a nice balance from the sweetness of the melons and the buttery richness of the lobster 

Amuse bouche: I don't remember what was in it but it was a very delectable bite of a bit of sweetness, crunch and creaminess to it ... I just know I licked the spoon! 

Sablefish: light, airy, and buttery ... reminded me a bit like Chilean sea bass; there was a perfect amount of fava beans and fingerling potatoes - I like the fact that the potatoes were sliced to match the beans 

Bone dry scallops: I did not taste this dish, but my friend said it was perfectly cooked - nicely seared on the outside and perfectly soft on the inside 

Dessert: 
Chocolate mousse something - was just ok to me; there was a nice crunch on the outside chocolate dome and the mousse on the inside was very airy 

Can't remember the name of the other dessert, but I did like it better then the chocolate mousse 

Service: 
Excellent.  The staff were all very pleasant and friendly Our server was very friendly and patient with us...she reminded me of Anne Hathaway :) 
They bring you bread (two pieces each) with salted butter and more upon request ... both are sooo good - just be careful not to fill up on just the bread because it's very easy to just keep eating that!
author: L C.

description:
My large party of 9 wasn't really satisfied with the dinner menu Farallon had to offer. So, we asked our waiter if the restaurant had a tasting menu. He answered no but told us that he could go ask the Chef if one could be arranged for us. A few minutes later he came back with a 5 course tasting menu for us. Overall, I enjoyed most of my food and thought all the ingredients were very fresh but I didn't like the ribeye because I found it too overwhelming.

Service was amazing. Our waiter was very accommodating and understanding. He checked up on us regularly and helped us make changes to certain aspects of the menu if needed. Ambiance was amazing as well. The decor inside was classy and cozy. 

Ultimately, I took off a star because I agreed with some of the other reviews below stating that it wasn't worth it. Also, even though the food was good, it wasn't the on the same level as some of the other $$$$ restaurants in SF in my opinion.
author: Grace M.

description: Beautiful ambiance - themed like an aquarium with the jellyfish chandeliers. It's very unique. It almost feels like the swing era with the booths. The dishes were incredible. The presentation was A class and service was impeccable. They had very polished servers who knew the etiquette. I think the price reflected the level of service and food. Overall I felt we received the value for our food. It is typically difficult to get a reservation here but we were lucky to find an opening and they did their best to accommodate us - tourists from Canada and Germany.
author: Chanelle D.

description:
August 11, 2017. My daughter and I stopped in for happy hour and were pleasantly surprised. Great service and a very satisfying menu. We ordered the cheese plate two sliders ($7.00 each) fries.
My daughter ordered a mocha that she said was very good and she is an Illy coffee drinker. Take a look a at the photos.  My only suggestion is they served the cheese with just two small slices of bread that was very good. I asked for extra toast and I get an eye roll. The cheese to bread ratio should be revisited. On my next visit I will try the oyster bar.
author: Jamie Y.

description:
Shells & starfish find their way into Farallon's underwater-themed decor, & not in an understated way, either. From top to bottom, the restaurant is unapologetically decorated in "under the sea" meets old school SF. Shades of blues & greens, jellyfish-shaped chandeliers, a Neptune Palace-esque mosaic -- your senses are bombarded with this oceanic setting & it's fun, if not amusing, to behold. 

However, we were underwhelmed by the food. We started our pre-theater meal with the Grand Platter (chilled crab, lobster, oysters, & shrimp.) Even with the various condiments & plentiful portions, this platter paled in comparison to others we've had throughout the years. Everyone at our table ordered filet or ribeye (yup, I brought a bunch of meat lovers to a seafood restaurant!) I was the exception; I ordered a cod & lobster dish that made me wish I'd picked either another item or another restaurant, entirely. Farallon's been around for two decades, perhaps it's time they revamped their recipes & freshened up their menu, as everything on my plate was quite humdrum. 

I'd been hesitant to visit this restaurant for years. For a hefty price, I finally found out Farallon was better off a forgotten bookmark than a confirmed dud.
author: Fancypants X.

description: We decided to stop here for dinner, the food is AMAZING!!!!! The menu is small but the options are all great. We decide to get the sea belly and tuna meal. We will be coming back if we are in the city again.
author: Gabby A.

description:
Pricey restaurant but with the quality you get, it is very reasonable.

The seafood entrees were superb and the service was excellent. We really enjoyed the ambience too. 
We had the shrimp cheviche, the sablefish and scallop entrees, and pasta on the side. All were really really good. 

I will come back to this place again.
author: Katherine T.

description:
We went here probably 5 or 6 years ago, and were in SF yesterday so we went again. The ambiance is wonderful! The decor is a sea theme with sea urchin shell shaped lights and stretched glass sea creature shaped lamps. And the ceiling is a mosaic of early turn of the century tile and medallions. Just beautiful. 
The service is wonderful and the food delightful. Warm home baked bread with pink sea salt sprinkled butter to start with a complimentary cold melon gazpacho soup. Yum!  My husband and I each had the oyster appetizer that was very fresh. I had the Cioppino dinner that thankfully was already cracked and ready to eat outside of the easy to get mussels in the shells. These were the first mussels I ever ate that did not have a fishy after taste. My husband had the fillet of sole fish dinner. He said it was good, but a bit on the salty side. Dessert was so pretty that we had to take pictures. 

A very nice dining experience out on the town.

PS: My body temperature runs cold normally. I was cold in this restaurant:(. Had to drape my sweater over my shoulders during my time in the restaurant. My husband was fine and others looked comfortable. My only negative: I was cold all evening.
author: Karen J.

description: The wait staff was very professional and nice however they charged me more than what they said the oysters cost. It wasn't that big of a deal, but it was off putting. The food is overpriced. I ordered a fish dish. I honestly could have cooked better. I also ordered a dessert and felt ripped off overall. The ambiance is great, food underwhelming and overpriced for quality and portion. I wish I would have had a better experience but I think my initial high hopes were too high so that could have played a part.
author: Meli M.

description:
What a great experience.  We started in the Jellyfish Lounge, figuring we would just eat off the bar menu, and didn't have reservations.  Well, after we saw the place, we decided to eat in the restaurant, and were able to get reservations - luckily it was a Wednesday and we were willing to eat early - not sure that would have been possible other nights.

The Jellyfish Lounge - what a cool room.  The floor looks like the beach, there are jellyfish chandeliers.  One side of the room is an oyster bar with someone constantly shucking oysters.  And a bar on the other side.  The oysters on the bar menu were tiny local oysters and very good.  The waiter and bartender tried to replicate the drink I had at another bar.  (They didn't get close but what they made was very good.)

Dinner:  We were seated at 5:30.  Things started off with an amuse bouche of truffled goat cheese, slice of olive, and almonds along with some excellent bread.  The waiter explained some of the menu items to us.  I chose the Gnocchi and Oysters appetizer, and hubby had the Sablefish.  I hear that the fish was the best he'd ever had.  I know my plate was excellent - soft pillows of gnocchi with an excellent sauce, soft sauteed oysters, caviar, and deep fried potato skin curls for some texture.  Dessert was a blueberry panne cotta.  

Service was excellent.  Waiters were very knowledgeable about the menu.  The table behind us got an in depth explanation of every menu item.  Was way more than we would have needed to know, but the foodies at that table were very interested.  (The sign of a good waitstaff, to know how much information to dispense to which diners.)

Would love to go back again.
author: Pam H.

description:
Came here last evening entertaining some guests from out of town.  I was able to snag a table at the last minute and the front of the house crew were great.  I've been here for Happy Hour many a time but never for dinner.

First off, let me say the food is well worth it.  My guests were very impressed and enjoyed themselves greatly.  One star is removed by our waiter, Jeremy C.  What the hell was wrong with him? Patronizing and condescending are the words to describe him.  Oh and ASCERBIC, like he didn't want to be there and had a terrible disdain for the guests.  Well, don't come to work then but honestly, even my guests noticed his attitude.

My guest wanted to know if they had "sherbet" - well, that's what it's called in some places and my client is also of another generation who knows the dessert by that name.  Jeremy, our reluctant waiter, snapped, "no, we don't have sherbet but we have s-o-r-b-e-t" and opened the dessert menu.  I felt so embarrassed as my client felt humiliated in public over a pronunciation as minor as that.

There were also other things he did but I am not going to bore you anymore.  The maitre d' was great when I interacted with him, his demeanor and service was what you would expect from an establishment like Farallon.

I had the Little Gems Salad with goat cheese, pecans and pomegranates - very refreshing and well dressed.  Other guests had the same and one had the salad with the sardines and that was delicious as well.

The entire table pretty much voted for the scallops and it was clean plates all around.  So a very nice dining experience with fantastic food.  If they could just fix the attitude of this waiter...
author: Favoloso M.

description: What a special place ! I didn't make any plans and just kinda randomly stumbled upon this place which has been around the bay area for a while. It have a great reputation in the city and after my first experience here I certainly can see why it does. Upon entering I was mesmerized by the overall design. It's beautiful. The bar area and the jellyfish lounge is beautifully designed. The light fixtures look light jellyfish it's just stunning. One seated in the main dining room we were greeted and given the daily menu. I was surprised to find out the menu changes every day. Genius ! We ordered the octopus, red leaf salami salad , sea bream and the pork chop. All of the food was cooked perfectly.  The kitchen is an open kitchen which I love seeing the action of the chefs and cooks doing their thing.  Service was outstanding and once again I was very impressed with the design of the place. It's gorgeous and well thought out. Kudos to who ever designed this place. It was a great evening visitinga dear friend which I have not seen is quite some time. What a great evening !
author: Andreas N.

description: Love this restaurant. The services were incredible. The food were excellent. I ordered Roasted Halibut, it was very delicious, good quality fresh fish with little bit of burnt smelled of crispy skin and the gravy. They are perfect.
author: Vivian E.

description:
Looking for outstanding fish in a non-tourist setting?  Avoid the Wharf and head here for a memorable experience. 

Service is top notch and the cocktail menu has some interesting choices. We tried a couple starters including the shaved scallop and tuna dishes. Both tasted great but the portions were very small for apps that cost $20 each. 

The main entrees did not disappoint.  I had the sablefish and it was exceptional.  My coworkers also enjoyed their selections. 

We were too full to order dessert but the waiter brought complimentary mini brownies - a nice touch to end the meal. 

Recommend this place for special occasions or business dinners.  You'll appreciate the design and decor inside.
author: Jay Z.

description:
Easy rating at 5 stars this one. Absolutely original and cool environment with warm lighting reminding the sea (shells, jelly fish and so on). Very comfortable and romantic tables joint with excellent service. Fantastic offer of sea fruits and a bit short but perfectly executed cooked plates. Just forgot try the barrel cocktails ... 
Could we make an exception and rate 6 stars?
author: Mario M.

description:
So we went for the happy hour to the jellyfish lounge. Relying on yelp reviews, this was a great place, one of the best. 
Yes, it is not bad for drinks from happy hour. 
No- for all food and service .Oysters- small and flavored with something that spoils its taste. Here is definitely not the place to enjoy them. 
Our waitress was very unsatisfied that we bother her with our order and questions. Nobody cleaned out table for a while. I had to put al the dirty dishes and napkins together at the edge after a while, and only after that they were cleaned. 
If you target for the certain type of audience, you should provide the certain type of service.
author: Dana N.

description: My parents came from China. I invited them to eat seafood at this place. I paid with my first intern paycheck.  I felt bankrupted but it was worth it. My mom felt so happy to eat fresh seafood. And they both were very satisfied. People dress more formally in this restaurant. This is one thing worth mentioning.
author: Danyang Danielle C.

description: My husband, daughter and I had dinner here last evening. The seafood was outstanding. Ambiance very nice. The service was excellent. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone wishing an excellent meal in an outstanding city.
author: Mary Anne H.

description: This place is on point!! Food was amazing and customer service is remarkable. Worth checking out specially on nice occasions.
author: Frank E.

description:
Wow I've written so many SF reviews for this trip and I have yet to give a single 5 star for anything...which is rare, because my reviews are normally 5 star...

Anyway...this won't be a 5 star review either.

The question is whether it is a 3 or 4 star experience...

The menu on the website is a little different than what we got in the restaurant.

My boss got the halibut and I got the short ribs with the dungeness crab supplement.

We also got a few scotch flights.

The service was slow. They seemed to forget about our first scotch flight.

The best food was stuff we didn't order. The amuse bouche was great, and we got a halibut ceviche (I think our order was lost as we waited forever to get to this part of the dinner). I normally hate most ceviches, but their halibut ceviche was amazing.

Then the food came.

My boss enjoyed his halibut.

My short ribs were "OK" - they were a little dry. There was more dungeness crab than I expected, but it was full of little pieces of shell. The dungeness crab meat was a little mushy too (too much time in the freezer?).

Overall I didn't feel it was worth the money.
author: Thomas F.

description:
Didn't have the greatest experience there, and it mainly stems from the poor service. Upon walking in, the front desk person was on the phone for about 10 minutes before attending to us. During the dinner, one of the waiter bumped into the back of my chair with quite some force. The two stars are for the food - the abalone and chestnut ravioli was quite delicious as was the uni bone marrow. The decor was mostly cheap acrylics - I felt a bit like I was in Disneyland. 

Torn whether to return to the place, the food was quite decent - but the service really left a sour taste in my mouth.
author: Vivien S.

description:
Solid higher-end seafood place in the heart of San Francisco.  I tried the Fruit de Mer (Fruitti di Mare in other places) and it was pretty good.  I'm used to it being served with pasta and a bit of broth  - Farallon lists it on the appetizer menu, and serves it more like a charcuterie board.  The shrimp and oysters were phenomenal, and it's tough to goof up crab claws.  The only thing I thought was off was the clams on the half shell.  They were fishier than Trump's Russian dealings.  
Great atmosphere, attentive service, just the right amount of lighting - a great place to enjoy classic seafood (or steak, if that's your thing).

Oh, I nearly forgot - the light fixtures are all sea creatures, which can be either freaky or funny, depending on what you like.  I didn't need the giant jellyfish chandeliers to be reminded I was in a seafood place; kind off out of place in this higher end restaurant.
author: Dan O.

description: The snooty hostess followed up by a server with an "I'm too good for you" attitude, made for a very short visit to this overhyped joint. We finished our ridiculously priced, tiny portioned soups and bolted out of there and went to the Morton's next door where they know how to treat people properly.
author: Steve M.

description:
Service is amazing, food is ok. The portions are super small, as can be expected from an expensive/fancy restaurant. The beets & crab appetizer was good, although I only got a few bites. We also got the gnocchi appetizer, which came with like 5 gnocchi. My BF & I were literally laughing & taking pictures of how small the food portions were.

For the main dish, I got the scallops, which were cooked great, but was SUPER SALTY with the dressing and vegetables it came with. I literally could only eat the scallops and left the rest on the plate. At this point I didn't want to give dessert a chance, so we got just the check, which ended up being almost $200 with tax & tip. Loved the service, all restaurant staff members were nice & attentive. But if we're going to pay that much, I'd like some good food too!
author: Betty M.

description:
Food-gasm alert!!!!!

We had the Ahi Tuna Poke = pure deliciousness.
Delta Sturgeon = this was definitely different, but amazingly delicious.

The man had the Local King Salmon which he quickly devoured and exclaimed that this was the best salmon he's ever had.
