Jellyfish chandeliers, weird underwater paintings, and blue and white ceilings and floors.

The food was stellar. The misses were the corn chowder and the Caesar salad. The soup tasted like lard and smoke, and the salad was so acidic that it was like eating a sour patch kid anchovy. Both gross, so we sent it back.

The tuna poke was also a disappointment. So was the shrimp cocktail in what tasted like tomato sauce rather than cocktail sauce.

The french fries, oysters, and crab toast were killer. On the mark legit.

Miss Bad Idea Bear loved the fresh crab.

The caviar was creamy and nice. But, I've had way better in Las Vegas.

At a little over $200 for lunch, it's pricey but worth it.
author: Jack R.

description:
Had a lovely dinner with 2 colleagues at around 7pm on a Tuesday night.  We were surprised to find that reservations were needed, and as we didn't have one, we elected to sit at the seafood counter/bar for our meal. I think this turned out to be the way to go as it gave us the opportunity to see the seafood as it was plated. I went with the 1/2 lobster for $28, and added the 1/2 crab which I think tacked on another $16 or so to the bill, but it was worth it.

The lobster and crab were both served chilled.  This was a new experience for me as I am used to eating both when still hot from steaming.  After getting used to the temperature, I really enjoyed the meal.  The lemon and avacado sauces for the lobster were delightful and worth trying vs. the drawn butter (which is served as well).

Our only complaint was that we had to ask to be served our bread several times... We were almost done with our meal before it came out.
author: Ann J.

description: Superb dining experience. Fruits de mer was great and tartare was mouthwatering.  But the best is the Venison and sausages.  I loved the jellyfish chandeliers and the service was top notched.   Wine pairing was complementing.
author: Wing W.

description: Beautiful setting. We went here for happy hour in the jellyfish lounge. It is first come, first served, self seating. We got a table right when we arrived at 5:30pm. It was great, right next to the street so we could people watch. We ordered a dozen oysters ($7 for 6 pieces), sliders, fish and chips and a few margaritas. Each was $7! What a deal! And the oysters were very fresh and tasty! Highly recommend this place for happy hour! Happy hour is from 4:30-6:00pm.
author: Lindsey T.

description: Delicious seafood restaurant with awesome ambience! We ordered the seafood platter, crab chowder and the sablefish with steamed mussels! Everything was delicious!
author: Natasha M.

description:
4 stars for service, 3 stars for cocktails, 2 stars for food.

I often stay at the Westin nearby and figured I'd stay close to the hotel by checking this place out. No reservations so we sat in the Jellyfish lounge which has beautiful jellyfish-like light installations. I liked how our server came around many times to take our orders and check on us. We even got bread service twice (carb heaven). 

The food left much to be desired. It was pricey and average at best. We had the squid appetizer, lobster roll and sliders. Squid was well cooked, not greasy. Lobster roll was well sized but didn't taste remarkable. The sliders were the most disappointing since it was two small sliders lukewarm and a paltry amount of fries. 

My sense is that this place caters to tourists and business people who have the money for the seafood and raw bar. Such a shame that they can't follow through with the food quality.
author: Colene C.

description:
2016New year's Eve dinner with a group:
The food was superb! Definitely worth it. The steak was the best I've ever had - perfectly executed. The ambiance was just like the pictures - we sat in the main dining room. They brought us "Happy New Year" hats and champagne for midnight. 

The ladies bathroom was wrecked. I had to ask the host to have someone tidy it up...back an hour later and it was still a disaster. No toilet paper available. Dirty paper towels everywhere. Water drenched counter tops. Water or urine on the floor, not sure which. 

4 stars simply because the bathroom was so gross. I dropped $250 on myself that night.
author: Jack W.

description:
First time eating here and I actually live close by! 
I have to say the place is One of the best I've had the Drinks are Always serve Cold! And the Service was Great! 5 Stars!
author: Lorraine M.

description: So over priced, very small portions. We were still hungry after spending over 250.00 for two. I'm a foody  and we were looking so forward to this great meal. The service was bad ( had to get up three times to ask for salt, another glass of wine ( small pours ) and the check. Sad.
author: Susan S.

description:
Very surprising and disappointing.    We ordered the theater menu which was pre fixed. 

My husband ordered the duck as his entree.  It arrived cold to the touch. The server apologized returning it to the kitchen and bringing a replacement.   It was hard to believe but it was once again cold to the touch. We asked the server to touch it which he refused but apparently his boss did because he returned with a third duck entree prepared the way it should have been. He said there was a problem in the kitchen with the chef not understanding how the dish was to be served.  The biggest bummer is I ordered the halibut which sat getting cold as I waited to eat with my husband. 

Dessert was a trio of sorbets comprising of peach, chocolate and green tea. The peach was excellent, the chocolate was good but overpowered the peach and the green tea was awful.

Our salads were okay but not spectacular. 

Cocktails at the bar were good and the two drinks were comped due to the cold duck entree 

Overall so disappointing for such a highly rated restaurant although the servers were excellent.
author: Susan M.

description: Ok so I took my parents there for dinner last night and I don't think I'd recommend this place overall.  The hosts were nice and I was glad that they moved us to another table.  The original table was right in front of the doors where the servers come out.  This was my parents first time in SF over 20years so I wanted to treat them to some really good seafood.  They moved us to a nice private corner table in the main dining area which was great.  We ordered the soft Shell crab appetizer which was good but a little salty.  We also order the cold oyster, shrimp cocktail, crab and lobster combo and that was delicious.  The main dishes were the scallop plate which was a but in the fishy side and overly salty but had a good crisp sear on it.  The steak was NOT good.  I thought we were getting a nice juicy ribeye but it was pounded kind of flat and it wasn't juicy despite it being asked it to be cooked "Medium well".  And it was served with a pile of fries.  Was not impressed considering they charged $39 for the steak.  I had to ask multiple time for a refill of hot water.  At the end, I thought it was tacky that the server reached over my table setting to grab the check bill (after I paid and did the tip) before we left the table.  If it was really a nice restaurant, the servers don't take the bill until after you leave.  That was tacky.  Also be aware that they charge 5% city tax on top of the regular tax BEFORE they calculate the whole amount for the sales tax.  Which means you're paying 13% tax total at the end.   I felt disappointed and ripped off in the but I tried not to show it since my parents aren't so picky with fine dining and didn't expect much.  I'm used to fine dining and nice restaurants so I was quite disappointed.  I would only recommend ordering the lobster and the oysters here.  That's it!   They have a good selection and many choices of oysters and their lobster tasted fresh.   Those are the only things I liked at this restaurant.  It's overpriced.
author: Alice C.

description:
Once again Farallon came through! Food is just too good here, and the **real MVP** once again goes to all of the fantastic servers who helped us out during the night. Special shout-out goes to Farallon for:

1) Carrying and storing my awkwardly large duffle at bag check and then dropping my luggage in my cab as I was leaving

2) Keeping me on-time to make my 6:59 PM Caltrain even though we sat down around 5 PM  and ate a ton of food, but because our waiter hit that *double-time* for us I was able to be about that Weekend #BabyBulletLife
author: Brian S.

description:
Wow! What a gorgeous restaurant! I felt like I was transported into another underwater fantasy world. Love the floating jellyfish decor! With the dim lighting, they made the place look elegant and grand, and not tacky. 

My husband and I shared the Royal Platter which was a gorgeous platter (see photo) of oysters, clams, ceviche, salmon sashimi, tuna tartare, shrimp, dungeness crab, and lobster. It was the perfect amount of food for the 2 of us, and left us feeling very satisfied but not too full. Everything was SO fresh and delicious!! I really liked everything on that platter, especially the lobster, tuna tartare, and dungeness crab. My husband loved the shrimp-- so juicy and plump! Our least favorite were the clams and oysters which were a little on the briney side. 

We washed it all down with a small bottle of 2012 Joh Jos Prum Wehlener Sonnenuhr Riesling Spatlese, which tasted amazing with all the seafood! I liked it because it was slightly sweet, light, and just delicious! If you're generally a Riesling fan, you'll like this one for sure. 

Great service and overall a wonderful place for a romantic date and fresh high quality seafood! It's on the pricey end but you get what you pay for! Supposedly they have a great Happy Hour as well! :)
author: Diana I.

description:
My boyfriend and I came to Farallon for dinner on a Thur night before the Jul 4 weekend. We had made a reservation for 2, but it turned out we made it for the wrong date, but thankfully, they had a table for us nonetheless :)

There are many hits and misses here. You have to know exactly what to order, or it would easily be a disappointing experience. 

1/2 oz American Paddlefish Caviar with traditional accompaniments - Yummy! Recommended!

Oysters on half shell on ice - The oysters were mostly fresh and yummy. Our favorite was the kusshi oyster from washington.

Sterling beef tartare - They originally served us the tuna tartare, but quickly corrected the mistake. Wish we had stuck with the tuna tartare instead since the beef tartare was extremely disappointing. The beef was slightly hard, the creme fraiche drowned out the fragrance of the black truffle. Everything tasted bland. Give this a PASS :(

Seared Georges Bank diver scallop - YUM. Scallop was seared beautifully and cooked to perfection. This is the first time  I had beef tongue together with scallops and it was a great pairing. Loved this dish!

Mediterranean shellfish bisque - Yummy!! Strong cognac and shellfish taste. Love it!

Seared rare hawaiian ono - BOO :( This dish was a little on the bland side. The side of "sauteed" spinach tasted raw, unseasoned, and was generally unappetizing. Overall presentation was also lacklustre. Definitely rated bottom of the list.

Pan roasted Alaskan halibut - Yummy. Love the corn soup base, went very well with the perfectly cooked halibut. Definitely recommended.

My dining experience was probably 3 stars due to the many hits and misses. But +1 for the wonderful service and for seating us even though we made a mistake with our reservation!
author: Christina N.

description:
Came here for our one year anniversary dinner and I was definitely impressed with the decor and theme of the restaurant. We found out from one of the staff the room is the top of the pool decor, and the pool is right below!

Reservation is a must, because even on a Tuesday night, the place was packed.

We opted for drinks first and the smaller shellfish platter. The lobster was amazing! I'm not a huge lobster fan, but this tasted like butter. 

We only chose two courses each, only because the second course options didn't really stand out much. 

I ended up with the spinach salad and the Hawaiian Ono, while man friend ordered the citrus halibut and the trout.

Both starters were great. The salad had a sweeter dressing, but still solid. The Ono was done well, and tender. 

They do have a very extensive wine list by glass and small or large bottle. 

My only two complaints are:
1. The turn around time for each course was particularly long. We waited for a while for our second course. Thank god for bread and butter!
2. The staff knew it was a special night for us, so end of the night, I expected some kind of small token of dessert, but, nothing. I didn't order dessert either because I didn't find anything that was a wow factor on the menu.

Overall, its nice to see an open kitchen and the staff hard at work, and the staff was pleasant to talk too. Good solid seafood options and would come back again.
author: Nika K.

description:
We spent the day at the Farallon Islands and thought it only right that we stop in here to celebrate. We were celebrating, not only the fact that we didn't get seasick, as many on our boat did, but also our 28th wedding anniversary.

We walked in a bit early for dinner but just in time for Happy Hour in the Jelly Fish Lounge. We were lucky to get the last empty stools at the bar which gave us an action view of the Jelly Bar where seafood is prepared and oysters were being shucked, as well as other eager guests streaming in the door and awaiting a table.

The happy hour menu was ample and reasonably priced at $6 a selection. The oysters were some of the freshest, tastiest ever! We ordered a dozen and even considered a second dozen but got side tracked by the lively and engaging conversation with bar neighbors. We also enjoyed the Wild Mushroom Strudel (very small but tasty serving) and the Charcuterie. Even the bread and butter was unusually good.

The best part was our hostess for the evening, Renee, was a delight and she really made the evening special. She was knowledgeable, personable, charming and a very efficient bartender. We had been there at least an hour enjoying the bubbly and small bites when she overheard us mention in conversation that it was our anniversary and quipped "You're just telling us that now?" with a smile. Of course our dessert was served with fanfare and chocolate font. Renee is a gem; it's the first time we met but felt like old friends by the time we left. Can't attest to the service elsewhere but at the bar, service is excellent!

I highly recommend the Happy Hour but check the hours before you go. We were told that they would be changing the hours in the near future.
author: Suzy S.

description:
Extremely disappointed. The food was bland and sloppily presented. I had the "tuna tartar" for appetizer that was completely flavorless tuna chunks in tomato sauce. For the entree I had the cioppino. One giant over cooked prawn, and a few clams with possibly a half a cup of crab meat that I had them de-shell (for an extra $5 that wasn't listed on the menu). Again, no flavor. 
For the prices? They should be ashamed of themselves.
author: Russ G.

description:
Came here for a birthday dinner for my boyfriend at the beginning of April on a Sunday. 

The great:
- The service was excellent. The host and hostess greeted us warmly and with smiles. Our waiter was incredibly attentive, polite, and brought everything out with perfect timing. Our glasses never got empty and empty plates never lingered. There was even a birthday card waiting for my boyfriend at the table, which was a very thoughtful gesture. 
- Oysters were fresh and we loved the champagne sauce
- The amuse bouche (a ricotta and seaweed combo) was the most interesting and surprising mix of flavors. We really enjoyed it.
- Halibut appetizer with the three garlic oil was amazing. The best halibut that we've had in a long time!
-Pea ravioli with scallops were cooked perfectly, and made me fall in love with peas.
- My boyfriend ordered the duck and he loved everything on the plate.
- Our desserts were lovely. I got the almond, pear, strawberry sorbet trio (substituted out the chocolate) and my boyfriend got the eclair. It had 'Happy Birthday' written on the plate which he appreciated. He said it was the best eclair he's ever had.

The good: 
- We didn't know what to feel about the decor. It definitely felt dated, but we kind of liked how unapologetically over the top it was. 
- The smelt appetizer was tasty but didn't excite us.

The bad:
- My Lassen trout entree was outright bad. There was a pool of watery liquid that everything was sitting in, and I couldn't tell if it was intentional or not. It washed out the flavors, and made the skin soggy and unappetizing. The carrots were the best thing on the plate.

Overall, we had a great experience and were really surprised at the complex flavor combinations. Nearly everything felt innovative and was delicious. One of our pet peeves is when it feels like a place is trying to be innovative for the sake of being innovative, but at the expense of actual taste. It didn't feel like that here. 

I think the decor is actually detracting from the menu. Since it looks and feels so old school, it automatically made us expect the menu to be old school and taste dated. That wasn't the case, but it set our expectations in a different direction. 

Aside from the trout (which may have been a fluke) everything else we had was fantastic. If I had ordered something different, I probably would be giving this review 5 stars.
author: Jenny I.

description: First timer to my partner and I . Great atmosphere, service and we were in aw by the detailed decor.
author: S V.

description:
Thanks to my Catholic up bringing, I'll always associate Friday with seafood and everything else that is not consider meat. 

A long day of nothing in my stomach, a girl can eat just about everything that is given to her within sight. Luckily, in close proximity, Farallon is the winner choice for dinner. 

We order:

- On the half shell of oyster = Barron Point, Glacier Bay, and Shigoku. All so sweet, delectable, and tasty. 

-Seared local petrale sole = nicely cook sole with fantastic butternut squash ravioli and baby broccoli. 

- Grilled cascade river artic char = there are countless ways to cook char, but I gotta hand it to Farallon for their version of grilling them to perfection. The skin is perfectly crispy. Not to mention, the butternut squash puree, bacon braised chicories, monterey squid complimented each other. 

The dessert menu seem really enticing, but it is unfortunate that I am too full. I guess I will have to venture to try their dessert and maybe their HH as well. As for now, I am content with their food. Hope you give this place a try. Cheers!
author: Owie N.

description: My husband and I have always had great experiences dining at Farallon  . . . until January 7, 2018.  We asked friends to meet us for cocktails and appetizers, and we were embarrassed by the service and food.  For years we raved about this restaurant, and it was our favorite place to dine on special occasions.  Even the recipe for their delicious shoestring potatoes and sauce had been abandoned.  What was served in its place was fast food fries with ketchup!  Outrageous.  We were told there is a new "chef."  I will try to find out where the original chef is now, and check out that restaurant.  Yes, the Farallon's decor is still cool, but that's not enough to get us back.  Mary H
author: Mary H.

description: Absolutely unacceptable to have plastic in my water!!!!!!!!! Been going for years, the service was unacceptable in response to the plastic in my water. Wow. Never going again. Eating at Morton's next door. Having a much better experience.
author: Angie R.

description:
Expensive, but worth it.  We had a fantastic waiter and service was great, although it was a long wait to get my second martini ... for which he apologized.

There were four of us at our table and the beautiful Royal Platter was a really great starter for our group.  Later, two of us had the Hot Pot, and there were Albacore and a Halibut plates at our table also.  All really good, but what really made the meal is the attentive service.  Water glasses and bread constantly replenished, beautiful dining room, and a very knowledgeable unpretentious waiter who did not rush us (wish I got his name).  We were able to relax and enjoy our time together over a truly memorable meal.

It's a rare dining experience when everything goes right.  Looking forward to next time here.
author: Yelp R.

description:
Beautiful location and good cocktail but forget about food and service....it's a joke!
Price reasonable.
I won't go back!
author: Cri J.

description:
The restaurant setting is very unique and nice. Roomy sitting and not too close with other table. The royal platter of seafood was great except for the baby scallops that were very fishy. Caviar is excellent but serving them with blinnies would have been much better than the brioche. The bone marrow with crab was delicious and rich. We didn't like the octopus carpaccio it was very blend and didn't have a wow factor to it. The scallop sashimi was good but I think that the dry chili flakes over powered the scallop taste. 
Our waitress was very kind and friendly and the staff overall were very polite.
author: Sty S.

description: Farallon provides a very elegant and beautiful atmosphere. The experience was just wonderful, the waitress was very polite. I never had a feeling of being rushed or interrupted too much. The decor is just gorgeous and reminds me of Europe. Lastly, of course the dishes are delicious & exquisite :)
author: M. H.

description: I went here before a graduation event with a friend. To be honest I can't remember what exactly we got...it wasn't that memorable. Pretty sure we got the Fruits De Mer Platter and an entree as well as an appetizer -- but I probably don't remember because it wasn't that good or bad. Leaving this as a personal reminder that it was just kind of meh. Not sure why but I felt like the food just wasn't that amazing. The interior decor is pretty and I liked the vibes inside -- but I felt like I was paying for a "bougie vibe" and not so much because the food was good. I personally really dislike restaurants that serve mediocre tasting food and charge you for a nice inside vibe. I feel like for the same price range there are a few other restaurants I would rather go to that I've been to in SF. I want a restaurant at $$$$ price range to provide both delicious food and nice indoor vibes -- but I felt like I got just mediocre food with nice indoor vibes here.
author: Joseph L.

description: One of the best meal I've had in a long time. The wait staff is extremely friendly and on point. They don't miss a beat.
author: Judy S.

description:
I chose this restaurant because it was right by the theater so it was ideally located-- I guess there is a reason why Farallon is still standing after all these years-- their food is very good-- they don't screw it up- and... well... it doesn't offend anyone. The atmosphere is very cool, I got a kick out of the retro 80's jelly fish hanging from the ceiling. It was probably super avante garde back in the day, now its a bit dated but cool dated-- like whats old is new again sort of. 

I would not say it was the most memorable dinner (food wise) but I also can't say a single bad thing about it. Its the kind of place you can bring your boss, your grandparents and your client. Its old school enough to be retro cool but has typical classic upscale continental food that never goes out of style. The pre theater meal is a pretty good deal, although the salad could have been more interesting- it was mostly salad leaves (there may have been a sliver of beet and a bit of walnut in there). It was the kind of salad I used to make when I did wedding catering and they would put me, the least experienced culinary assistant- on salad prep-- because it was so easy. Easy can sometimes mean fabulous, but in this case it was just what one would expect from a pre theater salad-- inexpensive, quick and easy to make- not super flavorful. 

The bread was not GREAT, it was warmed but a tad bit on the hard side. There was also rye bread which I don't like but at least it was softer. The butter with red sea salt on top was nice in a continental way. My ahi tuna entree was tasty, but again-- not super exciting. The tuna was not UN fresh-- but it tasted like it had been frozen. The fries were crispy and upon request, they brought me some (low brow!) Heinz ketchup. 

Sorbet dessert was pleasant-- The chocolate scoop was quite decadent- not memorable but not offensive either. So I guess I can't complain but I can't necessarily rave about it. I DID like the atmosphere- it WAS filled with grandparental types (older, rich theater going crowd) it is not a young, cool, underground hipster scene but again- its the whole retro continental making a comeback. I almost expected aspic jelly molded desserts! 

Would I go back again-- yes I probably would, especially if I was heading out to the theater which is right next door. I think they could maybe jazz up the menu a bit, try out a few interesting new flavors like black garlic or Harissa or anything exciting and new- they could combine old and new perhaps-- like familiar fish with a flavorful twist. 

The pre theater dinner is a decent deal- it really is- and if you don't drink (as I don't) its an even better deal. If you DO drink, their cheapest glass of white was like $14- so thats not a good deal.
author: Rachel Z.

description:
Farallon is such a cool restaurant with great seafood. The decor honestly is unreal. Happy hour is where it's at here. Dinner is great too, but obviously expensive. 

The oysters are super fresh and delicious.

Grand Platter is very good. You get a little bit of everything. 

Scallops are super juicy and cooked perfectly. 

Also like the steak. For being a seafood spot, they prepare it really well.

Last time I went, I noticed the seafood was on the fishier, which was really disappointing because our meal was $300. It must have been an off night because in the past it has always been extremely fresh.
author: Gabrielle C.

description: Terrific atmosphere and great service! We came from out of town to celebrate our recent engagement and anniversary. A nice card was waiting for us at the table and we received a couple of complementary flutes of champagne (all with only me indicating we were celebrating our anniversary on the open table booking). This is the kind of service expected at such establishments and Farallon did not disappoint. Perfect romantic evening, food was great and so was the wine. No complaints here.
author: Gerard H.

description:
The dining room itself is so pleasing to the eye.  There is a definite Feng Shui going on at Farallon.  You are left with a very comfortable feeling that allows you to just relax and appreciate the finer side of San Francisco.  It's a beautiful room with an amazing ceiling and interesting acoustics.  We sat at  table #30 and we were able to see everything that was going on throughout our dinner.  We later found out that this is the owner's table!

Service is excellent.

The oysters were so fresh--we opted for a mix of Point Reyes and Drake's Bay oysters.
The Louisiana Shrimp that we asked for too were fantastic as well.

We were served a mushroom bisque for the amuse bouche and it too was fabulous.  It was not on the menu but, a Mediterranean Seafood Bisque was--so, we decided to split a bowl of that for our second course.  Delectable.

I had the steamed Alaskan Halibut for my third course.  It was served with baby artichokes and was very tender and mild in flavor.  It was cooked perfectly.
The other diner chose the NY Strip for the main (third) course.  It was cooked medium and came with truffled mac 'n cheese.  It was excellent though we both thought it was over salted.

Our server recommended the carrot cake for dessert and we both figured out quickly that we have never had a better piece of  carrot cake.  It was amazingly moist yet dense and served with a scoop of ice cream infused with cardamom and Wild Turkey bourbon.

Two martinis and a half of a bottle of an Oregon Pinot Noir later, we were brought out two complimentary glasses of a full bodied Cabernet.  Their "ESP" was right on when they figured out we weren't' too fond of the Pinot.  We didn't say anything because it was perfectly drinkable, just not as full of flavor as we had hoped and the team realized this without us having to say a word!   It was a classy move on their part.

This experience was memorable.
author: Thomas D.

description: Excellent seafood. I never get tired of this place. The crudos are delicious! The tuna carpaccio was excellent and the micro greens were a nice touch. The octopus is always cooked well--not tough, not salt, with just enough char.
author: Mario E.

description: Terrible service and snobby attitude. I wouldn't recommend unless you have 3-4 hours. They are very slow. Took 20 minutes to get a menu and it got worse from there. Food so so. Left with a bad taste in our mouths
author: Jacob B.

description:
Just ate here last night. The ambiance is stunning- food less so. My scallops were average and a little rubbery, my husbands crab bland & average- bill was not average. VERY expensive for what you are served. In year's past it was better. Food is not as innovative as it has been. You are paying for the gorgeous setting. 
Best as a place for a cocktail and oysters. Go somewhere else for your dinner.
author: K D.

description: Dined here with my husband on Sat 12/17/16. The atmosphere and decor were wonderful. We had amazing food. We started with Cavier and Belluga Vodka. For our main course we had sea scallops and halibut. We ordered a. Title of Chardonnay. Our waitress was very friendly. The Sommelier or guy who brought the bottle to the table had zero personality. He never spoke. He showed us the bottle, poured and left he never told us what he was serving, said hello or goodbye. Even when we said thank you he never responded. He was the reason I am rating 4 stars vs 5 stars. He cost them a perfect rating. Luckily my husband is a Sommelier so we didn't need his recommendations.
author: E A.

description: Excellent seafood place.  Expect to spend $100 per person for food and wine.  But well worth it.
author: Joel L.

description: I googled best unusual restaurants in SF to take my wife for her bday and this is one that came up. Decor was stunning and the lighting and ambiance excellent. Service was mediocre and that is being generous. The waiter, Paul, tried to upsell on everything. How about a glass of Champagne to start the evening? No Paul she wants a glass of Chardonnay. As he attempted to leave the table I said are you taking our drink order because we didn't tell you the wine we want? he says....that's no on the champagne? We thought huh? Does he have a hearing problem and is this comped because we told the restaurant  this is my wife's bday? Finally we relented only  to learn that it cost an extra $43, He still left without taking my drink order, and upon ordering he asked us if we wanted crab on our entree. We said no. Are you sure he asked? So that's no? Do I really have to repeat myself constantly with this guy? I said no. My wife received crab on her entree and we thought, screw it, let's just get through this. The bill showed another $25 for crab bringing her entree to $62. The back waiter brought the food and stumbled through a description of the entree before Paul interrupted him. Ugh, is this the B team tonight because it is Sunday? We passed on dessert even though this was my wife's bday. To their credit there was a card on the table when we arrived announcing her bday. All total the bill came to $260 and to top it off my wife got back to the St Francis hotel and threw up. We think it was the oysters? I was fine but a bit queasy the next morning.
author: Brad Tittle D.

description: We had dinner here last night before a performance at ACT's Geary Theatre.  The restaurant is within walking distance to the theatre. Have to say that we had a fabulous meal.  We both had the butter poached Sturgeon with asparagus, chanterelles and a slow cooked egg.  It was so delicious, well presented and cooked perfectly.  I had a nice glass of Gruner Veltliner, which I love and which isn't available everywhere.  My husband had a glass of the Zinfandel.  We shared a scrumptious white chocolate mousse cake with fresh and candied citrus and a blood orange granita dessert. Our server was very attentive and we were set for the rest of a wonderful evening at the theatre!  We will certainly go back again!!
author: Carol B.

description:
I loved the Gaudi interior design of this restaurant. Feels like I'm dining in a underwater world. Came here for dinner and was not too impressed. The fish was cooked right, surely.. but there was no innovation in a dish. I docked some stars off because 2 of the fish on the entree (and there werent that many to begin with) were sold out by 9pm. That's just poor planning and preparation. Also, the appetizers are extremely overpriced for what it is. Tiny portions too (ie. 1 scallop in the appetizer... ONE).

I think its important to note that this place probably has the best carrot cake i've ever eaten in my life... and I don't usually like carrot cake. It was soooo moist and sticky and buttery!
author: Betty T.

description:
Disappointed.
Service, food...all disappointing. 
Warming...a long tale of sorrow awaits.

I've had great experience on other times but last night was downright terrible. So terrible, my friends and I went out to another dinner afterwards.

First, sitting: hostess  sat us in the corridor when the main dining room had plenty of tables.  When we requested to sit us there, the hostess replied "they don't have a table for 3." She only moved us after we I insisted we originally had a reservation for 4. It shouldn't be that hard. 

Second, food: everything missed the mark except for the raw oysters. Dishes were over salted or not enough flavors. We ordered a dozen oysters, 4 appetizers, 1 cod dish, and a bottle of wine. Only the wine didn't disappoint us.

Third, service: we ordered foie gras. It came with a ring of plastic saran wrap still wrapped around it. When we spoke with the server, he apologized but then added someone forgot to remove it after they sous vide. Really!?!? Why would you sous vide foie gras in the first place?  It looked like they sliced a piece from a tubular ring of pate.

Manager later came to apologize. He offered to redo the dish.  We said, "No thank you.  We weren't interested in eating anymore." He offered again and clarified that he wouldn't charge us. Really?!?! I think when an restaurant of this range (not a mom & pop joint) screws up like this, it's a given they replace the dish - and comp it. He made it like he was doing us a favor. 

All in all, perhaps it was an "off day" but what is the likelihood of service, food, and experience all being off?
author: Yam Yam C.

description: Steve was great!  Royal Tower was AMAZING. Drinks so good.  Decor so cool.  Definitely will eat here again.
author: Kathryn R.

description:
Farallon, you had me at JELLYFISH BAR.  

If you have an affinity for Jellyfish, don't miss their awesome bar - it will rock your world.  As for the food, I only come here for Happy Hour (dinner might be a little fancy for me) and it is always fabulous.  Dollar oysters until 6 and they are GOOD.  Plus they make a mean Manhattan and other classic cocktails of your liking.  If you're looking for a good HH spot after work or near all the hotels, this is a great choice.
author: Lindsey G.

description:
Great service. Great cocktails. Nice wine selection. 
Seafood was fresh and delicious. Add good company, couldn't ask for more!!!
author: Natalie C.

description: Fantastic service, Freddy is the best.  Love the food and super fresh oysters!
author: Mrs. L.

description:
I ate here due to a recommendation by a conceirge. I was looking for a unique restaurant with great food.
The interior was very creative and interesting and the food and service were great.
I ordered the soft shell crab appetizer, which I wasn't sure I would like. It was a very pretty presentation and tasted good. It tasted like good potato fried chips or french fries with sauce and tomatoes that cut through the potato taste.
I also ordered the halibut dish which was also very good.

If you are looking for a good restaurant with creative and delicious food in a creative environmnent then this is the place.
author: Funtime P.

description:
This is a beautiful restaurant 
The night started perfect in the bar
The problem stared when we got to the table. The service was one of the worse service I ever had. We had a tasting menu for dinner and it took 2 hrs for the server to bring all the food. Do the math is 6 small plates in 2 hrs(20 min between plates). In addition to this some of the plates that were supposed to be hot arrived late. And the worse was that I had to ask for the wine twice I didn't get it
author: Gabriel M.

description: The Service at Farallon was outstanding. The waitstaff was more than accommodating.  I had my 2.5yr old son with a small wedding group and I can't say enough how accommodating they were. The food was wonderful.  The atmosphere was great. I would absolutely return and recommend this to others to dine.  I was extremely impressed with the whole waitstaff, was a wonderful experience!
author: Christina B.

description: still very good we brought our kids this time my daughter and me had filet of beef with crab meat on top very good . my son had sable fish .my husband had scallops . my husband and I had prawn soup it was tasty ! my son and daughter split steak tartar with pomegranate and bone marrow . we all had desserts I had macaroons with pecans . my daughter had banana bread with pumpkin ice cream .  my son had chocolate mousse cake with pomegranate on it my husband had some kind of pasty shells with ice cream.
author: Nellie J.

description:
Oh to M to the GEE!!!

Sis took me here for one of our impromptu dinner and wowzers... I became a fan!!! 

First of all... the attire requirement wasn't uber shi shi. I mean there was hippie eating on our right side... gotta love the Bay Area!

Ambiance: I felt like I was back in the 80s - think Pulp Fiction with the diner booth like with starfish on top. It's quirky alright! 

Service: prompt... the servers didn't like to smile... or maybe they were just having an off night but for the most part, no one gave us a genuine smile, it was one of those "fake" smiles.

Food: oooh la la! 

- 1/4 OUNCE OF AMERICAN PADDLEFISH CAVIAR = perfect size, perfectly made, left my mouth wanting for more!!!

- LEMON SCENTED JUMBO ASPARAGUS slow cooked egg, sausalito springs watercress, brioche croutons  = DELICIOUS!!! The whole dish was just perfectly made, perfect taste! The size was just right and everything literally just melted in my mouth. Wow. Definitely, highly, recommend this dish!

- SEARED MEDITERRANEAN BRANZINO butter braised king trumpet mushrooms, sweet snap peas, wild mushroom consume = ordered this b/c I never had a "branzino" before... and now I have. This was just okay... I think I hyped it up way to much in my head due to my first course. I didn't end up finishing this... 

- CHOCOLATE BITES milk chocolate peanut butter pavé, bittersweet chocolate truffle, dark chocolate caramel, chocolate macaroon = The only thing I didn't get to taste was the chocolate truffle... but the rest was good... not mind blowing but decent. Still a fan of Quince's petit fours... 

- Mai Tai 1944 (or was it the other way around?) but damn, that is NO JOKE of a cocktail! Strong... with character... will definitely make an impression. 

Overall... THANK YOU SIS for another awesome dinner experience!!! Definitely a fan!!!
author: Cath M.

description:
Beautiful interior decor down to the very smallest detail. Staff were very attentive and friendly. Sommelier was informative and his suggestions were good.
We are at 5 stars so far.
The food; presented beautifully. Taste was off in nearly every presentation (sorry). Seafood prepared was under seasoned. A bit more salt would have opened up alot. Foams are either killer good or just bad. Ours was not killer good.  Really disappointed in the preparation of the veal cheeks. It was like a two bite chicken-fried steak, not fried well. Very oily.  Ab was very good. New York strip steak?  It was a definite under performer, gristly without flavor. Halibut was dry and that killed it for me. 
I am sorry for the poor review on the food. We were hoping for amazing and got ok.
author: Tiger F.

description:
ONE
DOLLAR 
OYSTERS

*swoon*

Excellent service too. Note my fellow cheapskates, the Diet Cokes are $5 a pop!
author: Lisa T.

description: This is my second visit here during my SF stay. Excellent food. Excellent service that exceeded my expectations: I've asked for certain accommodations with my desert and my wishes came true. I'd come back here time and again!
author: L R.

description:
We celebrated our 20 yr Anniversary,  we were not disappointed.  Service was exceptional Tara was very knowledge about menu. I had the Hawaiian Ono, my husband had the pork chop.  

Dessert was strawberry shortcake and Nutella cake:))
author: cathy f.

description: Went for happy hour, which was a good value. Bar felt awkward, service was not attentive. Overall nice but seems like a has-been place. Good quality food.
author: Andrew K.

description:
The meal started off slow as we waited 15 mins for water, but picked up after the dishes started flowing. This place is known for seafood, but they seemed to cover all the bases outside of seafood. 

Duck confit was amazing! They have Caviar Service which was cool. Seems like a staple of the restaurant. I only wish our server knew the menu better. Apparently they change it every week. 

Bottom line is I loved the place and would go back.
author: Ryan R.

description:
Went for dinner with my wife.  The food is good and so is the service.  But nothing stood out as exceptional.  For a $300 meal (with drink) I want to say, "I will happily come back for (whatever)".  Not the case with Farallon.  Had our meal been half priced...I'd still be shrugging my shoulders and using an unenthusiastic voice to say... "yeah, it was pretty good".

Maybe will try the happy hour? Nah, don't like spending too much time around Union Square.
author: Zoran L.

description:
I think  Farallon is one of the best restaurants in the City! 
The staff is superb, the food is amazing, the cocktails and wines are fantastic and the food to dye for.
author: Shelley H.

description:
I have a slight obsession with jellyfish so this place was like a dream come true. Fine wine selections led to us buying a bottle. The presentation was excellent. It was fun watching the open kitchen but sometimes it was a bit distracting from my conversations at the table. I went here a while back so I don't remember my exact plate. I do remember that everyone was full, happy and broke afterwards. Pretty expensive menu, but well worth it!

I would definitely come here again for a romantic date instead of dinner with friends.
author: Radostina S.

description: Stopped by here for the Union Square Food+Art event. The restaurant is gorgeous! The hostess at the front as well as the chefs were friendly and welcoming and the food (ahi tuna appetizers) were even yummier! I'll be back sometime for a full meal!
author: Sylvia Y.

description:
Was going to give it 3 stars, but....

Wife and I came here as our diet's over reward. We pulled up out front, handed the keys to the valet and went to enjoy the evening. 

Cocktails were slow coming. Bad start.  I liked mine and she liked hers. I didn't like hers, and she didn't like mine. That's ok.

6 oysters. They came with a champagne vinegar only. We had to ask for horseradish and tabasco. 

We had the egg drop soup and sturgeon for appies. Each of us liked one of them.

We shared the lobster and the fillet (i.e. make your own surf and turf). Fillet was fine. Lobster was doused with bernaise sauce, so much so, that you could hardly taste the lobster (or tell that it was overcooked).

Desert (carrot cake) was so healthy-tasting it felt like it came from Whole Foods. We didn't come here for that; we go to Whole Foods when we want it to taste healthy.

The bill was just over $350 with an 18% tip.

The next morning we noticed the valet had curb-rashed 1/3 of the rear rim. I called the restaurant to report this. They didn't return my call. I called again a day later. They gave me the phone number of the valet company they "contract out". So now it's my problem. 

So now this 1 star review is their problem.
author: Steve T.

description: I've been visiting this restaurant since it opened. In all that time, it has never disappointed. It's a great spot for just about any occasional. Formal, without being pretentious, the food is excellent; as is the service.
author: William O.

description: It wasn't as great as I thought or expected it to be. The 69 dollar appetizer was not even good and the lobster salad was disgusting
author: Sareen K.

description: I was very disappointed with our dining experience. The food from the raw bar was excellent but everything else after that was downhill. We were served our main course before our appetizers. Then when they realized their mistake, they tried to make up it to us by serving room temperature soup. We waited forever for the appetizer for finally come out. The halibut was dry and the duck was the worst I have ever eaten.  Their dessert menu was unimpressive. Overall service was poor for what you would expect from a 5 star restaurant. I would definitely not come back and would not recommend this restaurant to any of my friends or family.
author: Elisa J.

description: I tried to call them multiple times to make a reservation and I  had no luck with anyone answering the phone..this is terrible service for an expensive restaurant like this. Don't think I will waste my time since they will not answer the phone.
author: Ramona W.

description:
Review only for happy hour at bar
Health Score - 98 - sfscores.com

Food - 4 stars - happy hour oysters (6 for $7) were fresh and delicious. House made hot sauce was a winner as well. HH Wine selection was decent too.

Service - 4 stars - bar folks were pleasant and attentive. 

Ambiance - 3 stars - good central location to downtown. Décor made me think of Disney's the little Mermaid or 20,000 leagues under the sea meets art deco.  Cute but campy. 

Overall Guide
5 Stars - have already made next RSVP
4 Stars - definitely returning
3 stars - would return but not first choice
2 stars - would only return if friends insisted
1 star  -  nope
author: Lille L.

description:
I have been a fan of Farallon since I had my wedding dinner here back in 2007. I have dined in the private rooms and the restaurant and always thought the food was exquisite.

I ate there last night with friends and it was a complete joke.

Don't get me wrong the restaurant is beautiful and we had the corner table in the back. The company was great, the service and the wine were fantastic. The food made me angry. I don't really take pics of my food these days but I wish I had.

1) Chilled Louisiana Prawns - There are many places to have chilled prawns in this city, the 2-3 inch long, cold, crisp, fresh kind. As one of my favorite appetizers I was super excited. What we got looked like 4, 1 inch Trader Joes's frozen shrimp, overcooked and covered in chili sauce. $19.5

2) Hawaiian Ahi Tuna Sashimi -  another favorite in a city with great access to fish. Long white plate with 3 jaggedly sliced dollops of tuna. Nothing special $19.5

3) Little Gems Lettuces - 4 Whole lettuce leaves piled on top of each other, lightly dressed. $14

4) Roasted Heirloom Beet Salad -lavender ricotta, petite arugula, pumpkin seed emulsion - I am not sure about those other ingredients but I am sure someone sliced exactly one beet with a razor and served it to me. $15

I don't want to speak for my friends but the Trio of Shellfish included what appeared to be popcorn shrimp, lobster tail that was so tough it had to be forcibly released from it's shell, and approximately the amount of crab one might spike a deviled egg with. The grilled Tombo tuna was not terrible but also completely unremarkable.

I am ok with small portions and higher prices when there is care, creativity, and excellence in the food. This just made me feel sad and duped, as if I was supposed to feel"fancier" for being served next to nothing.

San Francisco has so much better.
author: J A.

description: Best Scallops i ever had !!! Cocktails were perfect and inventive. Sounds funny but the best butter i ever had too - covered in Hawaiian sea salt - incredible !!! A Lovely, upscale, special occasion, dressy Restaurant with Ocean theme, a bit touristy but it' Union Square SF. Service was a little slow, especially in the cocktail lounge area, but we loved everything !
author: Barbie C.

description: The restaurant was wonderful. The environment, the service, the food and the experience was phenomenal. I was skeptical because the portions were smaller than a typical restaurant for the price, though I expected it from a very fancy establishment. However, I was surprised to not be left hungry, very satisfied and it was not as expensive as we thought it would be. I would go back for sure. I would recommend it for special occasions or a special date night.
author: Edgardo V.

description: For a 'bucket list' restaurant and the price, we were left disappointed. We started with the fruits de mer: lobster claws, clams, oysters prawns, and crab + caviar with traditional accompaniments. The caviar (osetra and sturgeon) was great, I just wasn't a fan of the Russian blini's, which were dark and a bit dry. The lobster claws were sweet and delicious. From there, things went downhill. The crab chowder had good flavor, but about 1 bite of crab meat. The scallops had good flavor with butternut squash puree and balsamic reduction, some of the brusselsprout leaves were raw (intentionally) and just too tough to eat. One of us had the petrale sole and was very disappointed, she didn't even want to eat it. The presentation was awful and it lacked flavor all together. Desserts were larger than expected and well plated, but were mediocre. Service was pretty good, until they did nothing about the entree, promptly departed the table without taking everyone dessert/coffee order, and didn't honor our free dessert offer.
author: Amanda B.

description:
Impeccable service. Relaxing yet majestic ambience. Excellent food. The grape juice was other worldly.

Good choice for special occasions.
author: Mojahedul H.

description:
We wanted a good meal.....celebrating our anniversary....and wanted to try something new. 

So glad we found this new favorite.

We split the crab rissotto. Oh my.....wanted to order another one but had already ordered our entrees!

We also split the  tuna/scallop appetizer and I had the tuna entree. 

Hubby got the beef tartare.


And it being our anniversary we shared three desserts...carrot cake whoopie pie (not your average carrot cake!!), cheescake, and toffee cake with dates.

Over the top fabulous.

Would order the exact same things next time....well maybe one extra dessert.

Service was also excellent......we will be back before our next anniversary!!!
author: Dani K.

description:
I'm a native New Englander who loves seafood, so I was very excited about visiting Farallon -- and I was not disappointed.  The interior decor is beautiful, with jelly fish and sea urchin lights, and shell shaped chairs.  The ceiling is vaulted and beautiful -- I was definitely impressed by the set-up.

The staff is extremely polite and courteous -- great, kind, intelligent, and helpful people.  Knew their stuff for sure.

We ordered the "Grand Platter" as an appetizer and it was delicious!  Big enough to split among our party of 3.  Included giant shrimp, half a lobster, oysters, and crab meat.  The oysters were so good we ended up ordering 4 more!  Great presentation, and delicious -- the platter was definitely my favorite part.

I ordered the prawn entree -- and it was good, but not as good as the appetizers.  I honestly would have just preferred to split another "Grand Platter."  

This restaurant is on the high-end price wise, expect high prices for sure.  But if you're like me, and miss that New England/East Coast Seafood -- might be worth a try.
author: Michelle S.

description:
Was in SF for my wife's birthday and she wanted to go here after hearing about it from a friend. After reading a few of the reviews my family agreed to give it a try.

We made a reservation and arrived on time. The table was ready and we were seated right away. I felt like the waiter was a little rushed for a fine dining place. I am always in a hurry so this usually does not bother me but it does bother my wife and since it was her day I have to mention it. 

We were a little surprised at the small menu and the large prices. I would love to go into detail about what we had and how it tasted but after 4 days I have no recollection other than it was overpriced and under seasoned. We were in and out in about 75 minutes and I felt like I was pick pocketed. The bill was $345.00 tip included and that only included 2 cocktails and no appetizers.

It was really not memorable in any way.
author: Mark M.

description:
3.5 stars.  Had reservations for an early Sunday din.  The place was packed.  Took a few minutes for us to be seated even with reservations.  The decor and underwater theme is cool, kinda fancy 80s-90s feel to it.

Service:
I was expecting impeccable service, but the service was just good.  Nothing over the top, maybe because it was just my friend and I. 
Was a little turned off when the waiter tried to upsell me into buying a small bottle of champagne for $60 instead of 2 glasses for $28. If I was a guy on a date with my lady, I would have felt like a cheap ass, luckily it was just me and my homegirl. 
The bread guy was a little stingy too.  He offered me bread, I declined but at just 2 pieces each, my friend said she would have mine, and the bread guy seemed weird about this.  Maybe it was just a miscommunication. 

Food:
Sparkling wine was fantastic and went great with the chilled lobster.  The Louisiana Prawns were nothing special for $19 and would probably opt for oysters should I ever go back.  My friend got the cod dish which sounded great, but was slightly cool when it arrived at the table.  Side of roasted beets were yummy, but the potato gratin was meh. 

ProTip: They have valet parking for $13.
author: Chelsey G.

description:
Alas, the great Farallon has fallen! 

Party of 9 reserved for my birthday. The food was very inconsistent. Dismal even. Oysters good, caviar mediocre. Other fruits de mer (despite the gorgeous presentation) lacking, sadly. 

FIVE entrees sent back for being raw, cold, or worse. We don't do that! It was embarrassing- I think everyone was cynical and it was so late into the night at this point 

BUT Service was great, (aside from being seated over an hour late). Really nice hostess, servers, busser, sommelier, maybe manager?

They were very gracious about taking back the food. They offered (we accepted) after dinner drinks on the house. So one star for the most beautiful restaurant in SF, one for service. $$$$ for perilously bad food on a Saturday! So unfortunate.

I need to find a new place for special occasions.
author: Rachel D.

description:
Ballin' on a Budget - Christmas Edition.

As one of the most beautiful and romantic restaurants in San Francisco with a whimsical underwater ambiance serving sophisticated French influenced coastal cuisine, Farallon has been on my mental list for years.

However, with Christmas just around the corner, most of us are strapped for cash which means a fancy schmancy dinner is out of the question unless you have a sugar daddy or a padded expense account. I have neither.

*Furiously starts sugarbaby4u.com profile*

I. Am. Just. Kidding.

Thankfully Farallon has one of the best Happy Hour deals with a "Six Until Seven" menu available every day from 4:30pm -7pm that will allow you to experience the enchanting atmosphere and get a taste of the delectable seafood offerings without Mr. Amex giving you the one finger salute at the end of the month. 

For 90 minutes, Mr. NSS and I sat at one of the three tables in the Jellyfish Lounge (bar and seafood bar seating also available) and took advantage of the $6 HH specials. Do note that the crowd is mainly comprised of tourists and older elites as to be expected in Union Square. No eyecandy, go figure.

We started HH indulging into the BEST $1 Little Skookum Oysters (http://bit.ly/11RPig2) I've ever had. They were so deliciously creamy and sweet that my mouth begged for another dozen but we were ballin' on a budget here so I reluctantly resisted. Like a fresh gulp of the ocean, the Steamed Little Neck Clams (http://bit.ly/UjbpEx) were amazingly plump and sweet. The buttered grilled levain bread was perfect for sopping up the savory white wine broth with smoky bits of chorizo. I can never say no to truffle anything so we also ordered the Truffled Kennebec Fries (http://bit.ly/ReuMEe) which could have been crisper throughout but the heavenly earthy aroma was intoxicating and the taste addicting. If seafood is not your thing, there's also Beef Sliders, Potato Croquettes, and House Made Charcuterie on the $6 HH menu.

None of the 4 cocktails or 4 wines on the $6 HH menu tickled my fancy so I ordered The Aviation (http://bit.ly/UKeIZX). At a pricey $13.50, the gin based citrusy cocktail with maraschino liquor was small but packed a great punch. After just one, I forgot about our ballin' on a budget and ordered another. Bad idea.

$93 later (for two) no longer were we "ballin' on a budget"... we (I) were just B-R-O-K-E.

Oh well, I guess I'll have to do some re-gifting for my Secret Santa gift (Kinda NSFW): http://www.shopinprivate.com/kitty-carpet-merkin-blonde.html.

I hope they and their partner like a black kitty. *Fingers crossed*
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
You know San Francisco - you are such a tease sometimes.  You lure me into your fancy seafood joints for your lower than should be happy hour prices in your overly touristy districts.    And sometimes, sometimes, you don't tease.  Farallon, you delivered.

Came in here for Happy Hour.  $1 oysters and other cheap fare to be had.  Now, again, in this area a $1 oyster is nice, but not uncommon.  Unlike it's peers, Farallon shucks your oyster to order.  Yes, that equally fancy place by the Embarcadero pre-opens the oysters and sits them in the cooler for a bit till you order them.  Not here.  Crack and open when you order.  

Now, you should note, you might not get this if you go now, but go now just in case.  Their happy hour oysters when I was there were from Drake's Bay.  Those never go on deep discount.  But, they are having some community issues and need to clear out their stock.  The winner is you, here. If you catch the wave.

If you don't, ask about the oyster list.  They had Olympia oysters too (not on special).  Olympias are hard to find and are also one of the only native west coast oysters you'll ever encounter...or did you think Kusshi and Kumamoto were old Chinook or Miwok names?  There's a restoration effort in Seattle and in San Francisco to bring back the locals (so to speak) after they were over eaten 15 decades ago. 

Aside from that, the sous chef who was passing by suggested a few things...all of them amazing: line caught ahi, domestic shrimp, delicious & perfect fries, and yummy pastries.  It made us all very happy in the lounge.    

A full dinner here awaits me very soon.
author: David S.

description:
I just had dinner last night at Farallon with 3 other girlfriends to celebrate our friend's birthday. I had picked Farallon for the occasion as we were staying nearby at the Clift and the birthday girl loves seafood. Prior to last night's dinner I had visited Farallon once, however, only for happy hour. Remembering the beautiful decor, I had been wanting to return.

For dinner we shared (2) bottles of white Argentinian wine which was excellent - Alvarinho, Casa do Valle, Vinho Verde, Portugal 2014 at $38/bottle. Their wine list is very extensive and ranges from bottles at around $35 and up. Score! A nice restaurant with decent priced wines. 

For dinner I had the Green Curry - last night's version had a stick rice, Dungeness crab, prawns, and scallops. Absolutely delicious. Enough said. 

Overall, great experience. Good service, beautiful atmosphere and great food.
author: Tiffany K.

description:
My honey of nearly 4yrs surprised me for our anniversary with a FABULOUS dinner and great service this evening.  Chris, our server already was informed of my food allergies and made sure the kitchen prepared my meal just as I needed it. 
The decor is beautiful and elegant with comfortable seats which supports my bad back.

I highly recommend Farallon for nice fine dining.
Enjoy!
author: Nikcole L.

description:
Haven't eaten at Farallon for awhile and I'm afraid things have changed but not for the better.  This is my 2nd poor dining experience recently at a prior "favorite" restaurant and I don't like the trend.

My GF and I were seated in an odd alcove in the main dining area surrounded by large tables.  This was fine until those tables were filled, after which the noise in the dining room became almost deafening when combined w/the noise coming from the kitchen.  My GF and I were able to carry on a conversation w/o shouting but the noise coming from throughout the room was distracting and not conducive to an intimate setting.  I prefer to be seated in the balcony over lobby, which is much quieter, but it was not open this evening.

The other problem w/the table we got was that our waiter also had to serve several other large tables near us - I counted 2 tables of 8 each - which understandably distracted him from taking care of us.  We were not ignored but because our waiter was almost always busy elsewhere we were served by a variety of other servers that reminded me of a wrestling tag team. Our water and champagne glasses were constantly filled but it was amusing to see who would be doing the job next.

As for the food it was a huge disappointment, which was a first for me.  My GF wasn't hungry and only ordered a kampachi sushi and a lobster salad.  Those dishes were ok but the portions were so small that it wasn't even filling for her.  The portions were so small that I would have thought that I was eating at the old Michael Minna at the St Francis but for the noise and the less than elegant plating of the food.

I ordered the scallops for an appetizer and the snapper filet for the entree.  The scallops looked good but they were WAY to salty.  Didn't want to make a fuss and ate them anyway.  The snapper was also WAY too salty and also had a vinegar dressing in the dish which was as startling as it was unappetizing.  The dish also had a mound of finely chopped mushrooms on it which I had to dissect in order to figure out what it was.  My GF liked it but I found it tasteless and incompatible w/the fish.  For desert we shared some sorbet which was ok. 

The final amusement of the evening came when we were about done and our original server mysteriously appeared and then tried to fill our glasses w/some wine belonging to an adjoining table. We were having champagne and the champagne glasses were still on the table but he still tried to pour a regular white wine in them anyway.. He should have known the difference on sight.  Stopped him in time.

Not sure what to make of this experience.  Maybe it was just a bad night but at the price of $250 for a modest dinner for 2, I'm not inclined to give them a 2nd chance.  $200 dinners like $200 theater tickets unfortunately are the norm now but my expectations for dining and entertainment at these prices are now also much higher and, at least based on this experience, Farallon unfortunately longer meets mine.
author: Martin C.

description: The interior of this restaurant is great , although I don't see how it's underwater design but the jellyfish lights r creative and fun to look at. One of the best decors for a restaurant. Price is not that crazy, HH offers great value for money. We walked in without reservation during happy hour and ordered snacks and drinks before being seated for dinner. Service was good but not as great as the environment. Food is okay, a little too salty at times.
author: Zheng W.

description: Decent but overpriced food. Our server (British dude) was terrible. Took him forever to take our order. Even longer to get bread. Very inattentive. Would take our empty drink glasses and walk away without asking if we wanted something else. We were never served the amuse-bouche all the other tables were given. An hour after being seated, our dinners still hadn't arrived. The cheesecake, though..... DELICIOUS (& gluten free!).
author: Cara C.

description:
I love this place : the decoration is amazing and so original !
I particularly like the happy hour at the bar : very good oysters and cocktails :-)
I recommend !
author: Arnaud M.

description:
Delicious for a late reservation,
  On the busy market streets, after a meeting with the board. We were quite tired and set up a reservation for the hall. The service was wonderful and the most happy manager around. Without a doubt, Amazing for the price.
author: William A.

description: We sat at the bar for the happy hour menu. The bartender (Jaime) was amazing. The cocktails were wonderful. The food was delicious. I was very impressed and would definitely revisit. This is a place you don't want to miss.
author: Rena T.

description: I always have a great experience at the Farallon. The service is always prompt, warm and informative. The food is always sumptuously prepared and I usually always get my favorite table. Be prepared to drop some hard earned cash tho. Nice place to impress business partners or take a special someone.
author: Rob R.

description:
Cleanliness: 100% The restaurant was really clean.
Staff: Very accommodating when I asked for a booth.
Food: Fresh and very tasty. Oysters were really good, better than I expected.
Parking: It's hard so I recommend to park two blocks away and the little walk wasn't bad.
Ambiance: Very not load but wasn't too quiet either.
Drink: Wine program is very extensive and the mix drinks options were pretty good.
Observation: Even though it's a Sea Food Restaurant the have other great options.
Cost: Expensive but places like this in SF. NY, LA. WA are like this so I did not surprised me.
Opportunities: Service could be a little faster, food took longer than I expected and drinks too. It definitely looked busy, but they should have extra staff during peak hours.
author: Joe R.

description:
I definitely enjoyed the whimsical sea themes.
Drinks are strong & delicious.
Food is ok, not much flavor and nothing that'll blow your mind away. Definitely had tastier sea food dishes elsewhere.
To be honest the tastiest thing I had was the spoons.

Overall it wasn't too bad of an experience. The drinks, the decor, and being with my lover made up for it. =)
author: Rio N.

description:
In some ways, Farallon is really two separate experiences.  Arriving in the lounge and oyster bar area, you're treated to the floating jellyfish lighting and quirky artwork (a hard-hat diver sketching a duck--ridiculous but I love it).  Custom cocktails do nothing but enhance the dreamlike atmosphere.  For dinner, be sure to sit in the back room, which feels like a whole other world; it was previously a spectacular interior pool room for the Elk's Club.  The floor is now elevated over what used to be the pool, so the stunning ceilings can be enjoyed up close.  The food gets a solid B rating, well-prepared but not world-changing.  I was thrilled to have sablefish, a rare treat I wish was available in more restaurants.  The service was excellent and very attentive.

Reservations are clearly imperative, and expect to crack open your wallet, but our party enjoyed it immensely.
author: Andrew D.

description:
When I think of Farallon, I think of....

...jellyfish galore, a very happy happy hour, a busy happy hour, awesome bar staff and service, a few "Little Mermaid" songs, six until seven, a boat load of fresh-licious Point Reyes Oysters, truffled fries, taking pictures of fries, croquettes, some serious Rye Manhattans, beef sliders with arugula, a special short rib slider, Acme bread with salted butter, a lot of butter, steamed Littleneck clams in a garlic clam sauce with lardons, bread dipped in that garlic clam sauce, comp fried cherry pie with Kriek ice cream, an old Fonseca Tawny port, and a wonderful birthday experience (thanks to JC and Mark).  

Everything I've had during a few happy hours stood out.  And that's only scratching the surface.  I haven't even dabbled with their amazing dinner menu.  
I know I'll be back!
author: Bobby L.

description:
Beautiful decor, ok service, high quality food, but too pricy, hence the 3 star review. Main was not 40$ level. 

Very good oysters and the sea urchin/halibut/scallop entré was brilliant. Tuna ok, squid was far from great. Poor selection of wine on the glass. 

So, overall a 3.
author: Jo R.

description:
I'm a die hard happy hour gal through and through and there's something to be said about a place like Farallon, where happy hour starts as, well, "happy hour" and extends way beyond into dinner time.

What's the recipe for fan-freakin-tastic time at an under the sea atmosphere like this?

1 supremely catering and simply wonderful bar manager
2 friends catching up on life
1 George Clooney look alike patron
LOTS and LOTS of booze.  

Oh, and food of course!

The Happy Hour menu ROCKS! Everything is $6 before 7pm! From the 1/2 dozen oysters with champagne mignonette, steamed Littleneck clams in a chorizo based sauce,  croquettes, beef sliders (made with filet mignon cuts per the bar manager) and truffled parmesan fries.  As if the food wasn't enough to SHUT. ME. UP.  Mark, the bar manager, went the extra mile and introduced us to a peach flavored vodka that was just awesome. (I say this with a lot of praise since I'm not much of a vodka fan anymore) Throw in a complimentary cherry filled puff pastry dessert with cherry ice cream and 12 year Tawny port, whoa.  What did we do to deserve the royal treatment? Apparently, he saw us having too much fun with the George Clooney look alike and thought to make our evening extra fun. 

That my friends, is a formula for a HAPPY happy hour.  

Who wants to come with next time?!? ;D
author: Janice C.

description:
We were so happy with the happy hour here (5 stars!!!) that we returned 3 days later to try dinner last night. The evening started fine with delicious cocktails and the server (David) presenting the specials, which happened to be a tasting menu in honor of their 20th anniversary. We decided to try that and he left to get the menu from the chef (I guess nobody else had ordered it?) he came back and described it and then mentioned it was $225/pp! We decided to skip it. After that we became persona non grata. The main courses showed up while we eating the appetizers and my wine that was supposed to be paired with my meal was terrible. Unfortunately, not one person came back to check on us after that and David dropped off the check with a 'thanks' before running away. I mentioned that I hated the wine and it didn't go with my food and he argued with me about how hard the dish was to pair with wine (?) but they took a chance on it anyway ($25)
We thought about speaking to a manager but they didn't seem to care.
Terrible terrible experience after the epic highlight that was happy hour. The food was good but I'd Skip dinner service.
author: Mia K.

description: I googled best unusual restaurants in SF to take my wife for her bday and this is one that came up. Decor was stunning and the lighting and ambiance excellent. Service was mediocre and that is being generous. The waiter, Paul, tried to upsell on everything. How about a glass of Champagne to start the evening? No Paul she wants a glass of Chardonnay. As he attempted to leave the table I said are you taking our drink order because we didn't tell you the wine we want? he says....that's no on the champagne? We thought huh? Does he have a hearing problem and is this comped because we told the restaurant  this is my wife's bday? Finally we relented only  to learn that it cost an extra $43, He still left without taking my drink order, and upon ordering he asked us if we wanted crab on our entree. We said no. Are you sure he asked? So that's no? Do I really have to repeat myself constantly with this guy? I said no. My wife received crab on her entree and we thought, screw it, let's just get through this. The bill showed another $25 for crab bringing her entree to $62. The back waiter brought the food and stumbled through a description of the entree before Paul interrupted him. Ugh, is this the B team tonight because it is Sunday? We passed on dessert even though this was my wife's bday. To their credit there was a card on the table when we arrived announcing her bday. All total the bill came to $260 and to top it off my wife got back to the St Francis hotel and threw up. We think it was the oysters? I was fine but a bit queasy the next morning.
author: Brad D.

description:
We recently visited San Francisco and the concierge at the hotel recommended this restaurant as it was a short walk from the hotel. Down Nob Hill was OK, but they way back up will give you a work out, but I digress. We ordered the Royal Platter and it was fantastic at first it seemed pricey to me, but the quality of the seafood was out of this world.  It was outstanding. 

We also received good service and were not rushed. I would also highly recommend the Kale Salad.
author: Richard J.

description: Service was perfect, food amazing. Had the sturgeon poached in butter and sea scallops. Seafood appetizer is a must get...fresh and yummy. If you want an upscale meal with an all around great experience don't miss this place.  Will be back next time we are in town.
author: Calley D.

description:
We were in town for just a night and decided to go to here for a steak and some seafood. We had reservations but still had to wait for a lil, no big deal. Got seated, our server was David. Started with cocktails; I got the bone marrow and my Bf got oysters as apps--both were decent. Then my Bf ordered the filet mignon and I got the half moon bay fish for our entrees and the sole pie for dessert. Our appetizers came, we finished them as another couple right across from us got their entrees. As time passes by we noticed the other couple already finished their entrees and our's were nowhere in sight... I said to my Bf I'm gonna wait another 10 mins and if no one comes by and it's not almost ready I'm gonna ask to cancel as we have been waiting for a while and it's already getting so late. And yes 12 mins passes by my Bf got our severs attention and we noticed he was standing there talking to another employee, so the other gentleman who happened to be the assistant manager came by our table. My boyfriend said to him "it's been a while do you know the status of our entrees?" Scott the assistant manager rudely responded in very confrontational and CONDESCENDING manner "um how long is a while?" Then my Bf said "it's been a while" he then interrupted and said "well what does a while mean". He didn't even apologize but just started questioning us instead. I was perplexed by his demeanor and response. So I said, "it's been longer than 30 mins since we've finished our appetizers at least and I've been looking at my phone non-stop awaiting for an acknowledgement or update." Then he put his hand up and said hold on let me check then walked away.  When he came back and said they're finishing up and it's coming out shortly. I was very disturbed so I told him I did not appreciate the way he responded to us and that it was extremely rude, condescending and disrespectful. 

We go out to eat a lot and travel very often. We are pretty easy going and not the type to complain; however, this is extremely unacceptable. I have never been to any restaurant that would talk and respond to customers the way the assistant manager Scott at Farralon did. I did bring this to our server David's attention and he did apologize for it. I also want to mention the fact that when we told Scott about the delay of our food he never once apologized. I get it we all have bad days but responding to us the way he did was beyond disrespectful. 
Overall the food was great, but unfortunately I am distraught with the experience and that has ruined it. We talked about it for the rest of our time there and the next day and I'm still upset, disturbed and offended by it. 
We're in sf all time and are frequent guests with The Grand Hyatt and was really hoping that Farralon would be a reg place for us, but unfortunately our experience at Farralon has left the worst bitter taste my mouth. Again, it is unacceptable the way Scott disrespected us.
author: Linn H.

description: Wow...what a disappointment. We hadn't been here for a year or two, but what a downturn. We had a 5:30 reservation, and people who had just walked in off the street got seated before us. Really? And the jerk up front greeting people didn't have an answer why. The menu? Reduced to NEXT to nothing! 5 or 6 dinner entrees? Are you kidding me? That's not a menu, that's a fast food restaurant bill of fare. McDonald's has more choices. We will never eat here again. The space is still beautiful, but the memory of a great dining experience is GONE. Shame on them!
author: Lance G.

description: This place was recommended by multiple friends.  I'll just get to the meaty parts of the evening.  The service was defiantly a little slow for my taste but overall a great overall ambiance.  My wife commented on the decor several times.  I started with the lobster soup and it was a great starter.  I decided on the filet for dinner and usually I am a ribeye guy all day.  But I must say if all filets were all this good I might change my mind.  You could have easily cut it with a butter knife.  We ended  with the hazelnut chocolate brownie and my wife said it was the best part of the meal.
author: Joey H.

description:
I'm from Seattle, but genes are from San Francisco. Farallon on the food alone, would be a typical 3 star Seattle fish house.  But by national standards, outstanding.  But PNW standards, run of the mill.  

But whats astonishing about Farrallon is the wine list.  Specifically the selection of German, Austrain and Alsace wines.  They get two stars for this alone.  The full range of German sweetness represented.  And even offer a flight menu starting with cloying bitter troken ending with a stunning trockenbeerenauslese.  Wow.  And Austrian selection that my Austrian guest were floored by.  Very, very nice.

Service was kind of slow.  Not super attentive.  One of my pieces of lobster tasted funky.  Clams reminded me of eating stuff I was told in Indian Guides not not eat unless I wanted my stomach pumped.  The crab Louie wast artsy fartsy but excellent.  All the main courses were killer.
