We sat at the bar and had drinks not very busy and had to waive down the bar tender for service every time . The martinis were good. They came chilled with a big ice cube and great blue cheese stuffed olives.  They sat us ordered another martini it came warm not near as good as the ones I had at the bar. They forgot my wife's wine so had to re order that. Service was not good always had to look for our waitress . I ordered 4 appetizers. Oysters , French onion soup , tuna, octopus. The only one to mention is the tuna very good the others OK.  Good thing we ordered 4 apps the main dish's are small and again ok. For the price and the reputation of finest seafood restaurant in San Fran it fell way short . Wouldn't go back. Price doesn't bother me  but it better be worth it and it by far was not worth it.
author: DR M.

description:
I have been wanting to come here for a while because I saw pictures of the jellyfish chandeliers and thought it was amazing. So my boyfriend decided to take me here for my birthday.

The hostess here was very sweet. I really wanted a picture with the jellyfish chandeliers, so she helped us take a picture right underneath it. 

The food here was pretty good. I actually do not really like seafood but my boyfriend does, so I had some of his. We ordered Beausoleil oysters and they were okay. 

My boyfriend and I had two courses each. I got seared rare hawaiian ahi tuna, and the petite filet of beef. While my boyfriend got the steamed price edward island mussel and  the striped bass.

The seared ahi tuna was pretty good but I didn't like the taste of the lentils that the tuna was on top of. It tasted okay when you eat it with the tuna, but not alone. I actually liked the mussels more... actually, the soup that came with the mussel. I don't really like the taste of mussel and I thought the soup have a strong mussel taste, but it didn't. 

My filet of beef was really good, I loved it. It was really tender and cooked just the way I like it, medium rare. And the mash potatoes that came with it was delicious. The only thing that I did not like was the vegetable that came with it and the sauce under it.... I completely left that side alone after one taste.

I tried some of my bf's striped bass and tortellini, and that was pretty good too. The tortellini skin was a bit thick, but my bf said it is suppose to be like that. The striped bass was okay, but I like my beef better.

For dessert, my boyfriend had banofee sundae and I got the bittersweet chocolate malt gateau. I thought the gateau was a bit too sweet, the texture was amazing, but it was too much chocolate. I actually like the banofee sundae more, it was delicious and not too sweet. Kind of wish I ordered it instead...
author: Alicia W.

description:
Jekyll and Hyde. 

The Amazing:
Farallon's kitchen and chef are absolutely top notch. It was simply the best seafood dinner in my life. Every dish had an explosion flavor made with healthy proteins. I had the oysters, ahi tuna, crusted calamari, and ono. All the dishes were memorable and exciting.

NOTE TO MANAGEMENT, and CAUTION TO FUTURE DINERS:
The Service we received was absolutely awful for the price point. It started right from the beginning when they forgot to note a very specific instruction made via telephone reservation. Unacceptable. It continued with a server that was absent for extended periods of time. To order another bottle of wine, I had to raise my hand like a child in school. We sat for 20 minutes before finally waiving someone over to order desert. I poured almost every glass of wine. Apologies were given multiple times for lengthy delays, but they somehow continued. I love a long, drawn out dinner, but the absolute lack of attention we received was severely disappointing.

18% gratuity was automatically added to our party of 5. I hope this was not the reason that we received such terrible service. I would rather give my standard 20+% tip and receive service that matches the price point than feel forgotten.

Bottom Line: Food exceeds the price point, service falls far short.
author: Adam M.

description: We come here frequently and dine at the bar area where there a couple small tables.  Food is outstanding, innovative menu, always the freshest and highest quality ingredients.  Service has very high standards as well.  Probably the best seafood in SF.
author: Glenn S.

description: Foods are tasty. The sea style theme is beautiful, esp the lights. The service is professional. They might need a renovation tho.
author: Patricia H.

description: Everything was superb! Tasting menu delicious. Ask for Brian, he was an amazing server! Wonderful decorations, open kitchen very exciting. Perfect portion sizes for multi courses!
author: Leiby D.

description:
5 star service in an underwater fantasy?  Yes, please! 

The seafood was delicious and the dessert, out of this world.  

A San Francisco gem.
author: Debs L.

description: Royal platter is just OK, service is very bad, n awful, compared to Michelin 1-3 star ones, or even cheesecake factory
author: Tina J.

description: They have a happy hour that is awesome.  You can't beat their oyster deal.  I've gone in twice, and surprisingly, its not that packed.  It is a real steal, and I would recommend it to anyone that has time in the area after work trying to impress someone for a good deal.  I'm sure everything else there is on par.  The decor was legit.  The service was cool.  They have a raw bar there too.  I'd recommend it for sure.
author: Matthew A.

description: Great afterwork atmosphere, working local professionals, fresh oysters, seafood, great drinks!
author: Carmin W.

description: Stopped here for a drink and pre-dinner seafood apps. Great ambiance- sharp space with some trippy jellyfish-looking light fixtures.Awesome raw bar and lobster/crab choices. Servers were pleasant and attentive. It's a little on the pricey side but given the location it's not shockng.
author: Warner H.

description:
My dining experience at Farallon was nothing less than exquisite.  The service was excellent and the food was by far the best I have had.

I enjoyed a two course meal, first starting with scallops and enjoyed filet mineon as the main course.
author: Dd'z K.

description:
I am with the other reviewer who said she felt like a mermaid!  

The decor is decidedly poseidon-ish, with the jelly fish suspended from the ceiling and the fresco paintings depicting oceanic scenes...fun, funky and chic without being cold. 

I didn't have dinner, but the $6 appetizers for Happy Hour were yummy...as were the $6 cocktails. 

A really nice place to chill...
author: Marie B.

description:
What a wonderful experience!

We had trouble deciding what to get because there were so many attractive options on the menu. My wife and I finally decided on an appetizer and entree each.

Special kudos to the sommelier. We asked for some assistance with wine choices. After talking with us for about 5 minutes, he did pairings for us for each course, in half glasses so we didn't feel like we were drinking too much, and his choices were all excellent. We had him write them down for us before we left.

My wife had the sole and I had steelhead, both nicely prepared and accompanied, and left our plates cleaned - it was that good. The carrot cake was to die for, as was the recommended dessert wine.

This wasn't the cheapest dinner I've eaten, but we both agreed the good, service, and ambiance were well worth the price. I'm positive we'll return if we're in the area again.
author: Scott B.

description:
This is a difficult Yelp review because I was so excited to eat at Farallon that  I wonder if my expectations were a bit high and impossible to meet??? Nope. At $18 for one scallop, I expect decent service and good food in the very least, and Farallon failed to deliver on both. 

My BF and I are seafood lovers and couldn't wait to dig our greedy mitts into some of San Francisco Bay's finest. I had walked past Farallon on previous trips and knew my BF would be into the over-the-top undersea decor, so we checked out the menu online and were surprised to find so many good choices and daily specials. 

Our reservation was for 9:30 and we were sat rather quickly. Maybe it was because we had a last minute reservation, but they sorta shoved us in this small table in the "clam room" (doubt that is the official title, but I felt like I was eating inside the old submarine ride at Disneyland.) The main dining area was much more open and pleasant, and I was disappointed to be shoved in the little offshoot of the bar area ... but we were there for the food so we enjoyed what we could see of the amazing jellyfish lights and theme park decor. 

Things started off well with a fabulous amuse bouche sent over by the chef. A creamy goat cheese with tomatoes and onions. The first appetizer (heirloom tomatoes done three ways) was amazing and topped with a warm, creamy buratta that melted in my mouth.

We should have stopped there.

The next appetizer was a "shrimp parfait", which was essentially a bay shrimp cocktail with little flair or flavor. Definitely order something else. The BF and I had studied the menu well beforehand, and I was saving my appetite for the scallops. I LOVE scallops and agreed to share just one of them with the BF since this $18 entree was going to be my main meal. Well .... the scallops came out and to my surprise there was ONE scallop on a bed of indecipherable meat shreddings, that I assume were some sort of brisket ragu. Yes, ONE scallop. All I could really do was laugh at the absurdity of eating one scallop, and popped that plump little bugger in my mouth. Was it good? Yes, it was excellent.... but it would never order it again simply on principle. ONE scallop?


The next entree was a decently-prepared white fish that didn't wow or offend. Just average seafood fare.


We had debated ordering dessert, but at this point we were bout 2 hours into our meal and had spent at least 75% waiting for service. The service was slloooooww and not especially pleasant. It felt a bit like cafeteria service, "What do you want?"  and "Here you go." To our servers credit, she had a heinous harpy of a customer right next to us. A wrinkled old bat who screeched at the waitress that she had been waiting "5 WHOLE MINUTES" for her coffee. It was understandable that our sever wasn't as chipper as she could be, but it didn't make up for the pace of the service. We actually sat for a full 20 minutes before anyone came to take our drink order.

The total bill was a little over $150 without tip, ad we left hungry. 

Farallon is nothing special and I felt like we totally got suckered into a tourist trap. It's prime location on Union Square probably lures in more than it's fair share of out of town fools ... I just hate that we were one of them. Skip Farallon and try the Mexican eats at Colibri up the street, or Lark Steak House on Market.
author: Maija G.

description:
Love well prepared, extremely creative food presented in the most artistic displays. We have dined at Farallon several time over the past 20 years as you do pay for this high level of food preparation. Since seafood is their forte you really want to enjoy these featured dishes. However a matchbox size piece of fish for an entree is ridiculous. 4 bites at best isn't right unless this was a tasting menu. At $28 for the entree I don't think that is the intention. Other dishes in meal were likewise too small. We were not expecting Claim Jumper or Hometown buffet portions (which we don't eat at).

So go for the dramatic ambience. Phenomenal food. Great service.
author: Scott K.

description:
Here's the quick version:
- Pricey, Union Square seafood with great food
- Exceptional Happy Hour Oysters (A) - Most places underwhelm with the Happy Hour Oysters, not Farallon
- Liked the Broiled Monterey Sardines (A-)
- Very Good Grilled Flatbread (A-) - house made ricotta was awesome
- Dungeness Crab (B+) - Good, but the price, I'd rather spend a few more dollars and have King
- Seared New Zealand Tai Sanpper (B-) just ok
- Fries were ridiculous (A+)

Nice spot...the kind of place that will break out the break tray and then slip in an amuse-bouche even if you're eating dinner at the bar.

Good option if you're in Union Square and don't want to go far. Great option if you come in for happy hour.
author: Jeff F.

description: Nice restaurant and even though it's Italian seafood they accommodated 3 vegetarians with excellent dishes made on the fly. A little pricey but worth it. Excellent service. Mahalo from Honolulu.
author: Andrea S.

description:
Outstanding restaurant.  The restaurant has a very nice feel to it.  The lights are chic, the inner dining room reminds me hidden lair with its fresco tiled ceiling.  Even though the restaurant is very classy, it still has a 'comfortable' feel to it.

The service is also excellent.  Everyone is very friendly and eager to please.  

Most important:  the food was excellent.  Everything tasted great.  

Looking forward to going back.
author: Michael S.

description: One of my favorite spots - until recently.  The wait staff was forgetful (waited 40 minutes for a plate of soggy french fries) and rude (when we asked about the fries we were told we would get them when they were ready.)  The staff was clearly overwhelmed - understandable during the holiday season, but the rudeness was unforgivable.  It just spoiled the night.  We arrived at the same time as the 3 people beside us.  We all ordered at the same time, but their fries and oysters arrived within 5 minutes.  They were on their second order of oysters when our waitress was telling us our order would be ready soon (with quite a bit of exasperation in  her tone.)  We watched her go over an place the order - it was clear she'd forgotten.  A few minutes later a guy brings us a plate of oysters!?  When we said we were waiting for Fries not oysters he actually rolled his eyes!   I did not touch the fries when they finally arrived.  When we received the bill the waitress mumbled "no charge for the fries".  It was really disappointing because I love this place. It is hard to describe the bad energy and poor service in such a way that will help the reader understand why I will never go back.  Its time for an overall on the staff, or some infusion of energy and motivation from management, but whatever the solution, it was clear that to a person no one seemed to like their job.
author: Shelley B.

description:
I am a sucker for ocean themed decorations. THIS was King Triton's Dining Hall! I feel in love...forget the food. Just kidding. 

Food was alright...nothing tooooo outstanding, but still very well made. Not worth the price. One thing i did like was the sea salt butter...LOL.... 

Open kitchen which adds a nice touch the the whole restaurant. 

Service was fabulous. 

Right in Union Square, if you are looking for a romantic dinner or a place to dine.
author: Jackie W.

description:
I've been wanting to come give Farallon a try for many years. I finally took my family here on Sunday for my sister's high school celebration dinner. I made reservations for 6:15 and my family was seated way before then because they arrived early. When i got there after work our server came and made his presence with me informed us about the 5 course tasting menu they are offering. 

The food here was pretty good and the price is good. The portion is just like other fine dine restaurants, big dish small size of food. The ambiance is fun, there's jelly fish light decors and the chairs were like shells. 

We ordered the 1/2 pound chilled lobster for appetizer and 2 order of the flat breads. My sister basically killed the lobster herself, i did however took a bite of it and it was really fresh. For the main dish we had 2 orders of the grilled 1 pound lobster, Creekstone filet, and halibut. The lobster was a bit bland without any of the sauce. Really different from the chilled lobster which was good without any condiments. The grilled lobster on the other hand need the sauce to enhance the flavor. The filet was super juicy. 

For dessert we got the tiramisu sundae and the japaness cheesecake. The tiramisu has a kick of wine taste to it. The japaness cheesecake was pretty good. 

The service here is good and the food was good. Our total bill for 5 people came to $346 with tips included. Not bad at all, i will be back.
author: Jenny G.

description:
Farallon has a Happy Hour you don't want to miss.While the rest of the menu may pack a quality list of seafood galore, you don't need to break the bank to eat here. We decided to take a seat at the Jelly Fish bar which gets packed during Happy Hour. It's a small HH menu with all selections $6 so we decided to order half the menu consisting of Truffles Kennebec French Fries (for those of you that know me anything with Truffles makes my heart melt and add fries and you have me in heaven!). What's seafood without fresh oysters...1/2 a dozen for $6 is a steal so we ordered a dozen and they were delish! Their beef sliders was great with more fries and their house made charcuterie had a great selection of cured meats complete with whole grain mustard and a  petite salad.

Arrive before 7 PM for this Happy Hour Goodness! One of SF's Finest Happy Hour Menus!
author: Andrew S.

description: From the moment we walked in to the moment we stepped out we were treated so kindly that everything was an enjoyment at that point. The design of the restaurant is very beautiful and along with the food, Amazing. Oysters were great better than any I have had so far in San Francisco. The crabs and lobsters and dishes we had were great as well. The arugula salad was my choice because of how stuffed the royal platter made us. If you're in SF, Please come here and don't fall for the tourist traps anywhere else. Also, our waiter was J.D. !! Such an awesome and knowledgable guy about everything we asked him on and off the menu.
author: Izabella S.

description:
Three courses, four hours, and almost a total bust is how I'd describe my Farallon experience. During a recent business trip, my colleagues and I decided to spend our last night at Farallon where the unassuming storefront gives way to a pretty impressive and opulent interior that looks like was someone's mansion many, many years ago. We sat in the back room in the first floor and it looked like that was someone's indoor pool once upon a time.

I didn't expect the courses to be large but I didn't understand why it took four hours to serve three courses to 8 people on what appeared to be an average Friday night. I started out with a scallop carpaccio, which was OK, it tasted like scallops but just sliced thinly so it just felt kinda gimmicky. Then came the ravioli and again, considering the amount of time it took and how many were in each serving, I have to assume the pastry chefs were hand-assembling the ravioli? I was drafting a Yelp review in my head until my third course came and that's when Farallon entered the gates of my taste buds' heaven.

A pork chop, seared just a touch above rare with enough marbling to get a nice mouthful combination of meat and fat with each bite, flanked by sauerkraut and beets is bestowed upon me. How could I say 3 stars to what's likely one of the best porkchops I've ever had? For dessert, the apple and cheddar pie intrigued me but was underwhelmed as I did not feel it struck a good balance between sweet and savory. Granted, we were told this was their first night trying this so I'm willing to give them a pass there.
author: Andre L.

description:
We came here for a nice anniversary dinner. And boy were we disappointed! 
First, the food. 
For starters we ordered the poke appetizer. The chunks were very large- not small like typical poke- and the sauce was way too sweet. We opted to go with several a la carte entrees instead of the tasting menu. 
We got the halibut, tuna and a trout trio dish. The halibut was decent, served over pork belly. It was moist and had a nice smoky flavor. The tuna was bland but edible.  The "trout trio" was horrible. It consisted of a raw, gelatinous fillet, a tough and chewy trout skin (leather laced with salt) and a half dozen tiny trout eggs. It was inedible. 
The kids had pasta and fries. They took few bites and only ate the fries. Although, the fries came with some oddly flavored mayonnaise-type sauce that did not go over well with the kids. 
On the positive side, our cocktails were quite good. 
The service: Overall, it was just mediocre- not up to the standard one would expect from such an expensive place. 

The water glasses came smelling like fish. Don't know if the glasses were dirty or they just decided to use the oyster shucking water for our drinking water. The waiter conveniently had allergies so couldn't confirm the smell- and didn't offer any assistance. We had to ask for butter for the bread. 

In general, everything took much longer than it should've - especially since the restaurant wasn't that busy. 

We decided to skip on dessert and went to North Beach for more but satisfying dinner. Oh by the way, water tasted clean and refreshing with no fishy smell.
author: Vattey L.

description: Ahh. The best part of the meal were the appetizers.  The main courses not so much.  There are better places in the city for Seafood like Gary Danko.
author: Grace C.

description:
WOW !

What a great experience combined with excellent service. The sashimi was delicious and well presented. The sea bass entree was perfect. The oyster selection was good and fresh! The goose martini was on the money!

Now on my list of favorites.....

Flash.......
author: Jack F.

description:
Heard about this place for a while, even though we know that this is in a fairly tourist area, we decided to try it out to get it over with. 

The decor is a little bit tacky, almost reminds me that I am dining in Vegas. :)

Service was attentive, though. 

They're specialized in seafood, so we ordered all seafood dishes. They were fine, but nothing extraordinary. 

It was worth the try, but probably just one-time try is enough for us.
author: Kai Y.

description: Atmosphere is very cool, food is great, portions are small and menu is simple.  Overall I enjoyed this place and would recommend for seafood lovers.
author: Joe R.

description:
Came here for a company dinner and really enjoyed both the ambiance and the service.  We had a large group (around 40 people) and were taken to a section upstairs where we were greeted by a harp player and a private bar.  The tranquility of the music was accompanied by servers that brought around various appetizers and raw oysters.  I really enjoyed the freshness of the oysters along with the rest of our crew.  

For my entree, I ordered the pan-seared white bass and it was cooked very delicately.  The seared portion of the fish added a great element to the bass and the potatoes were very flavorful.  

All in all, the group and I had a very pleasant experience dining at the Farallon and would definitely return soon.
author: Kathy F.

description: Delicious! I would have given it 5 stars except that the noise level was louder than I expected it to be. A nice restaurant where you are being completely catered to, patrons should show some decorum and not have loud conversations and loud guffaws when tables are close together. Luke, the sommelier was great - helped us choose the right wine with dinner. Started out with prawns, then dungeness crab bisque (to die for), then striped bass. I agree with Julia P. - wait staff was amazing. Table was cleared, water was poured, needs were attended to.
author: Cheryl H.

description:
This place was on fire! First of all, the ambiance was very unique and memorable. The entrace(bar/oyster bar area) reminded me of a scene from Little Mermaid. But once you go into the main dinning table, it has a classy romantic feel.

The server told us that they change the menu either every day or every week(sorry i forgot).  We each ordered different types of fish(cod, grouper & salmon). I got to try them all and they were all VERY fresh and tasty. 

The dining room was noisy so it won't be a quiet romatic dinner spot if you are seeking for that.
author: Ricky M.

description:
I had high expectations when coming here based on visits by friends and the reviews.  My bf asked me where I wanted to go for my birthday dinner, and I chose Farallon.  It pains me to give a 2 star review but here goes.

Upon arrival at the facade of the restaurant, we waited for the valet in one of the two lanes on Post St. who was no where in sight.  Since, there was no actual open space in front of the restaurant, we circled around once more not to idle on Post St. blocking traffic before calling to ask if there was an actual valet.  We were advised if we waited long enough on Post St. a valet would come to our aid.  So we gave it another shot.  They eventually rushed to park our car once several other patrons piled up behind us.

Once I entered the into the oceanic opulence of Farallon, I assumed the rest of my experience would be just as expected.  Unfortunately, I was wrong.  We were several minutes early for our dinner reservations and decided to marinate at the bar until our table was ready.  Two Grey Goose Dirty martinis please!  I was taken by surprise.  These dirty martinis consisted mostly of watered down olive juice.  How do you screw up a dirty martini?  Needless to say, we refused to order any more cocktails during the rest of our wait.

Eventually, we were led to our table which was next to the rail in front of the exposed kitchen.  As we were seated, a booth table to our left was vacant, and I asked the hostess if it was possible for us to be seated there instead.  She advised me that table was reserved.  Once we were seated, I expected four people to be seated in that booth.  However, only a white couple was seated.  I sat there pondering what the difference between their reservation and mine was.  I could only gather that either they paid extra money to be seated there or simply, we were an ethnic couple, and they weren't.  Nevertheless, this was a minor component of the conglomeration of disappointment to come.

Additionally, the adjacent table received bread and beverage before us!  (We asked for bread twice:  once to the server and the second time our requests were answered via the runner.)  Once, our bottle of wine arrived, I was mildly impressed when the wine director came to our table to discuss our wine.  (At this point, I had a glimmer of hope left for Farallon despite the sour taste of seating arrangements and initial service.)  As the night proceeded, our server was fairly attentive by removing our dishes full of shellfish discards and maintaining her affable personality.  We enjoyed  the Grand platter, baby spinach salad, caviar and grilled octopus.   At the end of our meal, she brought me a tiny dessert with a candle and "Happy Birthday" drizzled in chocolate syrup. I enjoyed the baby spinach salad with strawberries, thin radish slices and bits of parmesan.  I couldn't help but to be amused by Chef Franz's smile when he smiled catching me snapping pictures of his tasty culinary creations.  Undoubtedly, the experience at Farallon must never relate to his culinary skills.  His food is quite exquisite.  

Unfortunately, I anticipated greater things here prior to my visit.  My visit did not satiate the fine dining standards as expected according to existing Yelp reviews.    My bf must have eaten a bad oyster or something on our Grand  Platter that evening.  He spewed it and everything else into the  porcelain god that evening, but I, luckily, evaded a similar misfortune.

I did not expect Farallon to disappoint so much.  Unfortunately, I can't say I will return to be a glutton for further punishment.  $300 is too much to spend  and have an experience like this.  :(
author: Elizabeth S.

description:
We rented out one of their rooms for private dining last year for my office's annual holiday dinner. We are a party of 16 and they put us in a tiny room upstairs. I mean 16 people + 1 giant dining table in a small room? No room for games, dancing etc...

The food was good not great. Their portions are ginormous so if you have a three course meal with a risotto as the 1st course, you might want to eat half of that because by the time you get the 1/2 lb. maine lobster as your entree you will be too full. 

Our server was great. She was very attentive and quite entertaining. I mean for a party of 16 people she was on top of it. I forgot her name but thanks for putting up with me and all my requests.
author: J M.

description:
Came here for Happy Hour @ the Jellyfish Lounge... There were a few groups waiting for bar seats/table, but we managed to quickly take over two bar seats from a departing couple.

We had martinis and the half dozen oyster special. the oysters were delicious and the martinis were great...

Only "down" side of this experience was that the wait staff were very obviously trying to rush us out, to seat more people, and the bartender ended up taking my martini glass when it was still a quarter full...so that sucked.

The decor is pretty cool.
author: Julianne S.

description:
My wife and I came here for our ten year anniversary. The host was very accommodating and found us a nice table.  Our server however was quite rude , when I asked for wine bucket for our white wine he seemed quite put out. Next he spilled my wife's wine on her and on the seat beside her , he did not apologize but rather blamed the fact the table was to small. He asked if we would like to move over to a bigger table and we agreed but he never offered to cover the cost of the spilled wine he dolled . He also never wiped or dried the seat area , they just sat someone else there 10 minutes later ?? We ordered a shellfish plater that was very average at best ! When we were considering the rest of the menu we mentioned that we were interested in exploring different fish options he said         
 " well 99% of the menu is fish." We were made to feel inferior . We decided this was not the place for us , so we told the manager what had happened , paid the bill and left with out eating dinner!
author: Dave B.

description: We heard great things about this restaurant. Made a reservation celebrating our anniversary and my husbands birthday. The service was ok. The food was also ok. Nothing spectacular. We are the easiest customers and don't require much attention but we had to get our waiters attention for things. Overall it was ok but being in the Bay Area I thought it was have been better.
author: Lyle C.

description:
I ate here for my birthday 5 days ago and I loved their service. Waiter was very helpful and detailed in terms of what to order here for the first time. I ordered the sea bass dish and my girlfriend ordered the salmon king dish. My sea bass fish had a crispy skin with roast chestnut and mushrooms to complement my dish with some sweet sauce that almost tasted like apple sauce. I was like drooling until my plate was empty. Hahah

 I wish my bass fish was a little more soft but the salmon king fish was really good. I thought the bacon was a weird combo with king salmon but everything seems to work out somehow. LOL As soon as you walk in there, they have plenty of room and the light chandeliers made up of huge orchid shells with little mermaid theme like the song called under the sea. The undersea theme was really nice but it's hard to find parking at union square so it's best to be very early when you make your reservation. Price of the dishes were reasonable because you get quality, top service and just enough food to keep you comfortable. I would say if you never ate there, GO FOR it!
author: Chris L.

description:
My bf took me here to celebrate my birthday because I love seafood.

Pros:
- I loved that they had Happy Hour (ex: $1 Oysters / $6 for half a dozen)
- They had the best heirloom tomato and almonds appetizer dish I've ever tasted (and I'm not usually a fan of tomatoes)
- They also had the best crab salad I've ever had (I think the lemon zest they put in it made it that much more awesome!)
- This place is huge!  There are 4-5 different dining rooms (we dined in the pool room--most popular). Very expensive/fancy looking atmosphere/decor.

Cons:
- Food came out slower than I expected...but each were made to perfection so it's not so bad.  
- a tad chilly inside so being bare-skinned for long in there isn't advised.  Bring a jacket. =o)
author: Wendy T.

description: Food was served cold. Took a long long time to get our dinner. The food that was served was mediocre
author: Tiffany S.

description: Amazing detailed atmosphere from the floor to ceiling. Hand crafted jellyfish lighting was fantastic. I enjoyed their happy hour prices and took advantage of 3 appetizers. Fries were delish and I normally don't like fries. I also loved their grill cheese. Friendly staff and good service.
author: B. M.

description: Sat at the bar for a solo dinner. The servers took good care of me. Happy hour 1/2 dozen oysters, mixed greens salad, and seared scallop. The salad was fabulous!  Strawberries and sautéed onions over the greens. Finished The meal with an almond tart. Yum!
author: Lilly J.

description:
My boyfriend and I came here a bit early for a Saturday night dinner reservation and were lucky to stumble upon their happy hour -- I believe it's from 6-7 -- as we ended up eating and drinking our fill during this time (and probably saving a substantial amount on the bill as well). 

Can't beat the great selection of $6 drinks and plate selections, highlights of which include 1/2 a dozen oysters and some deliciously seasoned steamed littleneck clams. Next time we'll skip the potato croquettes, which were pretty forgettable. Also really enjoyed the soup of the day -- seafood bisque, I believe. Great ambience as well (who doesn't like feeling like they're dining under the sea??). 

Had to take a couple stars off for the service -- our waitress seemed frustrated with us as we began to order (even though we had been nothing but patient as we waited several minutes for any of her attention once we were seated), and then, for some reason I have yet to figure out, walked off as we were still ordering. No, really -- I had just ordered some small plates and a drink, and then she left before my boyf had a chance to say or order anything! She returned a few minutes later with my drink and then continued taking our order as if her behavior was perfectly normal. Our bill was also higher than we expected because she'd added crab legs to our order; however, since we'd eaten them (we naively thought that they were part of the 1/2 lobster we'd ordered as well since they came on the same platter), we didn't say anything. 

...but all in all, this place is a solid destination for a full meal at (slightly high) happy hour prices.
author: Justine M.

description: I went here for a birthday dinner and the staff was excellent as they should be. The food was definitely good. I wouldn't say it was any better than many more reasonably priced restaurants. The shrimp was particularly overpriced at 20 dollars for 4 medium sized shrimp. The decor is kind of cool. Definitely cheesy but classic and well maintained. I would not go back here again. I would probably choose a steakhouse next time a birthday dinner comes around.
author: Brian H.

description: From the attendant service at the bar to the recommendation for an after dinner music venue, the  experience at Farallon was excellent. We started with drinks and a recommended sample from the raw oyster menu. The oysters were delicious and presented exquisitely. We had the Miso Glazed Saddlefish and the Bodega Cod. Both were spectacular and unique. Our server recommended a tasty wine pairing and we had the Blueberry Marbled Cake for dessert--yummy! I would return in a heartbeat. Bon appetit!
author: Larry L.

description: Went there for Valentines day and got seated right away. Our waiter was great always seeming to appear at the right moment while letting us enjoy our night, he was also very helpful with recommendations.  Food was  good, we had caviar, snapper and monkfish. A good overall experience.
author: Justin S.

description:
ok, i think i have a solution to the farallon dilemma: turn it into a takeout place. 

the food is spectacular. the "service" is miserable. from being greeted at the reservation desk, to being seated, giving your order, receiving your order, clearing plates: it's all a study of awkward. it's like you're participating in a some kind of grad school psychology experiment. its a real pity because like i said the food was great.
the oysters, cobia, shrimp, dessert: terrific, i'd be a takeout regular.

now... if you're sitting in the restaurant: look left. look right. you're most likely looking at a tourist. if i wanted to hang with tourists i'd... wait... i don't want to hang with tourists.
another big negative of the restaurant.

farallon: if only you would be what you could be. what a shame.
author: Sanil S.

description:
I came here with my wife celebrating our Anniversary, and we booked a table for two.  the Restaurant looked amazing from inside, and the decoration made you feel that you are in a story tale.

The service was really good too, and our sever was very friendly and helpful.

However, the food was average, such a disappointment comparing to the price we paid, it was not that tasty, and was not warm enough make you feel if it is fresh from the first place.

I do not think I will visit this place again!
author: Angel S.

description:
We ate at Farallon, for the first time, the first weekend in April.  We simply loved everything about the dining experience!  Well, almost everything.  The lighting was a little bright.  If it was more dim, it would have made the experience more intimate.  Outside of that, we loved everything else.  We had the 5-course dinner with wine pairing.  Talk about a _lot_ of wine!  :)   Each wine was wonderful and was the perfect match for each course.  This is our third "fine dining" experience and it was very enjoyable.  Our server was awesome and recommended we check out "Bocanova," at Jack London Square, after we told him about our bad experience at Jack's.  Our previous "fine dining" experiences were at Gary Danko and Fleur de Lys.   I'm not sure if valet parking is available but there's a parking lot, diagonally across the street from the restaurant.

Overall, we really enjoyed our dining experience at Farallon and would certainly return in the future!
author: Tom W.

description: Came here originally for the happy hour to find out they just changed the hours. We still ordered champs, whisky and cavier for our pre-dinner.
author: Elly H.

description:
The Good: appetizers, service and ambiance
The Bad: salty fish

Meeting of the parents is a big deal so not being familiar with San Francisco, all we knew is that we wanted somewhere quiet and nice for our parents to meet for the first time since our engagement.

We all enjoyed the appetizers: oysters, beet salad, arugula salad, butter lettuce salad, and the gnocchi.

The entrees were a disappointment to many because it was OVER-seasoned.

Whoever is reading this at Farallon, please advise your chefs-  light on the salt!!  They are heavy handed over there and I forgot to warn our family & fiance... so sorry!

Great place for meetings and formal dinners... not so great for entrees.
author: Stacey C.

description:
Review of the bar only.
We stopped in for a drink after going to Beach Blanket Babylon. We were barely allowed inside; 'it was too close to last seating for the restaurant'. We replied we only wanted drinks. We sat opposite the bar and it took a few moments to get a server. Finally we ordered drinks which took a long six or seven minutes to arrive. No-one came back to check on us. We had to flag down a waiter to get our bill. 
Not impressed with our service but we must have looked like street urchins in our shirts, kackis, sweaters and dresses. Not heading back here soon.
Oh, the prices. Two drinks and two glasses of wine, .....$60.00.
author: George C.

description:
Beautiful restaurant with excellent service but the food was really unimpressive. Too bad, I heard that it used to be awesome but our experience was pretty bad, especially considering how expensive it is.
I would not bother going back with so many other options in the city
author: Adam M.

description: Great spot for special occasion in San Fran.  I'll recommend to anyone visiting!
author: Leanna M.

description: The food is OK but expensive.  The service was definitely sub par.  Our waiter was dismissive then mixed up our orders twice.  He basically ruined our experience with our out of town guests.  When I complained to the manager I got the brush off.  There are just too many other good seafood places in town that will give you a better experience.
author: John D.

description:
LOVED THE PLACE!!!
Happy hour was great with delicious oysters which I couldn't stop ordering and ordering over and over again. Then we moved to the dinner table and had a wonderful dinner with friends. Service was very high level. We were very happy to be there and to eat so awesome items from chef's menu. Deserts are yummy too there! Highly recommend!
author: Anna T.

description: Stopped in for HH. I had one of the best Gin & Tonics I've ever had. It's a simple drink. While it's difficult to screw up, it's even more difficult to make a memorable one. The accompanying appetizers were exceptional. Try the grilled cheese and you definitely want the truffle garlic fries.
author: Gene F.

description:
Dined at Farallon with clients and a few colleagues. Great experience from start to finish. We got the history of the building by our server (started as an Elks lodge in the 1920s, built above a swimming pool that's not the floor below the restaurant). Great wine list and interesting house cocktails. All of the seafood was incredibly fresh. We tried the tuna carpaccio and shell fish sampler platter for apps. I had a seafood bisque that was incredible (and interesting presentation). Entrees looked excellent all around and everyone enjoyed. I had the true cod which was served over wild mushroom risotto. One of our party ordered the lobster and I was envious--it looked outstanding. Across the board great food and service, with a very pleasant and unique atmosphere. 

Only knock were the portions, which were on the smaller side. Somewhat expected for a higher-end restaurant like this, but the only thing keeping it from a 5th star.
author: Jason W.

description: We made a reservation for my son's 18th birthday. When you make a reservation they do require $20 if you forget to cancel. This was our first time at the restaurant but I have been wanting to try this place for a while, 3 out of the 5 in our party love seafood. We had read a number of reviews that indicated the decor was a bit odd but we were looking forward to the jelly fish room. When we arrived for an early reservation at 5:45 on the Monday after Christmas the place was already packed, especially the bar area. We were escorted to a round table that sat 5, we were a little disappointed we did not get a large booth but it appeared they could only seat 4. We immediately ordered a dozen raw oysters which my husband and son thoroughly enjoyed. We ordered two salads (all of the salads come with some type of seafood but my son was able to get his without) and the venison. My oldest son ordered the butter lettuce and I ordered a kale salad, both the salads were just ok and on the small side. The venison was very good. For entrees two in our party ordered steak, I ordered the sablefish and two ordered the crab. The steaks were well prepared but arrived barely lukewarm, the crabs were nicely prepared and the sablefish was way over spiced, I could barely taste the fish, it tasted like breadcrumbs. All was ok but for the price we paid I don't think we will return. We did order some wine, good selection but again very overpriced.
author: renee m.

description:
Sister night out - we sat in the bar area next to the seafood bar. It is fishy all the way! Literally, fishy! fresh seafood should not smell fishy.... 

Service: Inattentive + Forgetful = Poor. The waitress needs any hearing aid or just not paying attention of what we order. She asked us to repeat our order twice every single time. 
Food: 
Oyster - skinny and not tasty. Seattle still have the best oyster! 
Drinks - Not bad with good wine selection 
grand Platter - It's ok. I tasted fresh lobster, shrimp, etc before. This is not it. 
Environment: Pretty but fishy! 

Note: Happy Hour is ok. Whole course dinner.... probably not.... 
You will see a lot of business dinner take place here....
author: Flora C.

description:
No stars . If there was a negative star I would use it .  Went for wedding anniversary . We arrived at designated time and were rudely told by hostess it would be a few minutes . Another couple came in 10 min after us and had same time res . They were seated before us . Once taken to table we realized it was the WORST table in restaurant.  One side faced restroom door and the other faced bussing station . There should NOT even be a table here.  The hostess -red head - severe bangs- walked past us several times and scowled at me. I actually felt scared of her!!
The food was marginal and service worse.
Never ever again . Thankfully I have a wonderful husband and wouldn't let this red headed monster ruin our night.
My husband entertains clients often from out of the country and will never consider bringing  them here again . 
No Longer the gem it was years ago. Blech!
author: Laurel L.

description: BEWARE!!  Zero stars if possible.  My husband went there for a business dinner yesterday. Had sashimi, squid salad and steak.  Less than an hour, he started feeling the effects of food poisoning. Ended fainting in the bathroom!!
author: N. W.

description:
Under the sea... (under the sea)  Under the SEA... (under the sea). 
Darling it's better
Down where it's wetter
Take it from me

Oh Farallon! I'm so happy to give out a solid 5 star review for a nice, higher end restaurant in the Bay area.  It is a perfect place to take a date, a important business client or, even have a fancy spoiled girl's night out.  So often, I go to nice restaurants and though I enjoy the meal, I feel letdown from the cost to worth comparison.  This is not true at Farallon.  There, you have your cake and eat it too (and yes - one should definitely order the carrot cake).

Decor - how do you get a sophisticated, wacky and old tyme feel all at once?  I donno... but whoever decorated this place did the job.  It mostly gave me an elegant Poseidon under the sea feel but, then some random artwork kept me guessing. lol  All in all, it worked.  Maybe it was my mind of the night but, I even liked the 'conch shell' feel of our seats.  

Service - flawless.

Wine - extensive list.  I enjoyed our selection though we only got 2 individual glasses.

Food - Excellent.  We started with the butter lettuce salad that they automatically split for us.  The green sauce dressing under the lettuce was delish and the orange slices were a perfect touch!  We went from there to our entrees... ahi tuna and striped bass.  Both were perfectly prepared and amazingly tasty.  I'd recommend the tuna if you'd like a lighter taste and the bass for a more savory palette.  We finished with the carrot cake... it was SO good.  The cake was most and packed with goodness and the cream cheese ice cream that accompanied it was weirdly good, I couldn't stop nibbling at it!

The portions were much healthier than expected which was a nice surprise.  Because of this, we got value as well as an amazing meal and for me, the taste/value combo is what keeps me coming back to a place.  Decor and service are added perks.... great ones here.    

I'd definitely go back.  
 
See ya there!
author: Susan D.

description:
I am really debating if it's a 2-star or 3-star restaurant. The restaurant is beautiful, jelly-fish like lighting, table in a cave, you do feel like you are underwater (swear I saw a girl who thought she was a mermaid dining there, you know, Barbie-like). My friends and I ordered the Royal Platter, and the selection of seafood they out on there was great: oysters, shrimps, lobster, clams, and some poke; fresh. We also ordered the Seared George's Bank Diver Scallop, NY strip steak and the striped bass. The steak and striped bass were fine, not impressive; the scallop was overly seasoned and the whole dish was so salty to a point that I could not take a second bite. So of course, I waited patiently for the server to check in with us on our food to see if I can have something else but I suppose our dinner reservation was too close to their closing time, everyone was rushing in the restaurant, running around. The next thing you know, someone came,
took our plates and started to wrap things up. I asked for our server and told
him that I am a little disappointed that my dish was overly seasoned and taken away, and all he had to say was 'I'll take it off the check'....right and what about the fact that I was still hungry? Anyway, I'll still give the food a 3, and the service a 1, being very nice here and just focusing on the food. But I will never go back to this restaurant since I can get a nice seafood platter anywhere else like Swan Oyster Depot, or Hog Island.
author: Doremi H.

description: Great place to go when visiting SF. One of the coolest interior design of any restaurant I've ever been to. And the seafood is fantastic.
author: Myles H.

description: Ate here last night, and thankfully I didn't have to foot the bill. The service was excellent. Ambiance and noise ok. Standard stuff was there. It's what what you'd expect from a fine restaurant in the nicest part of town, except nothing was *exceptional. I felt like each portion was about 1/2 the size of any other nice restaurant and 2-4x as expensive. Rice and beef was $44. I could have eaten several. Oysters were $4.50/ea so our dozen was the most expensive thing on the menu which really pissed me off when we got the bill. I am going back to my favorite oyster spot- Skool- this weekend to make up for this unnecessary overpricing. They server at least one of the same oysters for $1. So again, Farallon marks up the same items 200-450% of other places around the city. I don't think I'll be back. Especially not at $50 for a dozen oysters. It wasn't bad in any way, there's just places I love and crave for a fraction of the price. No great memories here other than a gorgeous pic of my girlfriend with a jellyfish 'chandelier' *LAMP, cough* in the frame.
author: Brian G.

description:
Amazing dinner. I love the decor it's like little mermaid. 
The Mediterranean octopus appetizer was interesting. Never had octopus in that kind of texture before. Pieces of it felt like meat/fatty. The sauce was delicious. 
The chef brought out a complimentary mashed beets/goat cheese thing. Two spoonfuls on two large white spoons. im still not sure what it was but it was amazing! 
i had the meat medium cooked and it was tender juicy, delicious. The mashed potatoes and bed of spinach complemented it wonderfully and I appreciated how the presentation of the dish kept the juices on one side of the plate. The onion rings with it was the best onion rings ever!! 
The bf had the cod and I must say it was one of the best fish plates I've tasted at a restaurant. Based on my experiences with fish that is not salmon or sushi, it's usually a bit bland after the initial bite. He loved it. 
For dessert we had the toffee pudding, and as it was a bday dinner the plate had chocolate sauce saying happy bday with a candle. So cute! Also, they even had a birthday card waiting for me at our table! Handwritten!
author: Annissa H.

description:
"The food was terrible and such small portions" is the perfect way to describe this meal. The meal and dining experience were terrible- an awful anniversary celebration, and on a Saturday night! 

The terrible service started when we told our waiter we didn't want to order drinks- apparently even in a restaurant where money is no object, the $20 hit to the check was too much for our waiter. He was rude and inattentive and ultimately kept us waiting 20 minutes for the check. 

My husband and I shared 4 appetizers- the 1/2 lobster, bone marrow, scallops, and oyster beef tartar. The 1/2 lobster was so small I didn't think it was legal to fish lobster that tiny (it was the equivalent of 4 shrimp- not even close to even 1/2 a pound) and THIRTY DOLLARS. The oyster beef tartar was overpoweringly fishy. The bone marrow was inedible. There were only 2 small scallops. We shared 1 entree, the halibut. It was fishy. 

One of the most disappointing meals I've ever had. Nearly ruined the anniversary celebration. If this is the product Farallon produces on Saturday nights I can't imagine how awful it is on week days. 

DO NOT GO HERE- a complete waste of money and time
author: Dana S.

description:
I've now been to Farallon 3 times and have loved the food every time. The ambiance is really eccentric with an underwater theme.  The seafood is fresh and the variety is excellent. The last time we went, my family and I shared the Seafood platter appetizer with oysters, shrimp, clams, service and sashimi. For dinner I had the Stripped Bass which was cooked perfectly!

The only complaint I had this last visit was the service was extremely slow. It took over 10 minutes after we ordered our drinks for them to serve us, then it was another 20 mins just to order. The restaurant was already starting to clear out because our reservation was late (8:45pm) so it's not like they were busy. When all was said and done, my family and I had a 3 hour dinner that probably could have been done in 2 max. 

Aside from that last experience, I highly recommend this restaurant.
author: Dianne L.

description:
I was actually anxious to try this place out - from the website, the interior looked like a tranquil underwater more sophisticated Little Mermaid scene. Anyway. I went with 5 other friends and we reserved the Nautilus Room.
 
I was impressed by the interior. It was exactly like the website, even though I had my doubts. I thought that maybe in real life, it'd be tacky, but it wasn't. Oh wait, we're talking about the food right? Okay. So for a restaurant that is known for seafood, it didn't live up to its name.  

The dessert was the best part of the meal. 

Overall: overrpriced and overrated.
author: Susy C.

description:
A group of coworkers and I were treated to a unforgettable dinner at Farallon. The restaurant is true to the theme of Jules Verne's 20,000 Leagues Under the Sea. As you walk into the door, you'll see jelly fish floating from the ceiling, and you'll see sea decor throughout the bar area. We were escorted to a private room that felt like an officers dining hall. You know you're in a special place. Looking out of the large windows, there is a large sea shell hanging from the ceiling above the other diners. We were lucky to choose from the regular dinner menu in contrast to a prix fix menu when dinning in a large group. Now I've started to read the book, "20,000 Leagues Under the Sea." 

My wife and I had the honors of choosing the wine: 
Capiaux, Gary's Vineyard, 2007 
Groth 2006 Pinot Noir 
Paradigm 2005, Cabernet Sauvignon 
Sauternes, Chateau Raymond Lafond 1986 

For dinner, we ordered (and of course, we tried each other's dishes): 

Lobster Bisque, amuse bouche, rich and creamy with the taste of the sea. 

Pomme frites with truffle oil, crispy outside and moist inside. Just enough truffle oil 

Seafood Platter, a shared platter to share with six of us: lobster, clams, oysters, tuna tartar, ceviche and shrimp. 

SASHIMI OF HAMACHI - a petite serving. The hamachi was thinly sliced and the accompaniment added flavor. 
seived egg, petite vegetable salad, caviar vinaigrette 

CHILLED MAINE LOBSTER SALAD - can't go wrong with the lobster. So fresh, crisp, meaty. 
mango coulis, scallions, cascabel chili gastrique 

SEARED CAGE FREE HUDSON VALLEY FOIE GRAS - a petite service, and quality over quantity. Melted like butter. 
grilled pineapple, toasted hazelnuts, spiced agave reduction 

GRILLED CREEKSTONE FARMS PETITE FILET OF BEEF - so tender, asked for medium rare and got it. The sauces right on. 
green garlic puree, heirloom radicchios, truffle coulis 

BITTERSWEET CHOCOLATE MALT GATEAU - hit the chocolate spot. No straw needed. 
vanilla bean semifreddo, milk chocolate malt crunch, 
espresso crème anglaise 

WARM CHOCOLATE SOUFFLÉ TART, rich and sinful. Perfect with the coffee. 
almond ice milk, butterscotch sauce, 
candied almonds 

Cheese platter- our waiter came out with a petite platter of five cheeses to share. Very nice to end the dinner. 
HUDSON VALLEY CAMEMBERT; CAPRIAGO;ROTH'S PRIVATE RESERVE; TRUFFLE TREMOR; ROGUE RIVER BLUE
author: JOHN J.

description: The lobster salad, spinach salad, caviar, and calm chowder were delicious. Overpriced but delicious
author: Jazzy T.

description:
from 11-18-14 - 

Pros - 
Happy Hour - great options for affordable prices
Amazing decor, a work of art
Fresh seafood
Great service

Folks really have it together here and aim to please.
author: Monica S.

description:
I was here for a business luncheon meeting in a separate room, not in the restaurant, but the food and servers were from Farallon 

If i could give it a 3.5*, I would. 
The lobster bisque was delicious; the roasted chicken was good but not super memorable. The super chocolately dessert to round out the meal was very rich and dense. 

Servers were so efficient and friendly. 
I look forward to dining in the restaurant one of these days
author: Jocelyn L.

description: Top notch, outstanding seafood.  Well worth the trip if you are in SF.
author: Josh B.

description:
Food was pretty good. The service was really good, but almost too much. The server was more worried about us gettin to our show han we were, but in a way that was fikle, like he would love to scoot another table in. However, they were great about valet-ing and hanging on to our car until after they were technically closed. Ande we were a buit late for our reservation (but it was real early and they were not close to full). Those accomodations really were great hospitality.

The table service was really good, just not an experience.  Really, the overall experience was not memorable. Srikes me more of a business dinner place. The decor was confusing, I totally wanted to love it, it is just like 10 years away from being a total kitchy nutty spot, and having some personality.
author: emily r.

description: Okay, I have been to Farallon twice. I like the food/drinks, love the ambiance, but it's a bit overpriced for what you get. $20 cocktails that aren't all that spectacular.. I'm sorry but I can't help but raise a brow. I do not mind paying a lot for a great drink/meal/experience, but this place is simply not worth it. For two, expect to pay at least $150 for a good (not great) dinner. There are better options throughout the city.
author: Kristy C.

description: Not coming back, seriously. For the money I dropped, I got way better food, service and vibe in NYC. Totally uninspiring and lame. Food is fine but just plain boring.
author: Nomad M.

description: Food selection was way too limited and exotic, and for $200 for a few entrees and drinks, expected so much more. I am sure this is (or was) the place to be seen, but would not ever go back for food. Service was excellent and inside was absolutely beautiful.
author: Doug B.

description:
Farallon may even be a bit closer to five stars, but it will require more research before I can vouch for that. ;o) I've never dined here for a regular meal, but I have been to a superb party in one of their private rooms. If you are considering hosting an event here, I really recommend it for that! 

I've also been to their happy hour, which is reasonable, delicious, and offered seven nights a week. That's a good deal in the East Bay. For SF, it's amazing. During happy hour, you can dine in the bar on little snacks, wines, beer and mixed drinks that run six dollars each. They're appropriately portioned so that two could comprise a dinner, or one could leave you with room enough for dining later. 

If you are sitting at the seafood bar area, watching the shellfish preparers is a nice bit of foreplay to a seafood meal.

It has a cool collection of nautical lamps and art. It's definitely a safe spot to take a date, as it is classy. But it's not so romantic as to be awkward for a guy's outing.
author: Delya S.

description: 5 star service.  We made it a point to eat fish for every meal while we were here so we went to Farallon where 90% of the menu is fish.  Even though they don't have a kids menu they offered to make a pasta for my 10 year old...she opted for the trout which was incredible.  Service staff was a team of smiling folks and very attentive.  We will absolutely visit again
author: Chris P.

description:
Beautiful decor... yes
Nice booth for my sweet and I....yes
Service.....slow, yet friendly
Our Lobster bisque was luke-warm
Portion of steelhead entree was about 4 ounces of fish--not a traditional size by San Francisco standards.
My mushroom gnocchi was also served luke warm.
As we entered and took our seats we noticed several unhappy guests having words with the manager and expressing their disgust with the service and their meal.  Perhaps we were determined to have a nice time, but I would never go there again.
author: Moonmonke Y.

description: The underwater theme is enchanting. Nice place to go for a date or anniversary. Service and food are excellent. They have jellyfish chandeliers, I mean c'mon! So cool
author: Jane C.

description: Really bad service for a upscale restaurant. They basically ignored my reservation request as well as having to wait for my table for 15 min. Over cooked lobster and a new odd menu, not worth the price
author: Sarah K.

description: I kind of believe they falsely advertise them selves as a restaurant they are actually more of a tapas place, you cannot really get a dinner per say it is all alacarte very pricey and very small, with four of us we dropped a quick 300 dollars and didn't really get a full filling meal god had I really wanted to eat we would of dropped 5-600 in a hurry.
author: John L.

description: Rated four stars over almost 1200 reviews.  You got to be kidding me. Sliders were raw. Fries were cold. Atmosphere loud. Wine served in glasses totally inappropriate to the grape.  This place is extremely lucky to stay in business.
author: Randy B.

description:
I came to Farallon on a romantic date. Highly recommended for that occasion. The decor is killer, Love it! I especially love the huge Conch shell seating nook. Very cool. 
The seafood is very high quality and fresh, I am very picky with that. 
The mixed drinks are clever, fun and delicious. 
The portions are nice and small, which I really like and respect in a dish. BUT on the ahi appetizer, it was mostly garnish, less than a fork full of ahi..which was disappointing.   
The service was very good, they have a sommolier walk around the restaurant and recommend by the glass which is super fun!!
Our server was a little bit creepy, Lol like paying more attention to me than my bf and staring creepily...but I would still definitely recommend this restaurant. Very class place and very fun!
author: Evelani Lei O.

description:
Very good food, great service, and extremely pleasant - and in contrary to many restaurants nowadays- decor.

It was my first time here and I enjoyed the Ahi Tuna Carpaccio, Prawns, and Scallops that I ordered and was served.

Awesome place for a date.
author: Marcos C.

description:
Came here last minute and was able to get a seat on an extremely busy night after talking with the waiting staff. (SCORE)

The food: Alot of good stuff here but alot of SALTY FOOD
 -The good: Dungeness Crab (Yayuhhhh, probably the freshest I've had in Cali), brisket burger (borderline yum)
-The Okay: Gnocci (pomegranates seeds killed it - everything else about it was good though)
-The Not so Okay: Cod (SOOO SALTY, although the fish was cooked perfect), Clams in some SALTYYY BROTH...straight up poured sea water or something into these dishes cuz I needed to drink 5 glasses of water after that

The service: Good, I'm happy they got me a seat after we got seat jacked by some wierdos at the bar.  

Would I come back?
For the cold seafood bar I definitely will...maybe I'll consider eating the other stuff if they calm down with the salt
author: John K.

description: We took my father here for his 70th five years ago. The fish was lovely, the service was wonderful. Now he's flying in again, and guess where he wants to go? He didn't even realize that it was the same place, he just saw how well-reviewed it was on Tripadvisor. If it's big on tripadvisor, I guess this means it's touristy enough that I won't feel shy about pulling my camera out to photograph their incredible modern, sparse mosaics.
author: Kate G.

description:
Beautiful! Romantic!  Service was perfect.  Bread was good.
Deserts sucked.   No cheap wine.    I must have ordered the wrong things on the menu.  Nothing was great.  the price bugged me.

 I don't  think it gets more expensive than this... so just close your eyes and toss in the card.

This place was not worth it.  But my date and I did enjoy O'fallon theater after.  Unforgettable.
author: Jack J.

description:
LOVE. THIS. PLACE.

I spotted the suspended jellyfish on the ceiling from the street and immediately made up my mind that I MUST dine there before the end of my visit to SF. It was just too cool looking.

Ambiance:
I made my reservation on a Wednesday for that Friday at 7:45pm without a problem. My husband and I arrived on time and were promptly seated. We were taken to the vary back room (past the dangling jellies) and through another "oyster-like" room where the booths were very large, painted white with mauve cushions, before we arrived at a very large deep blue room with cavernous ceilings. (Each room was so different!) We were seated right next to the open kitchen where we had front row seats to all the action. 

Service:
IMPECCABLE. From the buss boys to the sommelier, the waitstaff were all smiles and never once let our glasses dry. I never thought to myself "Where is our waiter?" despite the fact that the restaurant was completely filled. They were all informative and very pleasant. No stuffiness!

Food:
My husband and I shared the Shrimp Parfait and loved it. Tons of shrimp and lots of flavor! For our entrees we ordered the Ono and the Halibut. The halibut was perfectly cooked with a nice light flavor over gnocchi (my fave). It was a nice balance. The Ono offered a spicier/peppery flavor, which my husband loved. We also ordered a crisp and delicious bottle of Sonoma County Sauvignon Blanc. 

All in all, we had a blast. Fine dining sans stuffiness.
author: RACHELLE B.

description:
The service is always excellent here, and the quality of the food is always extremely good. Everything is extremely fresh, however the taste can be underwhelming.

I've had some meals here that were outstanding, and some that were decidedly mediocre. 

It's too bad, because this restaurant could easily be one of the best in SF if it were more consistent.
author: Jacqueline A.

description:
Even though I fear I'll sound completely ungrateful, this place is overrated. I couldn't get past the decor and when I leaned over and told my friends that I felt like we were at the Medieval Times...we all burst out laughing and figured it out. This restaurant is thematic. The ceiling is painted like you're under the sea. The light fixtures are different sea shapes...and feeling like the little mermaid is not my idea of fine dining. But enough about that. I had heard AMAZING reviews of this place and the concierge at the hotel really sold us on it...but honestly, it was just okay.
The service is amazing, the wine list is fantastic, but the food is just okay. Some things were a bit bland and even boring. Other things were just acceptable. The seafood is definitely fresh, but nothing else to write home about. Sorry Farallon.
author: Martha A.

description: This place is totally over the top and not usually the place I would pick. Yet the food, service and atmosphere are amazing. It's dressy and high end so be prepared to step up your dress code if you go. The raw seafood bars are some of the best I've seen and there are a couple of them scattered around the restaurant. Great place to take a hot date if you're looking to impress.
author: Madeleine S.

description: Bad experience..food was late and cold. Server was rude and did not care. Selection of wine and food was very limited. This is not the Farallon I have previously experienced.  Definitely will not return.
author: Mike J.

description: Loved it- food was fantastic and so was the service. The interior is also very nice. It is a classy fine dining restaurant with a variety of options to order from for first through third courses. If you have not been- you should go:)
author: Zainab B.

description:
Emphasis on seafood, both from the raw bar and the kitchen. The service was amazing.  The under the sea decorations were interesting, although my dining companion and I were humming songs from Little Mermaid.

For two of us, we ordered two first courses, two second courses, and shared a raw platter for our entree.  It turned out to be the perfect amount of food.  But after having sampled the seafood preparations in the tuna carpaccio and scallops, I was disappointed that I did not get to try any of the seafood entrees.

We had extra entertainment as our table was near the kitchen and we watched the coordination among the entire wait staff as orders were fired and expedited to all the tables.

Look forward to returning to Farallon on one of my next trips to the city.
author: Cynthia B.

description: Kevin the manager did not even apologize when I called after we walked out without one person coming to our table he asked if I knew what number I dialed never returning
author: Dee D.

description:
Sorry, Farallon. But you failed to impress, dazzle or delight us at all. And given your purported position at the top of the SF food scene, that's just not the expectation.

We started the evening waiting for our reservation for a few minutes in the bar. Our cocktails (at $12-13 each) were standard at best. I think a top notch restaurant would have creative, top notch bartenders to provide an intro to the evening ahead.

We were shown to our table on the 2nd floor by a very nice and efficient host (best employee interaction of the night). Sliding into the banquette covered with velvet while negotiating your way past the extra long tablecloth, without the whole table setup crashing down on you is challenging. When they do a refresh of the restaurant they should consider making the seats of the banquettes over with a pleather (or other slick) material. It would make seating, cleanup and cozying up to your tablemate a LOT easier.

Our waiter was just odd. He tried to be helpful but just kept wandering off in the midst of discussion saying he had to take care of something or other. And I would expect waiters in this caliber of restaurant to be able to memorize an order for 2 people (it was 3 items total), rather than having to walk away again to get a pen and pad? Not sure if he was high or just not a great waiter - but it made for a very uneven service throughout.

The decor could use some updating. The covering of the columns upstairs looked a bit like a set for Disneyland circa 1990 and they had a shadow box on one wall filled with shells that looked like someone's DIY mom made it after returning from a beach vacation. Again, nice idea but odd execution for what is aiming for a lavish space. 

The food itself was ok. We started with the iced shellfish platter (crab, lobster, oysters, shrimp). The flavor/freshness were good but the 1/2 lobster and the dungeness crab legs were pretty tiny as shellfish go. We followed up with a ling cod and a striped bass main dish.  The ling cod was very tasty, but was served on a pear(?) slurry that had a baby food texture that didn't pair well with the fish in my opinion. It would have been significantly improved with a broth-based sauce or even a light butter sauce. My SO did enjoy his bass quite a bit. The timing on delivery of the courses was also pretty uneven, with 20+ minutes prior to/between courses. I am all for having some time to sit, sip and chat but when folks at the table find themselves asking if there's a problem, then your kitchen is moving a tad too slow.

I am SO sorry this review isn't full of accolades and fawning over the dinner and experience at Farallon - I really, REALLY wanted to love it, but sadly it just lacked too many things for me to run back.
author: Elizabeth E.

description:
I have been wanting to try this place and finally did it a month ago. When my friend and I walked into the restaurant, we thought "this place looks so small" as we only see the bar and a few tables in the hall. But we were so wrong! 

As we walked into the main dining room towards our table, we were so happy to see how nice it is inside, and that we totally felt like we walk into an under water tank with beautiful ceilings, thankgoodness the tank was dry and no water.

The evening was as pleasant as the dining room. Our waitress was very knowledgable and funny! Food was fantastic. The fois gra was excellent, I dont usually order fish when I dine out but since this is a seafood restaurant I went for the sea bass, which was so yummy. We were too full to order dessert, but I will have to make sure I leave room for dessert next time as they sounded fabulous!

I will be back!
author: Sharon P.

description: Beautiful interior decor with amazing good food.
author: Kenny H.

description:
Was in town for work, and in the mood for seafood and this looked like the place to be. 

The bartender was awesome, and gave me some good recos for my entree. The food was really good, and the dessert was amazing. 

I got the Black Bass and it was really good, but pretty small. This was under the "Third Course" section of the menu which is supposed to be the full sized-entrees, but it was small. So definitely get an appetizer or something. The desert was some sort of chocolate malt which was topped with something salted- delish.
author: Jen K.

description:
I booked this restaurant for my anniversary dinner on yelp, and I received confirmation email right away. The day before the restaurant called me and confirm with me and I told them it's for my 1st anniversary. When I arrived the restaurant, the table is ready and with the welcome card from staff on the table. 
The service is very good, waiter and waitress very nice and professional. Food is good, very fresh and yummy, love the caviar. Price are reasonable. Would love to go again
author: Sammie Y.

description: Great service! Very friendly and attentive. Wine cart is awesome. Seafood and their plato is marvelous
author: Maxim G.

description: 3 stars for mediocre value.  I've eaten here twice about 6 months apart. The food is good, but not $$$$ good. The ambiance is nice. And valet parking for $13 (as long as you retrieve your car before 10:30 or 11).  Most recent dinner here gave me indigestion and simply was not very tasty. Prior meal was much more tasty.
author: Joseph S.

description: Soooooooo great! Amazing food! Great service and beautiful place.  Very expensive but a good choice for special occasions and a splurge.
author: Lyndsey C.

description:
I looved the decor!  It was aquarian thematic without being kitschy - hard to do.  This is definitely a sophisticated dining experience focusing on gourmet food and wine and ambiance, managing to do so without pretention.  Farallon is an excellent venue for a classy or formal date or small event.  Keep in mind tho, that this restaurant is not a trendy hot spot and doesn't try to be so.  

The wine and food were excellent, the ambiance was classic, and the waiters and sommelier were informed, respectful, and personable.  Excellent experience!  So why not 5 stars?  Well, any meal for two that ends up over $200 is unlikely to earn that fifth star.  After all, it's just food.
author: Stephanie S.

description:
WOW! Really elegant and super decrative restaurant.  Seriously felt like I was dinning in the little mermaid's castle!  Where's Sebastian?!  I want him on my plate!

This place is amazing!  Service is flawless.  The wait staff are all super accommodating.  Great selection of wine!

Started off the meal with Caviar and oysters.  Caviar is always good.  Cant really say much except it was on a nice display and tasted great!

First course: Sashimi of Hand Line caught Ahi Tuna. Very delicate and a very small plate.

Main course: Pan Seared California Black Cod.  It was in a bed of sweet white corn chowder with roasted pancetta and leek tops.  Wow the fish was so tasty and the the sweet corn chowder was amazing!  Rich in flavor and really creamy.  I loved it!

Dessert: Bittersweet Chocolate Malt Gateau.  OMG Recommend not sharing.  You will finish it alone. hahaha!
author: Ying F.

description:
I wanted to love this place but the meal was ruined by the entree.  The atmosphere was great if a bit cartoonish. The service wonderful. The food good, wine great but the scallop entree was so salty it was almost un-edible. The scallops were cooked perfectly. I dare say one of the best I've seen. But my god. If I was not with work colleagues I would have sent it back. Liquid salt.  

Wish I had more to say but I can't review a place that's mid price the same way I can a high price. Different standard. And this was a little disappointing for high end. I'll try happy hour next time though.
author: Thomas B.

description: Very good seafood restaurant! Service was very good - our table was ready as soon as we arrived, unique decor and good atmosphere and more important the food was simple fantastic. We had the sardines as a appetizer, sole with sweet potatoes ravioli and roasted artichokes and the halibut with prosciutto and asparagus, dishes were super! Very good selection of wines and to finish this great experience we had the olive oil cheese tart - extremely unique dessert!!!!
author: Monica C.

description: Best Seafood we had while we were in San Francisco.  Great location near the theather
author: Todd E.

description:
I kept waiting for music to start playing, "Under the Sea," from The Little Mermaid Soundtrack, but that never happened. It probably wouldn't have been as fancy of a place if it did. Nevertheless, it kept playing in my head while I was here. 

We arrived for Happy Hour and while not all could agree on the tastiness of the oysters, I had not a single complaint about the wonderfully meaty sliders. 

Before the clock struck seven, our server came to check on any last orders and even checked back again on someone in our party who wasn't quite ready. I thought it was a super nice touch.

If you like admiring jellyfish chandeliers, solidly good drinks, friendly service, and a mysterious painting of a cocktail-drinking seahorse, you'll enjoy this place. 

If you're not paying for your visit (or are able to get it expensed), you might like it even more.
author: Loli L.
