Nice, huh? I don't even remember exactly what we ordered, but I'm pretty sure it was fish of some sort. We had some cabbage type soup I think it was. Anywyay, overall, my philosophy is if I can't remember what I ate, it wasn't that great to begin with. Nothing that stood out. And, all that to the side; Flies? GROSS!
author: ST1223 T.

description: This is a great restaurant if you feel like slurging... Walking into the restaurant, you feel like you're under water... the decor is beautiful.. We started our dinner off with a tasting of lobster bisque with lemon oil... My date and I shared the soft shell crab with cherry tomatoes and gnocchi.. the crab was the perfect portion to share.. very favorful and delicious.. I had the huge scallops with fava beans and mushrooms.. The dish was absolutely wonderful.. it was good.. but it was definitely pricey... My date had the tai snapper with truffles... that was good too... The dessert selection wasn't that impressive.. we had the apricot turnover with almond ice cream.. Overall the restaurant was good, but a little pricey... definitely a place to go to treat yourself.
author: Denise L.

description: I'll give Farallon 5 stars for atmosphere, 4 stars for service and 2.5/3 stars for food. Overall, I'd like to give them 3.5, so I'm going with 3. It's really quite average overall. We had a nice round table in the middle of the dining room all to ourselves, so that was quite comfortable. But, the place is noisy and a bit overwhelming with a lot of activity. We had the green salad with cheddar and croutons which was quite good, and actually the best part of the meal. For my main course, I had the Dover Sole cooked in parchment and the bf had the Filet Mignon. They cut open the parchment paper at the table and "dumped" the contents on the plate. It honestly didn't look very appetizing. And, the "crab sabayon" that the waiter wanted to pour over the fish just tasted like a cold sauce of butter, wine and bits of crab. I think a sabayon might actually have and/or supposed to have eggs in it. Anyhow, it wasn't anything special.  The fish was really bland, and I wasn't a fan of the artichokes and/or parsnips that accompanied the fish. The filet mignon was apparently pretty good, but the creamed spinach and onion rings (!) were very average. The meat was also nearly bloody and it was ordered "medium". Overall, it was an average meal, but for the huge price we paid (close to $200 for 2 of us), I'd say we didn't get our money's worth. If you want to check out the cool aquatic decorations, just go for drinks at the bar and order from the bar menu.
author: Maren P.

description: The cocktails were yummy. The service was good and our server put up with us taking forever to order and answering all 1000 questions we asked! Problem is, the food didn't really knock me off my feet. The pear salad was far, far too oily and too heavy on the dressing. The Walu was nicely cooked, but didn't really stand out in any particular way. Considering the beautiful decor and the high prices on the menu, I was expecting to be more impressed.
author: Sarcastic T.

description: Good selection on menu and wine list, preparations were all delicious.  Good service.  One small thing, but think important is bread.  It should be either distinctive and/or warm.  Cold, blah bread adds nothing to a meal, so shouldn't bother.  I would definitely go back, though and recommend.
author: Lisa B.

description: Interesting place at first, the decor is cool with jellyfish on the ceiling and wavy sculpture, making you feel underwater swimming with your food.  Yet, while the food was good, it was not sublime.  And for that price it had better be sublime.  Struck me as a bit of a tourist trap.  We were glad to check it out, but aren't in a hurry, there's far better dining in the city.
author: Rob M.

description: Great Decor!  Another Pat K owned restaurant located in SF.  Service should be better for the atmosphere.  My major disappointed was the service, but maybe that will change over time.  My favorite item is a simple yellowfin "AHI" tuna tartare.  I'll try Farallon again in 2006.
author: Sherman H.

description: Nice atmosphere and beautiful decor, love the jellyfishes! :) was there for lunch with the Dine About Town theme...pretty pricey though.
author: Yan M.

description: Sea food cooked in mass amounts of butter, served in a kookie underwater setting complete with all the wealthy tourists the midwest has to offer.
author: Cosmolicious L.

description:
Post Valentine's Dinner Review:

Most of the yelp reviews were spot on.
Made reservations 3 weeks ago and they got us in at 9:30pm. We were seated within 15-20 minutes. Staff was courteous but seemed a bit frazzled. Asked for the 5 course meal and our waiter initially said it had sold out, but went into the kitchen and came out a few minutes later to say it was still available. Waitstaff kept the water filled. 

The food was decently prepared but too salty. My girlfriend and I agreed that in order to get the potatoes as salty as they were they must have boiled them in brine and then fried them with salt. Desert, a chocolate souffle and hot chocolate, was the best part of the meal. 

The decor was playful and interesting but not very classy. 

Food ***
Decor **(purple velvet/cheesy murals)
Value *

BTW I think I was sitting at the table next to Gin L.
author: T L.

description:
Excellent service, excellent food and great decor.  This is definitely your luxury class restaurant.  Only the prices are too high, but other than that, it's a great restaurant by Union Square to bring all your rich friends who can afford to pay for your meal :)

Make sure to order a bunch of oysters too, they're so good.
author: Jim N.

description: This is one of my most favorite places in the city! I came here for my birthday when I first moved here and proceeded to go here for every other special occasion until I finally branched out!  Still, it remains one of my favorites.  The service is A+, the decor is amazing, and the food is ALWAYS delicious.  Do yourself a favor and make a reservation and see and taste it for yourself!
author: Jennifer H.

description: Can't believe I haven't reviewed this place yet. I went here with my girlfriends to celebrate my birthday. The wait was long as the place was jammed packed, but it wasn't too bad of an experience. The appetizers were awesome. The interior is great -- the jellyfish lamps, bubbled mirrors, fake seaweed, etc. all went well with the seafood theme. Food was great and so was the service. Would love to come back when it isn't too busy.
author: Maricel B.

description:
this was a very memorable dinner.  the first moment i stepped into this restaurant, the ceiling decoration caught my attention.  they had jelly fish shaped lights hanging from the ceiling.  very unique. 

we were seated in the back of the restaurant - where there's another dining room.  the seats were in the shape of a oyster shell.  our waiter and the staff was very nice.  the gentlement at the front brought me to the restroom when i asked where it was (don't they usually just tell you where it is instead of walking you there?)

the menu is expensive but one thing that i feel it's worth your money is the Sea Scallops.  It was cooked perfectly!  I was surprised because I've never had a place cook the scallops so good.  it wasn't overcooked or undercooked. PERFECT. and the scallops were huge also.  

they also have a oyster bar but i didn't try that.  maybe next time.  i also highly recommend this place for anyone who wants to eat seafood!
author: Kapo T.

description:
i got a fish. my ex got a steak. i'm usually more descriptive when it comes to food reviews, but i honestly can't remember much more about it besides my fish tasting quite fishy .. actually it was quite bad ... shocking given that farallon's forte is seafood. 

the entrees "appeared" spectacular .. but taste trumps presentation. i probably wouldn't have been so harsh on my rating had the food been more reasonably priced .. i expect really good food at this price.

definitely not worth it .. the hunt for good seafood continues ...
author: Anvy A.

description: So you def. know you're getting seefood; I felt like I was in the little mermaid. Some of it is cheesy but not bad to check out once. The food was ok; not great, not bad. I'm glad I went once but i probably wouldn't go back again. Pretty touristy and there are so many better seafood places in the city.
author: shadi m.

description: When I crave delectable, fresh, creatively prepared seafood with excellent service, I head to Farallon as this restaurant NEVER disappoints. Highly recommend the tasting menu with wine pairing. It's a great way to enjoy an evening out.
author: K A.

description: the food is wonderful I loved the lobster appetizer. And the ambiance is incredible! The dome ceilings feel subterranean. I love the bar area and the staircase leading upstairs. We sat in the shell booth, with an oblong table. I felt very privileged to dine her for a second time. We really enjoyed the server who sang in the restaurant! bravo!!
author: Brian M.

description: The best seafood around.  I went after I saw the play "Wicked" (a must see).  You can't really see anything outside the resturant, but once you go inside, you immediately see the jellyfish lights- they are one of a kind!  The food, as many have said, is spectacluar- you really cannot go wrong with anything on the menu, but I do suggest the patralie sole.  The dessert is also fantastic and  the chocolate cake with carmel filling is one of the best desserts I've ever tasted.  Bottom line- if you are ready for a dining experince and not just another resturant, Farallon is a must.
author: Shannon W.

description: I became a fan of Farallon when they comped our table of 10 with champagne because they were late in seating us (the table before us just would NOT leave).  I've always enjoyed their food and ambiance, but never had a chance to really enjoy dessert because I was always too full.  So, when my dinner companion and I were looking for a dessert, our concierge at the Grand Hyatt suggested we go to Farallon since the pastry chef had received numerous accolades and awards.  What a GREAT suggestion!  I had the chocolate malted crunch dessert (forgot the name, but can't forget the taste) and my dining companion had the carrot cake.  The chocolate dessert was ethereal and rich at the same time.  The chocolate ganache was scrumptious and in combination with the mousse and vanilla quenelle of ice cream with flecks of gold leaf and crystal sugar, it was a feast for the eyes and the palate.  The recommended carrot cake was just as scrumptious.  It was moist with a rich, but not cloyingly sweet icing.  It paired wonderfully with the cream cheese ice cream, salted pecans and kumquat marmalade.  At $10 each a pop, it was worth every single penny.  Easily two of the best desserts I have EVER had.  5 stars should be reserved for the extraordinary.  THIS was extraordinary!
author: CJ C.

description: The food and atmosphere here are the best.   The bass was so fresh and deliciously prepared and service was excellent.  Highly recommend this place.
author: EM M.

description:
i made a reservation quite ahead;stated it was my husband's birthday and requested a nice table;we were seated at the railing next to the kitchen/area where the head chef shouts orders to the chefs and the waitpersons pick up their plates (i.e. very,very, noisy). very unpleasant. the food was ok-good. i saw a number of birthday desserts going out with candles but none for my husband(:(). so, my reservation comments were completely ignored. 
we have eaten here before so were very disappointed....
author: kathy m.

description: Beautiful Decor, Good Food, but the decor..just incredible.
author: Diane R.

description: This is a splurge spot.  Every meal I have had there has been exceptional, although I have not been there lately.  The pastry chef is world class.  I think the interior was designed by Kuleto.
author: Max C.

description: Great seafood restaurant blocks off of Union Square--and in my humble opinion better than Aqua.  Certainly more entertaining inside, with jellyfish and other undersea sculptures lingering once you step inside.  Friends have had seafood, steak, and chicken and all dishes were great!  Not cheap, but drink in the atmosphere and enjoy the ambiance.
author: Lucas M.

description: Had lunch here with coworkers.  Pretty tasty lunch menu (hanger steak) was good).  The decoration is also nice.
author: Tinou B.

description: The decor is fun, but I say go to Aqua if you want to fine-dine on some seafood.  Farallon just isn't that great for the price, and the service is inexplicably haughty (hello?  you're basically a tourist trap).   We felt violated when the bill came, considering the quality of the experience.  Will never go back.
author: Jes H.

description: The wine list is outstanding.  Of course, plan on dropping some fairly serious dough to dine here.  The service is solid, perfunctory, knowledgeable.  The crustacean motifs running throughout the atmosphere make you feel like food.  The oysters don't get any fresher.  And really, all I need to say is, try the lobster bisque.
author: Abendigo R.

description: I have planned private dinners at Farallon for my company for the past two years and they never seem to let me down.. The food is impeccable. My favorites are the Grilled Main Diver Scallops and Alaskan Halibut.. The Short Ribs dish is also divine! The ambiance is just right for a business dinner or special occasion.
author: Trish P.

description: We celebrated my 31st at Farallon; it was so much more than I expected.  We tried a different appetizer but shared of course.  I couldn't tell whose I liked better.  We also all had a different entree and again, they were each unbelievably yummy.  Definitely share a desert, they are big, but they are totally worth it!  Thank you Mom & Pinky!!!
author: Angela D.

description: Seafood heaven!  Farallon sets the bar... I compare other seafood places or seafood dishes at other restaurants to Farallon.  And the decor is absolutely magical!  My only complaint is it can feel a little stuffy for my taste.
author: La A.

description: One of the first restaurants I ate at in SF.  I tend to think the "under the sea" theme is fun and interesting. Amazing seafood. Great cocktails, yummy bread. Be sure to know what you are ordering...I didn't pay attention to how my fish was prepared. The poor fish was fried whole and arranged as if it was swimming towards you as you ate it, eyes and all! Needless to say it was delicious, but I'll be sure to read the menu more carefully next time.
author: Shannon B.

description: Go here for the great atmosphere and decor.  The food is good, but definitely not the star here.  The design is tastefully done and unique, a pleasurable experience.
author: B J.

description: I came here for Valentine's Day in 2007. They did a really nice prix fixed menu. The food was really good, but I think once was enough.
author: Carson H.

description: Cool dining room. Like a trip to Atlantis, or Las Vegas. I can see why Farallon is popular with tourists. But the service was off... has anyone trained these people? And the food was only OK. Not nearly good enough for the price or the attitude.  I don't think I will be returning.
author: Nan C.

description: Wow what can i say about this restaurant.  It feels like you need to bring your sucba gear lol jk     this place has great seafood and the service is good. Oh and this place can get busy at times.  this rerstaurant is where i proposed to my wife
author: Justin G.

description: Can't go wrong with Farallon for a special occasion. Prices are very high, but the quality of the food and upscale dining experience are worth it.
author: a m.

description: I was not impressed with this place. The steak was much overcooked that I ordered med-rare.
author: David S.

description:
Very, very good meal, just not sure it was GREAT.  The menu is slim, in a good way- not overwhelming like some places can get (Cheesecake Factory Syndrome).  Ambiance is very much like an adult Dr. Suess underwater theme, replete with "shells" (tables) for couples and jellyfish chandeliers.

If you like ceviche, definitely give it a try here.  The raw bar is great and the ceviche constantly changes- I had the petrale sole that night, which was very light and refreshing.  GF had the mushroom & crab bisque, which tasted like Thanksgiving thanks to the wonderful truffle oil!  A little heavy though, so if you are going for a light meal you might want something else.  Great presentation though- they bring a bowl of crab and a pot of the bisque, after which the waiter pours the bisque into your bowl for you.

Had the thai snapper for dinner, which was the highlight of the meal for me.  It was crisp and buttery, but not overwhelming.  Good sized portions, but won't make you sick.  Lemongrass leeks & potatoes made a nice side to compliment the snapper, similarly light and buttery.

GF had the petrale & beef ravioli, which both were good but not great.  Ravioli was probably a bit better; the sole was very well-prepared, just nothing really popped out for me with the dish.

Passed on dessert, but they all looked great and smelled even better.

Service is superb- the waiter was very helpful with getting us comfortable with all the different dishes.  One of the chefs was even kind enough to take a photo of us on the spiral staircase- great group of people.

There are probably a few places that have better fish and plenty that are cheaper, but for a special dinner and an enchanted atmosphere, Farallon hits the spot.
author: James S.

description: Surprisingly quiet given the size of the restaurant.  Awesome seafood dishes, and the servers could not be nicer.  The desserts are phenomenol.  It is pricey and the ambience is very business dining.
author: Christina S.

description: Love the service at this place. The ambiance is great. Tuna tar tar yummy! We opted to sit at the bar instead of a table and the service and food were still excellent.
author: Palak P.

description: Overpriced Red Lobster. The seafood was ok. The wine list was fab. But for the price.. ehh. There are many other places to dine on so-so fishes here.
author: Rose J.

description: Mostly satisfying; though the decor tries too hard to be clever. Dining room reminds me of "The Snorks" or "The Little Mermaid" - all that's missing are the singing crabs.
author: Andrew C.

description: Beautiful interiors of oceanic delights.  Once you step inside, the jellyfish bar wows you with its beauty.  The food is also delicious.  I've enjoyed almost all the dishes I've tried so far except for the skate which was a few years ago.   This is one of my favorite higher end restaurants in San Francisco.
author: Animal K.

description: Yummy seafood! Great place to take clients. Can get a bit noisy but for the most part it serves its purpose--good food, entertaining client and decent price.
author: Bren L.

description:
The food is OK, but it wasn't special or memorable.  To be more specific, the dishes were inconsistent (mainly good, some not so good).  This should not be the case for a place like this charging the price they do.  The servers were also not particularly attentive.  It appears quality has declined over the decade.

I love the underwater decor though.
author: Jennifer D.

description: I have died and gone to dining heaven.  It is absolutely beautiful inside, reminded both of us of Europe.  Service was impeccable and the food divine.  We ordered appetizers that they split in the kitchen,no charge and also split the entree for us.  Just loved the softshell crab as well as the halibut.  The blueberry desert has this ice cream with it that is possibly the best I have ever had.  Oh shit, oh dear, I am already dreaming of going back to this restaurant, come on stretch pants!
author: Happy L.

description: Great seafood place.  Had a great booth with a view of the dining room and kitchen.  The crab salad was yummy.  Wreckfish was delicious.  And the dessert was a perfect finish to a great meal.
author: Richard L.

description: Celebrated my 30th birthday at Farallon. We made reservations through Open Table a couple of weeks in advance. We had good service which began with bread that they replenished throughout the entire meal. We loved the old ceilings as well as the fun jellyfish lights. I started with the LAURA CHENEL CHEVRE TART which was good but  didn't wow me. My husband had the SALAD OF MIXED BABY LETTUCES which he thought was ok. We were absolutely blown away by the 2nd course though. We both had the Mediterranean shellfish bisque which had incredible texture & flavor. It was creamy but not too heavy. Finally, I had the grilled Hawaiian Ono and my husband had the GRILLED CREEKSTONE FARMS CREEKSTONE FARMS PETITE FILET OF BEEF. Both of us thought that the entrees were delish, but I have certainly had better fish before. By the end of the third course, we were stuffed, which was good because they didn't offer a sweet treat to celebrate my birthday, which was a small disappointment. We brought our own bottle of wine and paid what we thought was a steep corkage fee of $25. We would return here, but may consider ordering other things (besides the bisque!)
author: Gillian M.

description: I had been to the Farallon many times over the years and really liked this place.  My last trip had me scratching my head.  I ordered the sashimi plate(18.00).  It was thin slices of sashimi, three of them and very thin, a garnish of greens(wasnt sure what they were, and little dabs of fresh sardine.  I assumed that if different ingredients are put on a plate, they are meant to eat together.  Well, the Sardine bits completely over powered the sashimi and the greens did nothing to enhance the sashimi. That dish was nothing short of a disaster.  Im baffled as to how that plate made it to my table.  It was that bad.  My second dish was the fresh monterey calamari.  Another disaster.  The calamari is sauteed in a slightly smoky broth, with some english peas and some nyoki.  The peas were very overpowering, I could not even taste the calamari, and some red pepper flaked were added which again, were too over powering.  Another dish that shoud never have left the kitchen.  Im not sure what is going on with the chef at farallon, but there is a serious lack of attention going on in the kitchen.  My duck entree was delicious, as was the fettucini and linguine appetizers,  The seabass entree and chicken dishes were also very tasty.  Service was a tad slow but efficient.  I like this place and hope they get it together in the kitchen.  When two out of the three plates you order are terrible, something is amiss.
author: victor j.

description: Good food, great decor, but totally not worth cost. You can get comparable food in bigger portions elsewhere for way better service and more reasonable price.
author: Amy H.

description:
my employers took me here for a welcome dinner.  the place had a very interesting decor.  we sat in the back, far away from the weird jelly fish chandelier. 

the food was excellent, but it was not amazing (i would call masa's amazing).  i had the pre fixe menu (3 courses, I think) and had plenty of wine. 

i didn't pick up the tab, so i can't say if it was worth the price.  however, i would definitely come back--especially if i'm not paying the tab.
author: Jaymee C.

description: This place is good but I don't know if you can justify the cost.  The food was great and the presentation was amazing but I feel as if I had better and seen better at other places. The decor makes me feel like I'm in a Las Vegas Casino, but it's an interesting theme.
author: Brent G.

description: I've been here a few times now, and each time the food, service, and atmosphere have been absolutely wonderful. This is definitely a special occasion restaurant, but well worth going at least once. All the ingredients were fresh, and the menu changes frequently. Try to do the wine pairings, as they are well worth it.
author: Franco R.

description: There really is nothing special about this place besides its decor that focuses on sea-related items. They have a seafood bar that I didn't try, but ordering food at the dinner table was just like eating at a regular American seafood restaurant. Really the only thing good about my meal was the foie gras with cranberries and cranberry sauce, but usually foie gras is good anyways if you plan to spend over $14 for it at any restaurant. Food was just average for a supposedly higher class restaurant such as this one. If you want to pay a lot of money for average-tasting food, then you can go ahead and dine here.
author: Henry L.

description: I liked it. Joe was our waiter. The staff was right on top of things. The food was good which was expected considering its reputation. I like the decor: funky jellyfish lamps are cool. My only complaint is that we ordered the apple pie with ice cream and they substituted whipped cream fbecause the chef thought the ice cream would melt on the way home. We were two blocks from our hotel. Seemed like an arrogant gesture.
author: Michael R.

description: This is a place where you get the chance to easily spoil yourself. I did without regrets. I sat at the oyster bar, inquisitively staring at the coquillages on display a bit everywhere and happily chatting with another customer, a charming young lady, who was sitting next to me. Wild mushroom bisque to start: simple, creamy, light, perfect compound of flavours. Seared Georges Bank scallops, truffled potato ravioli, shaved fennel salad, black truffle-lobster brodo followed. Perfect texture of the scallops and tasty fishy brodo, but I was a little disappointed by the three-but-large ravioli which were a bit overcooked (1 star less, inexcusable for a 27$ dish!).   The dessert, a warm Bolzano apple custard cake accompanied by delicious fior di capra ice cream, was awesome, fully worth its 10$. The total amounted to 70$ (beer and tax+tip included), definitely not cheap but justified (a part from the overcooked ravioli, grrrrr).  Needless to say, the service and the ambiance here are top notch.
author: Andrea L.

description: We had the most amazing dinner.  The wait staff was extremely attentive.  The best food and service.  We were there on Black Friday same time as the Union Square tree lighting ceremony.  We thoroughly enjoyed our dining experience.  Will come back again and again.
author: Zoe A.

description:
This restaurant is truly outstanding, it's my new fave recommendation. The best of best service. They really care about the customer and they tend to you literally hand and foot. They check on you at just the right times and are extremely helpful. I am a very indecisive person when I see new stuff in a menu but the waitress guided me in the right direction. I ordered a chicken dish and I didn't expect chicken to taste this good. Everything we ordered was incredible including the cocktails. I am in love !!!
UpDate*
We returned to reminisce our previous experience and unfortunately the economy reflected on the restaurant. The food was still great but the portions got a lot smaller and by smaller I mean a bite full. The waiters tired to rush us along by serving our wine glasses full time after time. I will still go for a cocktail that I love I can't remember the name but it the popular one and order for the bartender to the left of the bar. Their clientele is geared for executive business type now ...boo hoo.
author: Sandra M.

description:
I still like this place over the years. I like the fact that they give you total service  - including those little soups before your meal. It's so cool. 

I'm not huge on seafood, but this place makes it appealing to anyone.
author: C C.

description: Nothing great... The food was ok, the service was ok, but it's just average with above average prices.
author: Reviewer B.

description: The service was great!  They were very attentive and had good recommendations for wine.  We had the crab cakes and they were tiny but delicious because they were all crab.  The lobster on ice for the 1st course was ok.... the sauces were not that great.  The foie gras was delicious and so was the potato leek soup!  We had the ahi tuna and striped bass for the main course and they were delicious!!!  Yummy.  For dessert, the chocolate gateau and the carrot cake were to die for!  The carrot cake comes with this cheesecake ice cream and it is probably one of best tasting I've ever had.
author: L N.

description:
If you're worried about the next credit card bill, this isn't the kind of place.  However, if you've decided to splurge, I mean, REALLY splurge, and enjoy every bit of it, there are few establishments that are as fanciful as Farallon.  Let me show you how to really have fun at this place and really, really indulge.

As you're seated, order a bottle of Billecart Salmon Rose.  Mull over the hors d'oeuvre menu, but be sure to indulge in a large platter of oysters, at least a dozen per person, or if you order the little Kumamoto or Olympia, two dozen per person.  Alternatively, you can get a platter of seafood appetizer that gives you a heap of shrimps, crabs, lobsters, oysters and such.

The soup and main dishes seem to change daily, so I'd ask one of the highly knowledgeable wait staff for advise and recommendations.  If you have run out of the champagne, order another bottle, or move onto a different bottle, a richer one like Roederer Cristal.

For dessert, choose from one of the most decadent dessert wine list around.  This is one of few establishments which pours the venerable Chateau d'Yquem by the (small) glass.  For a while, they were pouring the vintage 1990, which is considered one of the finest in the recent years.  If you have a good-sized company, order a whole bottle, or better yet, bring one in with you.

The menu also apologetically includes some meat dishes and vegetarian dishes.  However, if you are ever afraid of seafood, this really isn't the kind of place for you as the decor itself, about which enough has been said, will cause you to break into hives, anyway.

Still, for those who love, no, I mean _adore_ seafood in a fanciful setting, there really is just no place other than Farallon.  Sure, if you follow my advice, it's hard to go below $200 / person, though its prix pixe with paired wines is a very good deal.

I too have to warn you that, there is no point of going to Farallon and be stingy about it.  Perhaps some of the less than wonderful reviews at Yelp are a result of that.  This place is about fanciful indulgence in all senses.

For one of these special moments with a good reason to celebrate, with a comfortable credit limit, it's just an experience like no other.
author: Anonymous M.

description: Had my first dining experience at Farallon the other night...and I have to say...I loved it.  The decor is absolutely fabulous!  The jellyfish lights are so creative.  The food was great!  We had the hamachi sashimi and scallops for appetizers.  For my main course, I had the soft shell crabs.  I have never had soft shell crabs cooked so good!  This is a must!!
author: tiffany m.

description: Loved it. The food, the service, and the setting. It was a great experience. It was a birthday night out and the restaurant treated us with a little something special- an amuse and an additional dessert.
author: Lu R.

description: The food should get at least four stars, but everything else deserves two, so we have settled on three.  I thought the decor was too cheesy.  I get it-- underwater.  We had a terrible table, next to the server's station, so all night we had a crowd next to us.  Our service was slow and not very helpful.  I'm sure if we tried it again, we would have a better experience, but one "meh" trip for seafood is enough for me.
author: Jessica T.

description: We had a large gift certificate to go here and we went and enjoyed every bit of it. I thought from the reviews that the decor would be over the top 90's tacky, but it was fine. The service was great. We sat in the small back room where several parties of sloshed gourmands slurred their words mightily. I had a salmon dish in summer/fall and the sauce was bit heavy, but my friend's lamb was divine. Yum...still more on the gift certificate. Which occasion shall we use it for?
author: jen n.

description: A very nautical experience.  Jellyfish and clams are everywhere...except for the menu.  For a seafood joint, they sure lack the substance to be considered one.  I ordered the Artic Char and it was just an overpriced Salmon.  It's definitely a great place to have a private party, but you'd have to order enough to meet their quota.  If not willing to shell out the dough for the private room, then it's not worth the time nor money to dine here.  It's fairly loud, kind of expensive, and the service is just ok.
author: Kelly L.

description: Wonderful experience! I heard about this place from my boss at the time who had me book a table for a potential client.  I decided to try it for myself after browsing their website.  The restaurant's specialty is seafood and, therefore, is decorated as such.  When you walk in, there are beautful jellyfish lights above the tables. The murals on the walls make it feel more elegant and inspiring.  The food is pricey (so be prepared for that when you go) but its spectacular, and worth the money.  I would definitely go back again.
author: Jennifer O.

description: Went here for dinner before the Opera and enjoyed every minute of it.  It's like sitting in an underwater paradise.  Don't forget to look up.  From the jelly fish type-chandeliers to some booths shaped like conch shells.  I remember I really wanted the crab but we went during the 'oil spill' clean up in the bay - so that was out of the question.  I had the Ono instead with truffles which melted in my mouth.  We ordered the best desert in the world: the banana bread pudding which my date only had one bite of before I devoured it.  I remember running my finger across the desert plate to get the last of the sauce too!  I wasn't that embarrassed ... it was THAT good!
author: sarah b.

description:
This is a place you want to take out of town guests to wow them.  Some of your more jaded palates will disagree with me on that but since we don't have a Momofuku here, I'll still stay with that opinion.  The decor is probably the main reason.  The food second.  This is very good dining and the bar scene is definitely entertaining if your dining in the front of the restaurant.  The more quiet and reserved sections are in the back.  Service is excellent.  I had the tasting menu which was fine.  Probably not exactly on par with Gary Danko's but they continually improve.  
Pricey as would be expected.  Please don't expect to get out without paying at least 75 per head sans wine, thats if you are going for 3 courses.
author: Jeffrey C.

description: We had a wonderful experience.  We had intended to order the prix fixe dinner, but didn't realize there was a time limit (our reservation was for 7, and the menu said it was served only until 6:30).  But our waiter asked the chef and my husband was able to order the prix fixe.  Both of our meals were FABULOUS.  I had lobster risotto and he had ono.  I thought the salads were delicious though mine was small and overpriced, but the rest of the meal, the excellent service, and lovely decor made this easy to overlook. and yes, the lamps are AMAZING!
author: jill c.

description: My husband and I dined here last night. What a truly enjoyable experience. As many have previously stated, the decore is quite unique. The wait staff was attentive, knowledgeable, and enjoyable. We each had three courses and split a dessert. The dessert was to die for; we had the chocolate mousse. The other courses were just as good. The only reason that I give the restaurant four stars, and not five, is that in one of the fish dishes that my husband ordered there were a number of bones still present. Overall, I would reccomend this place to anyone.
author: Linda B.

description: I need to start writing restaurant reviews right away so I don't forget what I ordered but I suppose if I forget,  then it wasn't a very memorable meal. The tuna tartare was good. The fish dish (sorry, I forgot which one it was) was just ok. The interior was nice & the waitstaff was good. I think I need to go back and try other dishes.
author: JM K.

description:
This place is BEAUTIFUL.

If you want the ultimate luxe, chic dining experience, take your date here. 

The decor is fabulous, the food is good, but come on...it's all about the decor.

Great idea to go here before seeing a play or something.
author: Nicole R.

description: really great seafood especially the fresh, uncooked raw bar. Wow. But, don't let them seat you in the low ceiling area connecting the back room and the bar. The lighting sucks and the noise is bad. The upstairs is good and the back room with the mosaic ceiling is best.
author: Gus W.

description: I was so excited to finally go to Farallon I had heard many good things about it; until I went there not so much!! We were sat right next to the kitchen very cramped and noisy and you would think since its literally two feet away from the table the food would have been hot....well unforantly not my dish. I have to say the service was excellent very attentive and professional~~ but save your money on other things]] Way TOO  EXPENSIVE for what you get
author: Sara S.

description: Great food, Ok desserts, and bad service.  Our server didnt even smile, we saw him like 2 times.
author: Kool G.

description: The best food in the city!  Message me if you want a recommendation for their greatest server :)
author: Andrew S.

description: You will not be disappointed with the restaurant at all if you know you have to eat there. Don't aim for portion, aim for quality, presentation, atomsphere and that big ass hole in your wallet soon to be burned by the bill. They make great desserts, I have to admit however the main entrees were ALL THAT impressive. Nothing too special. The dessert I had was something called "bloody orange" I really can't remember but it's a similar in the menu, look for it. My friend shoveled out $700 that night for us, how generous but I bet he went home and cried afterwards. LOL.
author: Mighty M.

description:
My friend took me to Farallon for my Christmas present as we both like trying out restaurants. It was a good experience. If you don't have time, here are my ratings:
ambiance: 4 stars
service: 4 stars
food: 3.5 stars (good portion)
Overall: 4 stars

if you have time, keep reading. :)
We started off with some oysters and the oysters were fresh and sweet. Then we moved off to the first course. I had the Geo duck clam citrus salad; it was fantastic (order it if it is on the menu, because they don't get a constant supply of it). My friend ordered the octopus, but it wasn't as good as my geo duck clam salad. For entree, I order the Quail, which was great. They gave me 2 quails! For my friend, he had the branzino (They give you an entire fish, not just two bits! Generous portion size).  The first branzino we had to send it back because it was under cooked. The second one, they did it right and it was fully cooked. The fish was great. For dessert, I had the frozen tangerine sorbet and this dessert is out of this world. As for wine, our waiter was very helpful and picked 2 bottles out for us. One white and one red. Both delicious. 

What does this mean? If you go to Farallon, Try the following:
1. Oysters or the cold seafood platter
2. Order the Geo duck salad if it is on the menu
3. Order the Quail or the Branzino 
4. Order the Frozen tangerine sorbet

Overall, even with the mishaps, farallon is a great place to go for dinner. Hope this helps.
author: Alice S.

description: It is definitely a place to visit for sea food.  I love the oysters that they have.  I visited Farallon with a colleague of mine and we had a dozen oysters and the food was fantastic.  The staffs are not only attentive but also very knowledgeable about the menu and about the oysters.  I cant wait to go back.  How come 4 stars you asked?  Well, the staffs at the front desk were snobbish and they could learn a thing or two about customer service from the wait staffs.
author: Stan D.

description:
Visited here during the dine about town a couple years back.  I was wowed by the decor.  You feel like you're in a make believe aquarium with the ceramic glass octopus hanging from the ceiling.  I also liked the seating layout.  There were tables for intimate dining away from the group seatings.

As for the food, the butternut squash soup and the flourless chocolate cake were delicious.  Soup was rich but palatable.  The cake was divine with the creme fraiche and caramel.  The entree however was severely lacking.  It was an unmemorable piece of fish that was dry and flavorless.  Thank goodness I had the cake to end my night!
author: sasaw A.

description:
I had heard some good things about Farrallon and we decided to try it when in San Francisco recently.  We thought the decor was GORGEOUS and appropriate.  I would describe it as a soft ambiance - better for a romatic date or business dinner than a girls night out.

We weren't so hungry coming back from eating in drinking in Napa for 4 days so we did some tasting and sharing.  My friend who likes more simple food got the cold lobster appetizer and loved it.  My husband and I shared the dungeness crab cake appetizer - it was very good and light.  Not a typical crab cake in that there was no breading - all crab meat.   We also shared the hot smoked alaskan salmon - nothing like "lox" and it was delicious.  The portions are not large, which they tell you, but are of quality.  We then shared the scallops for a main course which we also thought were  very good. The flavors are not overpowering yet accent the food.  Also the food tends to be very rich by nature so the smaller portions and lighter flavors worked well for us.  We are from South Florida so are somewhat spoiled when it comes to fresh seafood and would go again.  The biggest downside was there seemed to be a great happy hour special that was only available in the bar.  We didn't have time to go to the bar first so missed out on it.
author: Robin R.

description: Meh.  Meal was OK, not great or memorable.  Service was fine.  Worthy of a return visit?  No.
author: Glenn R.

description: Like dining in an underwater seascape.  The detail to the entire dining experience is captivating.  Excellent.
author: David L.

description: What can you say? 500+ reviews says a lot. It was my birthday and it was just me and my girl. We had walked into Farallon the evening before my birthday on our way back to our hotel to check it out and just look and the decor and to make a decision whether to come there or go to the Clift Hotel for dinner on my special day. The manager  greeted us and gave us a tour of the place and a little history on the location as well as told us about the happy hour if we would like to try it the following day. WE decided to come back for dinner and let me tell you, it was exquisite and AMAZING!!!  Every dish. . . the wine. . . the service. . . the attention. . . The manager greeted us again remembering us from the previous night and we were treated like VIP's. Our 2 person table  was nothing  like the 5 or 7 party tables that were dining there yet we were treated just the same. I will always remember this birthday and I am so glad to have found a great dining experience that I can't wait to indulge the next time in San Francisco.
author: Keenan K.

description: Way overpriced for what it is. Sure the decor is nice, but the service is super slow and the food is ok. For a little more, go to Gary Danko instead for a once in a lifetime experience. It took 15 minutes to get my wine glass, and they do not let you taste it before! Bill was $120 with tip for one glass of wine and tomato bisque for an appetizer, and Halibut and sea bass for the main entree. Their dessert was also so-so, lacking much decoration. I am happy I choose Gary Danko for the actual night of our anniversary and this for the next night! I would only go again with a restaurant.com offer!
author: Nick K.

description: I had dinner here with my fiance and my parents last Friday night.  It was a great experience! The ambiance was cool, the food was delicious and the service was excellent.  I definitely recommend this place!
author: Kelly S.

description: This is as good as seafood gets! Fine dining at it's finest, Farallon does not disappoint. The service is impeccable, knowledgable and overall just perfect. I cannot recommend any other SF seafood restaurant higher than Farallon. Everyone needs to splurge every now and then and just be treated to an unmatched dining experience! Take your very significant other out own the town. Farallon will NOT disappoint.
author: Phil T.

description: Good friends of mine recently visited from Chicago & I recommended Farallon for dinner, NY's day 2011.  We were seated in the center section of the restaurant, which is nice but not nearly as beautifully appointed as the main dinning room & is a bit noisier since it's right next to the kitchen.  That being said... we did have a most "excellent" meal and experience!!  The wait staff was exceptional!  From Ann our head server to Jennifer the Sommelier, who recommended an excellent Pinot Noir (reasonably priced) & Adam who joked with us and gave some history on the restaurant, the Chef's & who also brought us a wonderful dessert... BITTERSWEET CHOCOLATE MOUSSE... from Julia Child's personal recipes. They have great fish dishes with unusual sauce and side pairings & a must do experience at least once!!
author: Natalie W.

description: Definitely a very over-rated restaurant. For the price and all the hype, Farallon is the spoiled step-child gone wild. The seafood didn't live up to the standards from what you would expect from such a highly acclaimed restaurant, though the presentation was excellent. The decor alone is probably worth the visit, though i don't recommend anyone spending that kind of money for the food.
author: benjamin c.

description:
The decor is very neat. They did a great job with it.

The food is good. For the price, the food should be great. The halibut was a bit dry. The Sole was good but I wont' remember it. 

If you want to spend $100 a head for dinner with wine... head to Boulevard
author: G U.

description:
Great service, great food, great atmosphere.    I'll be back for all three and the Barramundi. 

if there were half stars, this would be four and half because the lobster was slightly under cooked, otherwise rounding up to five because everything else was great.
author: D S.

description: Sauces are way to heavy.  After an evening of shrimp, tartar and a fish entree I don't expect to come away feeling stuffed and like I've overeaten.  Not cheap!  I liked the bread and butter with the salt...nice touch.  I wouldn't go back here.  Service was good.
author: Janet L.

description:
The menu is always changing at this restaurant... and I'm not sure if it's just because the VIP service we get, but the food has almost always exceeded expectations.  I was fortunate to frequent this place with friends that were well acquainted with the owner, sommelier, wait staff, and not to mention, the CHEF! So my guess is that our service was more pleasant than what I'd receive at any other typical restaurant.  

That aside... I typically always get whatever fish they have on the menu... and it's always been prepared deliciously! Their seafood platters are quite a sight to see!! And their dessert!! YUM!! I'm craving those sweet cream cheese donut holes or what have you, sprinkled lightly with sugar, that just melts in you mouth!! It's been far too long since I've been there, I think it's time I make a visit again!
author: Liz G.

description:
The main attraction for me is the decor.  The underwater theme was fabulous.  It kept my 4 year old entertained the whole time.  I've heard if you have a larger group they seat you in an area that is less inspired, so keep that in mind if you are planning a party.

Oh yeah, the food and service was very good too.
author: Brian Z.

description:
Well the first thing to strike you when you enter this restaurant is the decor. In my humble opinion it is fun and adds a great deal of character to the whole experience, but I can see how it could be perceived as verging on if not totally on the kitsch side. 
Decor aside we had a very pleasant dinner here, enjoying wine and fish alike, with a cocktail to start as we waited to be seated at our table. 
Atmosphere is certainly not lacking here, and there is the fantastic ability to go dressed in your shopping clothes or to dress it up in the classic little black dress, always a big plus in my eyes - sometimes you just want to eat and sometimes to make a night of it! 
Beyond the personal dinner, I have also dealt with this restaurant for work purposes, hosting a rather important dinner for some of our top clients in one of their lovely themed rooms. While there is a set menu, it is set by you, and plenty to chose from as you can limit or add to the choices at your leisure for a price, and a bar or simply wine menu is also an option. It was a good choice and our clients (many from the east cast and midwest) enjoyed it immensely. So for personal or business purposes, this is a restaurant well worth checking out.
author: Michelle C.

description: We had a great dining experience at Farallon.  We went for our first wedding anniversary.  My husband had dined there before, but it was my first visit.  We enjoyed a great meal, but the service is what made the meal even better.  We were never without water, butter for our bread, etc....the service was friendly, efficient and effortless.  They knew it was our anniversary and wrote "Happy Anniversary" on our dessert plates....cheesy for some, but it was a nice touch.  We would definitely go back to Farallon!
author: Theresa S.

description: We went to Farallon on Sat. 12/11. It was not a good experience. We had 6pm res. & we did not have dinner till 8pm. Our waiter was new & really did not know what he was doing. Very nice, but inexperienced. The busboy should have been our server. He was great. Our food luke warm &we did not send it back because of the long wait. One of the meals was so salty that they compt. that meal & bought a round of drinks. It is a beautiful environment,but skip the dinners. We would never go back. The place was packed so maybe we just caught them on a bad night. D. Meade
author: Diane M.

description: Going to this establishment is definitely an "event" and I would short change yourself by only ordering 1-2 courses. Because it was my birthday my husband ordered the whole shebang starting with the perfect caviar, all three courses, dessert and a dessert port. Sweetbreads was a new experience for me but the balance of flavors to offset the richness and texture made  it enjoyable. The chocolate malt gateau dessert was to die for. The ambiance and service are spectacular.
author: Carisa F.

description: Another one of those cool hip places with good ambiance but rather unexciting food. Overpriced dishes that are more decorative than tasty. Went on a double date here. While the drinks and service where excellent the food just didn't justify the prices. Dinner for four $500 with drinks. With a price tag like that at least have something memorable on the menu. For the same amount, try Michael Minna.
author: Howard C.

description: The Farallon delivers! My girlfriend and I had made reservations for 6pm at the Farallon before a 8 oclock showing of Wicked at the Orpheum. We rushed out of my place and had more then enough time until we hit the bay bridge valentines traffic, or "love traffic" as i like to call it. My GF called the Farallon and told them we were running a behind, the hostess said "no problem". After getting the car parked, we finally arrived at 6:30. It was valentines, the place was packed, i was certain we had lost our tables and was already starting to review my choices at mcdonalds. I told the hostess my name, and she said "good thing you called and told us you were running late, and that makes all the difference!". Next thing i know, we are seated at our tables and enjoying the awesome under the sea decor. Our waiter was extremely helpful and agreed that since we had a show at 8, he would make sure we got our food quickly. We had ordered the stuffed calamari, AWESOME!, I had the petrale sole, my GF had scallops, and we split the blood orange creme brulee for dessert. We are both foodies and are very picky with our grub, every course was both visually impressive and tastey! We will be back to try the raw bar the next time we are in the city.
author: Danny R.

description: This place has amazing decor, and great food (though small portions) - but it's totally not worth the price.  A good spot to check out once, or to splurge on if you are wanting to impress someone...just familiarize yourself with the website, and be picky about where they seat you- you're paying for the ambiance!
author: t j.

description: Seafood is not one of my favorites, but Farallon sure changed that. The first time I ate here we had a menu comprised entirely of small entrees with a glass of wine specially chosen to accompany it. I was very impressed. Needless to say, the food was exquisite and always merits another visit.
author: Guillaume J.

description:
I have eaten here on at least three occasions and enjoyed it every time.  The service has always been impeccable and the seafood is perfect.  I don't get the last comment that this is supposed to be a french restaurant....I think of it as a seafood restaurant.  And as a seafood restaurant there is nothing 'Disney' about it, except for maybe the decor?  The decor is whimsical (light fixtures shaped like jellyfish, paitings of sea turtles swimming through the flooded restaurant) but I enjoy it and think the decor is beautiful.

My last visit we had drinks at the bar before sitting down to dinner. The bartender offered to make me up a cocktail (ie., one not on the menu).  That's how I tasted the 20th century - a retro cocktail named for a train that used to run on the East Coast (back when train travel was sophisticated and classy).  It was delicious and I really enjoyed that the bartender took the time to suggest the drink.  This restaurant employs real bartenders and I appreciate it.

If you like shellfish I recommend the seafood platter.  The 'grand' size would serve 3 or 4 as main course, the smaller size is good for 2 or 3.  This platter has yummy shrimp, crab, lobster and oysters. 

I've also enjoyed the wine selection and dessert.  All in all this restaurant makes for a lovely celebration dinner, even when all you want to celebrate is 'hey, it's Thursday'.

It is a bit expensive. I tink the pricing is reasonable given the service, decor and high quality of the food...but this is not the home of the 99 cent fishstick. Be prepared to pay about 50$ a person.
author: Sarah A.

description:
for a white table cloth - a solid 4-stars.  i went with the 3 course pre-fixe for 50:  it was delicious.  the menu is interesting and the ingredients fresh.  the wine list had some nice selections, but it wasn't really deep (actually, almost a bit standard), but i understand how inventory goes.  regardless, good service, good atmosphere.  would i go back?  sure.

not included in this rating, that was included in our bill was the 4% addition to our check for the sf health initiative.
author: Dank G.

description:
The original, albeit slightly theme-parky ambiance, made Farallon a San Francisco landmark. And to a certain extend, a touristic attraction. But this Union Square restaurant is worth putting your prejudice aside to enjoy its fresh, inventive coastal cuisine. But remember to smile, you may end up on someone's photo album.

For an in-depth photographic review, read more at 
http://www.nosaladasameal.com/2008/10/farallon-san-francisco.html
author: Haas H.

description: I went there for my b-day and the manager was extremely nice. initially, he didnt want to make a separate menu for my group, but we insisted because we didnt want some of my friends to order more than what was necessary. I still ended up paying over 500 bucks for i would say a very 1 star restaurant service. ALL of my friends hated the food and it was EXTREMELY salty as if it they accidentally dumped a whole container of salt into the dishes. all of us hated the food. The cake was very nicely decorated and i felt the dinner was quite nice, but that is because i was surrounded by people i liked and the jelly fishes on the ceiling really made it special...the decor was nice and the lightening in the dining area was dim and romantic and that is why i am giving it a 2 star. Also, the manager was nice, but other than that the food was tasteless and expensive and very very salty. NONE of us could eat it. In addition, my cake at the end was cut and thrown into the box and was so smashed that we couldnt even eat it afterwards. it was destroyed :( In addition, one lady server was mean through out the entire night. but i figured, the restaurant cant  control that...anyway, this is the reason why im giving it a two star. it is expensive, but the service and the food we ate wasnt that good. the only reason i chose this place was the simple fact that it was romantic and cozy and classy....other than that my food experience wasnt good at all...
author: Ladyinred D.

description: Home run.  Wife and I loved it.  Great ambience, presentation, and food.  Pricey but seems appropriate for the experience.  One of my favorite restaurants ever.
author: Pedro V.

description: swanky little seafood place. just gorgeous atmosphere and we loved the food. we both only had appetizers and drinks but were very happy with everything. a bit expensive yes, but if you're in the mood you'll enjoy it here.
author: Michelle I.

description: Farallon in Spanish means a coastal small barren island or a rocky projection of great dimensions, but there is nothing small, barren, or rocky about it. From the moment you enter, your eye will be delighted by the magnificent and whimsical Jacques Cousteau meets Disney interior decor, and amused by the jellyfish chandeliers. Servers who are on top of this culinary pampering enhance the flow of the food to your table. I was there for Dine About Town on Saturday for lunch (aka Rain About Town), a nice 3 course prix fixe bargain at $21.95, considering that Farallon can run you about $58. No choices here, the starter was a butternut squash soup with pumpkin seed oil, which tasted quite nice and perfectly suited the rainy, cold weather outside. The entree was a roasted Hawaiian mahi mahi with almond and meyer lemon relish, flageolet (immature French green kidney beans, the name comes from the French word for a small flutelike instrument, pronounced fla-juh-lay) beans, and arugula pistou (a French vegetable soup). The relish made the whole dish, which was very good. Dessert was outstanding: a pumpkin upside down cake with bourbon vanilla bean caramel and vanilla chantilly (sweetened whipped cream). The caramel was drizzled in a circle around the cake, and it was amazing. It almost matches the dessert I had at Farallon two years ago, which was so good I wrote it down: an apple cake with calvados (an apple liqueur) caramel, vanilla anglaise, and vanilla chantilly, one of the best desserts I have ever had. The other items that year were a sweet potato soup with hazelnut oil, and a seared Hawaiian mahi mahi with French green lentils (du Puy I hope), braised red chard, and mushroom duxelles jus. Executive chef Emily Luchetti is amazing, and her desserts outshine even the elegant fin fare of Chef/Owner Mark Franz. This was my 4th time at Farallon and it's one of my favorite restaurants.
author: Hao L.

description: Excellent service, gorgeous decor, and the food was awesome. Very expensive meal, but I think definitely worth checking out what I call the "jellyfish" restaurant.
author: Tracy P.

description:
Our group of 4 had dinner 6/4/2010, a Friday night. This was my third visit to Farallon.

Pat Kuleto's under-the-sea/art nouveau decor reflects a very strong vision, with splashy jellyfish light fixtures over the bar and  a sort of coral reef approach to the structures dividing the booths and tables. Some will love it; others will find it crosses the border to Disneyfied kitsch. The booths are comfortable and the lighting adequate but romantic. During our visit the restaurant was full and lively without feeling overcrowded or overheated. We could hear each other without raising our voices. 

The hosts were accommodating about our party's staggered arrival. Once we were seated, the  service did not miss a beat.  It was smooth and professional without being stuffy. 

I had read many reviews asserting that portions were small but did find that to be the case myself. Compared to a truck stop pancake breakfast or the massive piles of mediocre food some of the restaurants at Fisherman's Wharf serve, yes, the portions were on the small side. I thought they were more than satisfying and appropriate to the type of restaurant, and I  am no size 2 supermodel. 
Maybe I felt so full because the bread and butter so were wonderful that  I ate a lot of bread--and they were constantly refilling our bread plates. 

My husband and I shared our dishes so I got to try six items plus the complimentary amuse-bouche plus dessert. The food was never less than highly competent, but a couple of the dishes really did not hit the "wow" level you hope for at these prices. The menu changes constantly so comments on individual items are of limited value, but here goes: The beet puree (that's the best term I can find for it) came out on individual tasting spoons and brought great promise with it--a gorgeous golden color and wonderful explosion of flavor, and I dislike beets. The dungeness crab salad first course was bland in color and flavor. My husband's shrimp parfait with avocado was much more attractive and tasty. The second course hickory smoked salmon was quite nice, with strong but not overwhelming salty, smoky flavor and pleasantly moist in the middle. The crab cakes (not to be confused with the crab salad) were also good. The Hawaiian Ono the third course was served with beautiful vegetable accompaniments and a nicely flavored sauce. This was the strongest dish of the lot to my taste. My husband had the Mediterranean Branzino and we both enjoyed that as well. I ordered the Baked Alaska to share with the table and was not thrilled with it: the meringue was rubbery rather than airy on the inside and crisp on the outside, and the combination of extremely rich chocolate ice cream and extremely rich chocolate cake was excessive. 

We drank a bottle of Roederer Estate Brut Rose (sparkling) $56) and a bottle of Domaine Vacheron Sancerre ($65), both entirely satisfactory. 

The lively surroundings, professional service and overall good food made for a very enjoyable evening, but I would want to see Farallon kick some of the food up a notch before giving it five stars.
author: Susie L.

description: Great atmosphere and design work.  Very good service and the food was terrific.  Would definitely go again.
author: Richard H.

description: Farallon is my favorite seafood restaurant. It is defintely the most fun. You feel as if you have entered Neptune's kingdom. There are giant jellyfish lights, nautical iron work, netting for curtans, fish scales behind the bar, seaweed/kelp columns aroundthe bar, and old circlular aquatic paintings that reminds you of an interior of a large sailing ship -like portholes. The food here is so delicious and their flavors are distinct. They *know* how to cook seafood the best out of any restaurant I've been to. The ambience is magical and the food is very noteworthy. I highly recommend Farallon for a night out!
author: Lisa J.

description: I liked Farallon during the tech-crash heavings ,when the Nasdaq was at 1,500, parking was easy, and anyone who had $20 for a dinner entree was treated like a celebrity. Remember those halcyon  recessionary days?  Now the marketing directors and synergy leveragement specialists are back, and any remotely trendy restaurant again has license to be uppity.  Uppity means tiny portions, mediocre quality, indifferent service, and, the most uppity of all uppity, they automatically add in a tip!  They're no longer really trying.  You can get better seafood at most Cantonese restaurants in Richmond, or better yet, San Jose -- and just like Farallon, they have aquariums too!  (Har har.)  But the place was crowded even on a Monday early evening, so business is booming, and if I were in their position, I wouldn't be trying extra-hard when customers already flock.  So I toast the goateed, black-turtlenecked marketing directors with newly leased BMW 325s, because they keep the jellyfish lamps, umm, afloat.  I will stay away from places like this until they once again appreciate me.
author: Non P.

description: Went here with my partner for our 11 year anniversary.  The portions are small, but the prices have also been reduced.  (It's still waaay overpriced) but not like it was before!)  The oddest thing was the service.  The waiter was at once pretentious and obsequious. He had a tendency to over explain each dish even after we had ordered it, which gave us the impression he was either trying to up sell and/or trying to warn us about the extremely small portions.  However, the food was delicious and we had a wonderful time overall.
author: Laurie L.

description: for the past 10 years, farallon has been the san francisco restaurant that always keeps up its promises to deliver the best to the food-lovers. i love the place, for its decor, service, and food.
author: Connie H.

description: Food is awesome but pricey.  This is the place to take a girl if you want to impress her.  The restaurant has a beautiful "under the sea" theme.  Remember to do your research online so you can point out the architecture to your date and pretend you know what you're talking about.  Order some oysters with a few glasses of wine and you're on your way!
author: Eric L.

description: Really great place. I've been eating here off and on for 10 years or so and Farallon has been consistently good. Great decor, very original. Really good seafood bar. Excellent cocktails, too.
author: Errey S.

description: I've had dinner here recently. I had the Maryland Striped Bass, which was very good. This place also is extremely elegant, which makes it an ideal place for a romantic dinner. On the negative side, this place is REALLY expensive. I think the place is good for special occasions, but I won't be a regular here.
author: Simon B.

description: the decor itself is just stunning and even if you like the cuisine or not, you'll still have a good  time.  the staff is very friendly and fortunately for me the food was top notch.  great seafood dishes w/ some incredibly fresh fish.  started w/ the butternut squash soup that was excellent and then had the mahi mahi and was absolutely stunned by how good it was.  the dessert was literally just icing on the cake!
author: Swarup B.

description: High end, tasty food.  So expensive. Liked their desserts.  Free birthday dessert.
author: e g.

description: Dinner here would have been a surprise except control-freak me decided to peak at my boyfriend's google calendar and I discovered this is where he was going to take me for V-day. So V-day comes around and I'm excited but the boyfriend is late, very late and he tells me that he has to pick me up in his motorcycle instead of taking the car bec. we're late and they won't seat us after 6pm. There I am waiting in front of my apartment for 25 minutes. I changed out of my pretty black dress into black pants, a motorcycle jacket, boots, and instead of carrying a purse I am carrying this huge motorcycle helmet (I have a big head). I glance at my watch and it's 6:15pm -oh sh#t we're never going to get in. But this story has a happy ending because although we were about an hour late for our reservation they took us anyway. Although my boyfriend had to park his motorcycle illegally on the street his bike didn't get towed. We had the five course meal, service was great, and the restaurant does make you feel like you are underwater =which was very calming.  The food isn't amazing but it's close. If you never eat here come inside and take a tour -the jelly fish lamps are unbelievable.
author: Kat F.

description:
had an amazing meal here for our anniversary.  as mentioned in previous reviews, the decor is beautiful.  it feels like you are dining in a opulent cavern, decorated with jellyfish chandeliers and fish light fixtures.  the wait staff is very warm & friendly.  they are also knowledgable about the wine list and makes great recommendations.  i had a wonderful german reisling.  

the food was excellent as well.  we had the ceviche and ahi sashimi appetizers to start with.  for the main course, i had the wreckfish with gnocchi and english peas.  my husband had the halibut.  both of us thoroughly enjoyed our dishes and were stuffed.  we managed to find room and shared the chocolate cake that was accompanied by banana sherbet.

all in all, a lovely meal :)
author: Beatrice L.

description: Sure can't see the 5 stars other have given.  Maybe for the decor, certainly for the service.  But the food?  I had expected an extensive seafood menu-but there were only 8 entrees total!  And 3 were not fish!  So, I ordered the ono, my wife a trout dish.  Mine- too salty and still nothing to brag about.  Hers- boring, nothing really special.  The service was very good, the lemony desert I had delish- But hey, for 300 bucks for two, I sure did expect something, well maybe out of the ordinary
author: Dan B.

description: When I was told we would be going to Farallon for a pre-theatre dinner I checked out the website to see what kind of place it was. I was a little skeptical because it seemed a little cheesy from the website. When I walked in, however, I was very impressed. The decor is so different and innovative, but still very classy and serene. I loved it! The service was perfect (very friendly and engaging, but not overbearing) and they were very accomodating to our timing. The food was excellent and we all enjoyed what we ordered. I need to go back to try it again though when I have more than an hour so I can have a full dining experience.
author: Elizabeth R.

description: First time visit to the Farallon celebrating my 50th birthday with girlfriends.  The Jellyfish bar is amazing; had drinks at the oyster bar counter while waiting for our table. We sat at the end of the counter where the serving staff picks up the orders. The only issue here is that you can easily hear the bickering of the wait staff w/ the preparers behind the bar; really not a good thing.  We were seated at a very nice table; the decor of the restaurant is beautiful; the food is excellent. Our waitress (from Manhattan) was very nice but could of been a bit more attentive; we felt rushed when she did come by the table.  I was given a really nice Happy Birthday dessert; she dropped it off then quickly departed. Not the same treatment as another in the restaurant that had a few of the wait staff singing to him. I am giving the restaurant 4 stars since I am fan of their drinks and food; but think their staff needs to be reminded of a few things.
author: Justine P.

description: Farallon is very pretty, but the food is not equal with the prices. I like comeing here, but I like othe places more for less $$.
author: Michele A.

description:
first let me say that i am a former employee. 
second let me discount the claims that the food is overpriced. i believe most of the things on the menu are a generous potion, and the food is very fresh. most of the food is prepared on a daily basis, and the fish is almost never more than 2 days old.
third let me agree that the building is quite beautiful. the ceiling of the main dining room is an amazing arched mosaic. it was the ceiling 2 stories over the elks club pool. they built a floor 1 story above the pool and left the pool 1 floor below the dining room.
lastly, i must say it i probably one of the cleanest kitchens i have ever worked in. some people that haven't worked in kitchens may not think that is something worth mentioning but if you haven't worked in kitchens you don't know. there is almost always something you will see that is nasty. oh and the health inspector in san francisco is a fucking joke so pick your dining destinations carefully.
author: nate C.

description: i normally don't go to restaurants that cost this much so my experience in this kind of service is very limited.  our server was fantastic and the crab was excellent, but my main course didn't really work.  i was curious about how lobster, steak and foie gras would taste together and i found out it wasn't that great.  but still damn good if you aren't paying.
author: Markus B.

description: Farallon has to be one of the most beautiful restaurants in San Francisco. Having staff who have the expertise to advise the patrons is very valuable, however there is a fine line between advising in a helpful way and being patronizing. Farallon tends to cross the line into condescension. I was embarrassed to witness my boss, who is very cultured and European, get talked down to by the sommelier and then by the waiter when ordering his wine and then his steak.  The food is usually very good, however on this visit, I ordered the Ahi tuna that is served seared and rare in the center, which I would normally like. In this case, the kitchen did not cut the fish properly. The connective tissue was impossible to cut, and I had to leave a good portion on the plate after struggling with my knife and fork. In essence, a good restaurant, but some things need to be tweaked.  For the prices they charge, one expects a better level of service and proper food preparation.
author: Karyn W.

description: You can always count on Farallon for a beautiful meal in a beautiful atmosphere, with excellent service.  The decor is truly outstanding, you cannot do justice to it trying to describe it here, it is a must see.  The fish dishes are always outstanding, as is the service.  Every time I've been here it's been outstanding, I would go more but it is not cheap.
author: Grace R.

description: maybe it's not the local destination it once was, but this place can still hold its won.  something still mystical about the joint after more than a decade.  stand up dishes, wine and service.
author: e w.

description: dine here for my friends and i joint bday celebration, the place was nice, my food was ok, i had scallops for entree w/c is delish...but the side w/c is some kinda beans and mushrooms was very salty so i just avoid it...oh we order some appetizer and one of them have some artificial seafood, not good at all...the dessert was alright, service was ok, the best part was the wine, they have the best selection, we order a bottle of Dönnhoff white wine, it was the best! overall experience was good.
author: Jo Z.

description: The room at Farallon remains one of the real treats of the city, but the meal I had there the other night was one of the worst seafood meals I've had in years. I ordered "Dourade", which turned out to be a sand dab sized fish burnt to a crisp over a couple of ravioli and artichoke hearts. This set me back $37. Not worth it by any means. Also, the menu was far more limited than I remember--only 4 fish choices. Service and wine list were excellent as always, but the quality of food here has dropped off significantly since my last visit. Need a new chef, menu, or something.
author: frank r.

description: I'm convinced I was a mermaid in one of my past lives because anything that comes out of the ocean has a 99.9% chance of being devoured by me.  I come here about once a year and I come with a mission.  I invite a friend to come along and help me plough through the ROYAL PLATTER!  this $110 dollar platter has everything you could possibly want from a raw bar.  Huge shrimp, crawfish, crab, lobster, raw clams, oysters, ceviche, tuna tartare....oh my goodness my panties get wet just thinking about it.  I love to sit in the back room even though it's a bit noisy because it's where all the action happens. You get to watch the kitchen staff do their magic.  I think the service here is impeccable, and makes it worth spending $300 for a meal without the pretentiousness that places like Aqua have.  I have no problem throwing down some skrilla for a good meal, but I have a major problem with service that comes with an attitude. I've ordered other things here before, but mainly I recommend the royal platter and their desserts.
author: Jade L.

description: Farallon is by far one of my favorite restaurants in San Francisco! I live just a few blocks away from this spot and about once a month I get the itch to wander in and feast on a variety of immaculate sea food dishes! Forget going to the Warf or the Pier for sea food, Farallon is where it's at. The waiters are always extremely kind and eager to help a patron out whether it be finding the perfect wine match for your meal or educating you on how the flavors in a particular dish titillate your taste buds. My personal favorite experiences here have been sitting at the bar, snacking on a variety of appetizers and guzzling down oyster shooters made with tequila rather than vodka. The decor of this spot is spectacular; it makes you feel as if you are sitting in an elegant underwater world. I would recommend Farallon to anyone looking for great sea food in a fine dinning setting who is not afraid to spend a little bit of money!
author: Bri C.

description: amazing dining room, and the food is just to die for.  the seafood is fresh and the wine list is amazing.  Its a bit pricey, but well worth the dough, if you have the special occasion that you need to take your significant or family to.
author: matt j.

description: the old tile work in the dining room is worth five stars alone, add consistently good food and farallon is the perfect SF restaurant - I have absolutely no complaints eating here - I am happy as a clam.
author: Sophie A.

description: What decor! We returned here after the reno in 2000. It use to be open for lunch, but no longer. We have always enjoyed eating and entertaining there. Our east coast friends are never disappointed due in part to the underwater feeling. If you only have time for a drink and appetizer it is still rewarding.
author: elizabeth d.

description: This was by far one of the best meals I have eaten in a long time.  It was my graduation dinner, and I will say that I had the best service because I knew our server.  Next time anyone decides to try Farallon, please ask for Marla.  She is so knowledgeable and will guide you through your entire meal.  My boyfriend and stepdad had three different types of oysters and they loved every single slurp!  The feta croquette salad was amazing, I wish I could have that every single day...I would be happy.  I have never tasted octopus before, and I really had no desire.  However my boy order the octopus carpacchio and I must say, it was quite tasty.
