For my entree I enjoyed the char, and I have to say one of the best parts of the meal was dessert.  I had the cheese plate.  I ordered 3 and I was given 6!  I am a cheese lover so as you can imagine I was in heaven!  Thanks Marla and Farallon for making my graduation dinner so special and memorable.  I intend to come back that for sure!
author: Samantha R.

description: The decor is amusing for sure and lovely too.  The food is really good, interesting and unique but not always I have to say.  I had teh ambrosia salad.  The lemon ice was an interesting touch but you end up with cantaloupe soup if you don't eat it quickly.   The crab salad was nice but not sure it was anything more than crab. what about seasoning etc?  I like simple but simple can be outstanding.
author: Misti L.

description: Among the four of us, the best dishes were: cider braised Duroc pork belly, Mediterranean octopus confit, Nantucket Bay scallops & lobster, and the red wine braised beef short ribs. You'll get a kick out of the fantastic oceanic-themed decor: hand-blown jellyfish lamps, sea-urchin ceiling light fixtures, tentacles wrapped around the bar, etc. Lots of people dressed in cocktail dresses and what not, but also plenty of people wearing polo shirts and khaki type outfits. Kind of loud and noisy, but the hostess accommodated my request for one of the high-backed booths, and that helped with the noise level somewhat.
author: A. T.

description: the decor here is quite funky - kinda makes you feel you are underwater.  i thought the food was good but for those prices, i rather try out some other places in the city.
author: Dorothy L.

description: Exquisite food and atmosphere, and the service is 5-star +  The menu is pricey and the portions are fair, but not huge, but overall an amazing expierence.  If you are looking for a VERY nice seafood restaurant in the SanFran area I would highly recommend....
author: Brad T.

description: It was good, but not good enough to justify the price.  I've come away with a wow feeling from places half as expensive, and I just didn't get that here.  It's a great expensive date place, but that's about it.  I'd go back, but I wouldn't be the one planning it!
author: Chris C.

description: new to the area but if this is the quality i am to expect here in San Francisco then I am absolutely delighted.  Oysters were the freshest ever.....seafood remarkable - i'll definitely be back for a longer and leisurely dinner.
author: Joan M.

description: Martini was well made and the oysters fresh, but could not get over the plastic sea motifs all over the place.   You know that pirate ship restaurant in Disneyland?   Decor-wise, it kind of felt like an upscale version for adults.  As I don't like overtly themed restaurants the feel of the place kind of bugged me, especially as an upscale place, but ok otherwise from what I know of the drink and oysters.
author: Missy L.

description: Walked in very impressed with the ambiance. However, food and service did not live up to our expectations...which were based on several strong recommendations.  Don't hate us because we are from Chicago, but our seafood was bland and my Sole was just bland fish and chips.  But, the Carrot Cake dessert was amazinggg.  The place is cool...and maybe there are better things to order then the waiters rec of Sole and Scallops.  Wine was delicious.
author: natalie m.

description: Way over rated.... over priced food that one can get at a hotel restaurant. Really nothing special. Was really hoping to like it. Nice decor, good service, food was disappointing.
author: Alex L.

description: The decor of the restaurant is very fun and the upstairs balcony is especially cozy.  The host was very friendly and nice but the rest of the staff was very cold and stiff.  Our waiter had absolutely no personality at all. The menu has a very large selection. The seared foie gras was amazing. As for the entreee and dessert it was good but nothing outstanding. Overall I think Farallon is a very good restaurant but still a bit overated and overpriced. I left a little disappointed.
author: eric b.

description: Lawd, where to start with how good this meal was. Made me sign up with Yelp to tell you. Letting the host know it was the first time for my parents visiting SF, we were sat in one of the grand booths that made us feel like royalty. The waiter seemed to know each dish personally and lead us through a tour of amazing tastes starting with the seafood platter that included the best lobster I have ever tasted. Everything so fresh and delicately prepared. And the wine steward, paired us with wine that perfectly suited the meal and without any heavy handed guiding towards expense. And then there was the 4 courses and amuse bouche - which it was. We left so full and happy as I am sure you will too.
author: dominic p.

description: I think this place was fine. I was expecting better and have only gone there once. The food was fine, I don't think on the same level as the other fine restaurants in SF but if you're looking for a good place for business dinner, it is ok.
author: Nadeem R.

description:
1)  receptionists are not helpful and attentive.  expect the same service quality you would get in any government agency

2)  the ground floor dining area is noisy.  not recommended for romantic dinner.  the upper floor is not open.  we waited 25 mintues in the bar even we made a reservation.  don't expect request such as "quiet seating for two" would be honored.

3)  my server is very nice.  not too aggressive and passive.  too bad i didn't ask for his name.  he is a guy wearing glasses in 30's.

4)  the food is so-so.

5)  overall, i would not recommend it even if you need to pay out from your own pocket.
author: gordon c.

description:
perfect!  

since valentines day is coming up. i  thhough i would write my experience from last year! which was perfect! go here!!!
author: Nicolette E.

description: Wonderful!  No extra words are necessary to describe this place.  The decor is beautiful but not overwhelming - creating a comfortable and cozy (if you sit upstairs) dining atmosphere.  Seafood is always top notch, although other items are quite good as well.  Desserts always impress.  Although there are numerous top restaurants in SF, Farallon deserves 5 stars because it is consistent.  I have been here many times over several years and it never disappoints.
author: Eric W.

description: I had the MOST amazing wine paring 5 course dinner here!  Definitely for a special occasion, but soooo yummy.
author: Lauren F.

description: I've eaten her twice the last two years and loved it each time. I liked the environment for a nice date and the food was incredible. The staff was very helpful and knowlegable in our selection of oysters. The appetizers, entrees, and desserts were all great. This is my favorite seafood reataurant in SF and will continue to go back annually at least.
author: Rob P.

description: Famous for their seafood selection, a restaurant that has a very nice decor.  I had the salmon which was average.  The French Onion Soup doesn't quite have enough cheese, but overall flavor is ok.  The only thing with this restaurant is that nothing really stands out in the flavors.  The service was great but a little better than the food.  I would still give this 3-4 stars as I am very critical and have high standards.
author: Alex K.

description: cool looking place, the tables and seats are really small (nothing for big people), a bit expensive, service is average for the price, food is excellent
author: Cianna X.

description: Go somewhere else for you special occasion.  I just got home from an incredibly mediocre/poor dinner here.  Lobster claws and sardines to start were fine.  I don't know how you'd mess up a steamed lobster though.  Sardines were under-seasoned.  I had the Dorade, which was good, not great.  My parents both had the beef cheeks, which were all jacked up.  I finally got my Dad to send them back.  The entree is almost $40, it shouldn't be tough, crispy burnt (how did they even cook this thing) and impossible to cut.  The waitress sort of lectured my Dad that he should've sent it back immediately and was quite rude even though he was extremely apologetic and clearly uncomfortable sending it back.  This was not a $15 entree, this restaurant is in the Michelin Guide for God's sake, you should give a crap if you're serving, well, crap.  She did bring him the bass in exchange, which was sadly under-seasoned again.   On the up side, the sommelier was fantastic and thank god, we had good wine to pull us through.
author: Deidre A.

description: wow, this place is amazing... the interior is fantastic ... my husband brought me here for our first anniversary, and wow.  i felt like such a princess.  my only complaint is we were seated in the bar area right by the door and it was on the noisy side.  my husband had the lobster bisque and the salmon and i had the scallops and duck.  the salmon was the best i think i have ever tasted, al dente in the middle, soft and fluffy and delicious.  and the scallops, my husband doesnt like scallops, and i love them... these were so good even he was stealing bits. and the duck, oooo the duck.  this duck was perfect, med-rare, tender and rich with candies cherries and wild rice crepes.  the chocolate pudding is more of a pot de creme and is also fantastic. with appetizers and main course, half a bottle of wine, dessert with port and tequila it was $100 a person.  yipe.  a total splurge but very worth it for both the excellent food and the wonderful ambiance.
author: rachel a.

description: This really is about as good as dining gets. We went for a special occasion to celebrate (my birthday) and had 4 courses that complimented each other so well.  The decor was lovely.  It had an antiquey elegant sea theme that wasn't overdone and not understated either.  I couldn't stop looking at the light fixtures.  It was one of the best special occasion meals I've ever had.  I especially enjoyed that it didn't feel packed the way some restaurants can get.  Even though every table was occupied they were well spaced so you didn't get stuck rubbing elbows with strangers or trying to talk over other people's conversations who are too darn close to your table.  I would give it even more stars for the intimacy, noise level and lighting if I could.  That's just want makes a nice restaurant in my opinion - quiet enough to feel comfortable but still lively enough not to feel like you're completely alone.  They were also good enough to accommodate us when we called to say we were running late due to traffic.  Overall this is an experience to remember and a class act of a restaurant.  The price is steep but worth it for special occasions.
author: Natalie B.
